Another important point is that you do not have to tell anyone where you are or what you are doing because you are old and you do not depend on your parents.

Also, another important point in the life of a young or old person is responsibility. If you are young, you will always have school, and that is a big responsibility, but if you are old, you can just do whatever you want and you only have to worry about yourself.

The last and most important point is money. When you are young, you have your parents, and they are the only ones who worry about the economy. However, you will not have everything you want only because it is not your money; it is their money, so if you want to buy something they do not want, you just cannot buy it.

In conclusion, the life for old people was, is, and will always be better, and if you are young, you can enjoy, but not as much as you want. But you can also wait until you grow up and become an old man.

Last year, my girlfriend and I went to the Disneyland of Hong Kong led by a group. After the whole trip, we found that we did not have many memories about the Disneyland because the group gave us such a hurried travel that we even did not have enough time to take a few more pictures. As a result, I decided to have my tourism with my tour guide forever.

There are several reasons that helped me make the decision. Firstly, some people stand on the ground that group travel is much more economical than being led by a tour guide. As far as I am concerned, it is questionable. The tour guide you employ is not very expensive, and the guy will give you much more than your imagination. It is a dream place that does not appear on your tourism book. At the same time, you will have enough time to take photos and breathe the air of freedom from your city. We spend our money to enjoy our life, but in the tour group, we just keep moving to another place when we do not recognize what we have seen here. It is a real waste of our money and our life in my eyes.

Secondly, we can find ourselves by the tour guide. In the group, we are the workers; we must listen to this, listen to that. We spend our money to enjoy our life; we do not need a leader to have a tourism. It is no longer our office. There is no boss! The nature and we are here! That is the true life; we are the leaders of our life, we are the leaders of the tourism. Where I want to go, I make the decision.

Thirdly, perhaps traveling in a group is more safe; we can face the problem together, which happens in our tourism. But we should know that everyone of us should be brave to face any challenge in our life. To solve the problem is one part of the tourism that we really appreciate. And you have a tour guide who will help anytime, because we are the boss. We spend our money and time to enjoy our life, to enjoy the problems.

From what we discussed above, we can safely draw the conclusion that although the advantages of traveling in a group will bring safety and relatively economical benefits, they cannot compete with the true life of tourism led by a tour guide when its responsibility is taken into deliberation. So pack yourself up. Now, enjoy our life!

The success of people is strictly related to the level of risk taken. The real success is the materialization of people's ability to differentiate themselves from others. A good example of a success story could be Steve Jobs' adventure in the technological world. Steve Jobs, the father and creator of Apple company, knew very well that to be a successful man, you must take some risks and try to do things differently from your competitors.

As Professor Porter says, the real and most valuable competitive advantage for a company, but at the same time for a person, is the ability to be different. Being different does not mean only doing new things; being different could be doing old things but in a different way.

Every time we try to do new things, we take more risks at the same time, but to be successful, we must be able to evaluate the different risks and figure out what could be our return, and what or to what measure the failure could affect our life.

Then, from my point of view, success is related to a multiple series of different factors: the ability to create, to imagine, or to perform something differently from other people; a predisposition to risk, in other words, it could be very difficult to reach success if the subject is risk-averse; but at the same time, it is very important to have the ability to measure this risk and create different scenarios to be able to predict what could happen if everything takes the wrong path.

Returning to the Steve Jobs example, what signed the success of Apple company was the visionary ability of Jobs in figuring out what would distinguish a product like the iPod from a different MP3 device. He chose an innovative path, calculated and evaluated the risks correlated with his ideas, and, reaching some failures, taking some losses, he finally succeeded with his device.

Then, when someone has success, it is at last because they were able to understand and learn from their failures and errors, which could derive from trying to be different and taking some risks.

Success, in my opinion, is the prize reserved for those who have the courage to be like no others.

Michael Jordan succeeded as an amazing NBA basketball player, just as much as Tom Cruise succeeded as one of the most popular actors in Hollywood. They both became well-known people, however, they are known for different reasons and talents. This shows that people are good at different things, and focusing on their best talent is the key to success. I disagree with the statement that it is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject. Specializing in one specific subject is a more definite way to succeed, it lets you focus better, and it is less stressful.

One reason to support my opinion is that specializing in one specific subject is a more definite way to succeed in the future. I feel that having a more broad knowledge of many academic subjects only helps you in your childhood. Trying to earn good grades in all of the classes you are taking may be the pressure for thinking that it is better to have a broad knowledge. Having a broad knowledge may also set you off to find what you are good at. However, I believe that what is most important is what you become as, and working hard on what you are good at would actually get you somewhere in life.

Another reason why I feel that specializing in one subject is better than to have a broad knowledge of various subjects is so you could focus better. Trying hard on one subject when you know you have to focus on another one could be distracting. I feel that working hard for one subject would let you concentrate better.

Finally, I feel that it is less stressful to specialize in one subject. For example, I believe that it is difficult for someone to be good in both writing and mathematics. I believe that people usually do not like what they are not good at. If there are subjects that you would prefer not to take, because you know that you are not good at, you should rather work hard in a subject you know you like to do. My friend who is very talented in arts is unfortunately not very talented in mathematics. So, what she does is that she does not take any mathematics classes. In conclusion, I feel that specializing in one specific subject rather than having a broad knowledge of many academic subjects would lead you to a happier life.

I do agree with the statement that 'successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.' Successful people usually come from many failures and risks, and after overcoming all these situations, they gain success. So, those people have a clear idea about how to tackle or overcome risks and problems. The person who is usually successful prefers gaining more success from more new things or the things with which they are unfamiliar.

And in order to try new things, they never hesitate, whereas the person who is usually at a non-success stage fears trying new things. There are many examples that support this answer. For instance, in the construction field, people usually succeed in the field of constructing huge buildings, dams, towers, and flyovers, which is usually a risky factor at those times. Because they have succeeded in their field, they are trying for more new things, like going for more huge or enormous works, which is also a bit kind of risky. Because the construction field people know a lot about their work and the failures they will meet in achieving things, they try to solve them in a more logical manner or, say, in a planned order.

Not only in the construction field, but we can also look at other fields, like the most happening scientists' field, where they try only for new things rather than going for the known ones. Scientists always think of inventing new things. If they had thought that they can't take risks in inventing anything, which we have now, then we couldn't get many luxuries and also disease-preventing medicines for many hazardous diseases, which are usually harmful to humans.

When we go for new things, then only we get new things in our day-to-day life, which are becoming part of our daily life now-a-days and also daily routines. Hence, in this fast-moving world, successful people should try for new things and should take the risks to become more successful, rather than sticking to only doing what they already know how to do well.

I think that for a student, both understanding ideas and concepts and learning facts are very important. But I don't agree that ideas and concepts are more important than learning facts. The following reasons support my idea: first of all, it is useless if we understand a lot of concepts and ideas and we don't use them to learn facts. I want to say that learning concepts is a very important thing if we are able to use those concepts to do useful things. Therefore, learning new concepts is very important, but also we must learn from facts to see how those concepts are used.

For example, I am a university student, and every day, during the lessons, I learn a lot of concepts. But I study in a technical university, therefore, for me, it is very important to gain a lot of experience to improve my preparation in a particular subject. Furthermore, it's very important to learn facts, because they can always come in useful in the future. The second reason that pushes me to think in this way is that if we only understand ideas and concepts, we will not understand completely how those concepts work. I want to say that there are a lot of things that we can learn only from facts and experience. I think that a student has a good preparation about a particular subject if he learns both concepts and experience. In fact, in a lot of companies, if a person wants to gain an advancement, he must have a lot of experience and a lot of knowledge.

I agree with this statement. I think that young people enjoy life more than older people. There are two reasons. One reason is that young people are more active than older people. Also, the other one is that young people have new ideas for life.

First of all, young people are more active than older people. It's because young people can engage in more activities than older people. However, older people can't engage in as many activities as young people. It's because older people don't have enough energy to sustain activities for a long time.

Secondly, young people have new ideas for enjoying life. For example, there are festivals in life. Young people can open up their ideas for festivals. It's because young people can think of interesting ideas.

In conclusion, young people can enjoy life.

Many people have the problem of not knowing what to do regarding the subjects they can choose from in a university. Should they take their time to study many academic subjects or should they specialize in one specific subject?

The first positive point of choosing many academic subjects is that you have a broad knowledge of many different things. That makes you more flexible when you look for a new job and also gives you more flexibility in many other situations. The second positive fact is that you are able to talk about many different topics, which can help you to increase your relationships with others. If a person talks about various topics, you are able to enter the conversation because of the fact that you have more knowledge about different things. You are able to talk about many different things than a person who just studies one specific subject.

To specialize in one specific subject has many positive benefits. First of all, people who take many courses do not have specific knowledge about a certain subject. People who specialize in one subject are more professional and therefore able to answer more specific questions because they have more knowledge. They are also able to use their knowledge to solve higher-level problems. Another positive fact is that companies always need professional people who have a lot of knowledge in a specific area. Therefore, people are better paid than people who are not so professional.

I strongly believe that it is better to have more knowledge about a specific subject. You are more able to solve complex problems and you are also able to answer more specific questions. In addition, people with more knowledge about a topic are more likely to get more money from companies because they need professional people.

Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well for many reasons. 

First, trying new things gives you an opportunity to learn more. For example, learning to drive can make you focus more and see more. 

In addition, you can be more experienced when you take the risk and try new things. The more you try, the more you get the feeling that you have no limitations in what you can do, and the more experienced you get. 

Let's take the CEOs of big companies, for example. If they did not try new things and did not take risks, they definitely would not be where they are now. 

Third, trying new things and taking risks makes you more ready to solve problems. 

On the other hand, not having the guts to try new things and take risks could result in being in the same position for a long time, if not forever. You will do your thing right, but you will do it forever. 

In conclusion, don't limit yourself, don't underestimate yourself, go out there and try new things and take the risk.

I agree with the statement that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are. There are two reasons to support my opinion. The first reason why most advertisements make products seem better is that the most important thing is to sell more products in terms of the producers. In selling products, advertisements are very important because there are many products of the same kind in the world today. In this situation, attractive advertisements are indispensable to compete with products from other companies. Let's take cell phones, for example. There are many companies producing cell phones all over the world, and each company also provides many different types. Last year, I lost a cell phone and decided to buy a new one. I was at a loss as to what to buy, and I finally bought one with the most attractive advertisements in a store. After I used it for a while, I easily found that it was difficult for me to use it because of many unnecessary accessory functions. I usually use cell phones only as a mobile telephone, and so I do not need a function of taking a picture. Therefore, I really found that it is important to discern the advertisements more carefully. The second reason is that the producers partly believe that the real quality of the products is first known after many people use them. In this regard, producers are eager to sell the products in the first place. They consider the problems of the products after the consumers claim to them. It is not really a good attitude, but this idea is also rampant and is derived from the idea that selling products is the most important thing for producers, as I mentioned in the first reason. However, society has changed its regard of a recall movement, so this attitude becomes riskier and riskier in the developed countries. In summary, I agree with the opinion that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

``People try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.'' I agree with this statement because by trying new things, we can learn a lot and become famous in what we are doing.

By trying new things, we can know something new and discover new things. For some people, after taking a lot of risks, they may not get success and so they go on with their same work. I don't agree with this statement because without trying new things, we cannot move forward.

For example, if a country is a developing country, it will remain a developing country forever if they don't try new things and make their country a developed country.

Another example, if a person wants to become a top ranker or become an engineer, he needs to take a lot of risks to reach his destiny by trying different things, thinking differently, and working on it. I think it will definitely give success to the person.

An example for which I disagree with the statement is if a person is not working hard or not trying anything different, then definitely he will not reach his goal and he cannot be a successful person.

Similarly, take Sachin Tendulkar, he was very poor in studies and was very much interested in cricket. His father took a lot of risks and started practicing cricket with him rather than giving coaching in regular studies. So, because of taking a lot of risks and trying new things, now we have a world-class cricketer, and India is very proud to have such a player.

So, all this happened just because of taking risks and trying new things rather than continuing with the known work.

So, finally, I say, ``The people who try different and like to take risks rather than doing the same work will definitely get success and stand on top of all.''

Advertisements, many factories and companies make advertisements to let people know about their new products. Sometimes they say true things about their products, and sometimes they say wrong things, so how can we know the truth?

First of all, we can know if a product is good or not by asking people who have tried it. For example, if your cousin sees on TV an advertisement about a machine that is useful, let's say it's a sports machine. As we know, on TV, they will say a lot of things about it that will make people like it and buy it without wondering how much it costs. So, your cousin buys it. Then, you hear about this machine and you are wondering if it's good, because if it's good, you will buy it. So, you make up your mind to ask your cousin about it. Unfortunately, he/she tells you that it's not good and it broke on the first day.

So, when you hear this, surely you will decide not to buy it. So, it's a way to know if the product you hear about in an advertisement is worth buying or not.

Second, if you really like a product that you saw in an advertisement, why don't you buy it? You won't lose anything; try it. Perhaps it will be better than you thought. Everything is possible, but be sure of what you are doing, and try not to lose so much money on things you don't need. Just buy the things you really need.

To sum up, advertisements will be useful in many times because they will let you know about new products that you have been searching for a long time, and then you will find them in an easy way. So, you should be up to date with new advertisements because sometimes they're good.

The issue that will be discussed here is whether young people nowadays give enough time to helping their communities or not. Some might say that young people are more educated today to be ever aware of the problems in their community and more enthusiastic to help. While, on the other hand, some might say that young people today are too busy in their own life setup to look beyond it and help their communities. Well, I would agree with the first set of people who think that young people nowadays take out enough time to help their communities.

Firstly, the reason I think that the young crowd nowadays gives enough time to help their communities is that they are more educated and are aware of the problems that lie in their community, in which they have grown, more than the young people of the generation before this. Let's take an example of a young man who has faced difficulties in his childhood because of a lack of good schools in his village. Now that he has somehow managed to get an education and get a good job in a multinational company, he knows the benefits of good educational facilities. He knows, with his experience and exposure to the world, that his village can grow and develop if the children can get good education. So, he would take out time to put conscious efforts into the development of his village.

Secondly, taking the same example of this young man who is employed in a good company, he also earns well compared to the young people before. He has enough money to help the people in his community and the will to change the infrastructure to facilitate the younger generation in their development.

Finally, I believe that the younger generation today is more enthusiastic and filled with more zest to take out extra time to change the conditions existing in their community and help the people who need it. The education system today has changed, teaching more moral values and inculcating a sense of responsibility in the younger generation to help their community and their country. The young people today have learned to prioritize their work and have become more effective in managing their time.

So, I think that today's generation is more effective in helping their community.

The topic under discussion is whether most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are or not. I agree with the opinion that advertisements make products look much better than what they actually are.

The widespread growth of communication media, such as television, newspapers, the internet, and various other choices, has led to an outright growth in the propaganda of any item. People come to know about any new product in the market through any of these media.

The mindset of people has changed variably in the sense that they have shifted their focus from buying required products to those advertised by celebrities. Gone are the days when people used to go outdoor shopping to get the required products. The new era has just begun through internet shopping, which reduces the burden of going out and shopping. People can sit in their homes, and if they find something interesting in the advertisements, they opt to buy it through the internet.

The previous notion of buying a product based on its requirement and merit has totally changed. People have changed their mindset to buy products that seem appealing and interesting in the advertisements.

As an example, consider the good old days when there were not many advertisements for a product. People used to get a clear understanding of the product they were buying and then opt for it. Nowadays, the scenario has changed, where people buy a product only because their favorite celebrity has advertised that product.

Furthermore, people are more interested in buying an item their neighbor has just bought. They consider themselves one step higher than them and buy that product, even if it is irrelevant to them. In this way, mouth-to-mouth media creates problems.

These advertisements nowadays make products look much more valuable than what they really are. Going through various advertisements provided through the communication media and opting to buy a product is not a wise decision. These advertisements generally hype the product. One comes to know the seriousness of the mistake they have committed in opting for the product with the only impression of the advertisements when they receive the original product. Next time, they might be careful enough in selecting the products to buy.

So, in my opinion, it is always better to select a product based on its merit rather than following the advertisements and selecting the product.

I agree with this statement. I think that young people enjoy life more than older people do for many reasons. The old people have to think about some problems that young people do not have to think about. For example, an old person has to think about their work and their family. When a person has a family, they have to think about their children, but the children do not have to think about anything because there are their parents who think for them.

I am 23 years old, and I know the difference between when I was 10 years old and now. Now, I have to think about many things that I did not have to think about when I was 10 years old. Now, I live alone and I have to do all the things that I did not do before. For example, now I have to cook because there is no one to do it for me. In addition, I have to buy my food and wash my clothes.

On the other hand, when I was a young child, I thought about playing with my friends. I liked to play football, and I played football with my friends for many hours each day. In addition, I went to the swimming pool with my friends and stayed there all afternoon. At the swimming pool, I played volleyball with my friends, and we were very happy.

Now, I cannot do what I did when I was young because now I have to go to work and I do not have enough time to play football and go to the swimming pool.

At the end, I agree with the statement above because when I was young, I enjoyed life more than I do now. I think that young age is the most beautiful period of life that a person can live, and I am sure that there are many other people who think this.

I clearly disagree with the fact that the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide. I will explain why around three main points.

First of all, in my opinion, I truly think that trip preparation is a complete part of the travel experience. If you follow a group led by a tour guide, you will not be able to discover the country or city you will visit in advance. Reading the Lonely Planet, spending hours on Google, watching for some advice on the best places to go is a great time.

Secondly, in a group led by a tour guide, you have to follow. For me, it means that you are not free to do what you want, when you want. The worst thing is that they tell you when you have free time! In a trip, I go through a lot of different moods. Sometimes I like moving quickly from one place to another, but sometimes, and it happens quite often, it is real pleasure to relax, take time, and enjoy the moment. From my point of view, it's essential to follow our rhythm.

Last but not least, the departure and return flights are most of the time scheduled in the middle of the night and in unknown airports. We all know that tour guides want to reduce costs and get better rentability. That is the reason why they prefer to choose big airplane charters with small seats to put more people in them. In addition, they use small airports, which are clearly cheaper. The travel becomes painful, and it affects your trip appreciation.

That is why I disagree with the idea that the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide. There are many other ways to have a better time in a trip than this one.

In my opinion, I think it is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than the other. The reason why I prefer this one is that if someone is specialized in one specific subject, I think this person is quite a boring person. Let's say he knows very well about the animals in the sea, and whenever you meet with him, he talks only about things that he is good at and nothing else. As I am a listener, I would have a very boring time.

On the other hand, if you have broad knowledge of many academic subjects, people who talk with you think that you are very smart. You don't have to talk that much, but a little bit of information about many things is all you need. Usually, listeners don't try to argue with you, unless they are professionals in what you are talking about.

Of course, it is also good to specialize in one specific subject, especially if you are a teacher or doctor, anyone who teaches or gives advice. Then, the one specific subject would be very valuable.

Actually, both personalities are valuable and better than knowing nothing, because you know something at least. I had one friend who was usually quiet. But when I let him talk about cars, he didn't stop talking until I changed the topic. He was so interested in cars and he liked to spend his time on cars.

Do you want to live a successful life? If you want to make it possible, I think you'd better try new things than old things that are too common and outdated. In my opinion, most people who live successfully have tried new things and taken risks. There are two reasons to express my opinion.

Firstly, it is true that normal people do normal things, live normal lives, and love normal things. According to what successful people say, however, they were willing to take risks to succeed. People should not copy and repeat something because sometimes that something needs to be changed. We should create new things that will make us live new lives and better lives.Secondly, maybe all of us know the sentence 'life is a venture.' It is so famous a sentence that we could have heard before. But the case that it comes true is very rare because people are afraid that they could make a mistake in trying new ventures. But I think avoiding ventures to keep them from failing is the worst thing in your whole life. You don't have to be frustrated even though you fail to try something new. It will give you an experience. This invaluable experience will help you to succeed in other things. It is so invaluable that you may not want to change to other things.

In conclusion, there are a number of opportunities in the world. Some people can see and catch these possibilities, but others can't see that they would miss these things. You have to take these opportunities in your life. In this modern society, it is so important to be a creative person. Society wants that kind of people, so we should have courage and keep going for new things.

Today, to move, people in general use their cars. The number of cars is always increasing, but on the other hand, the price of cars and oil is also increasing. On one hand, some people think that in twenty years, they will use fewer cars than there are today. Indeed, having a car is becoming more and more expensive. On earth, there is less and less oil, so the price increases a lot, and not all people can afford it. Moreover, in the biggest cities, common transportation will be very developed, like in Paris, where the government is creating new bus routes. They want Paris to become a city with no cars. Indeed, some people think we need to stop using cars because of the increase in pollution.

On the other hand, cars are the best way to move. Indeed, with cars, you can go everywhere and whenever you want. You do not have to wait like with buses and subways. Maybe the price of oil will increase, however, all governments are trying to find a solution. For example, in France, the government wants to introduce a new oil product made from cereals. This oil is already used in some countries like Brazil, where many cars use this oil, and where the oil is less expensive than in France. Moreover, this vegetable oil can stop pollution in the biggest cities. And finally, with a car, people can do what they want, just like at home. They can choose the radio station they want to listen to, they can smoke, they can make phone calls.

According to me, common transportation can develop a lot again. But with new technologies, all people would like to have their own cars, and I think that in twenty years, there will be more cars in use than there are today.

Yes, I agree with this statement: 'In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.' At present, technology has improved. At the same time, car models have increased. In the past, there were only two or three models of cars available. But currently, there are numerous models of cars, and with technology, cars are being manufactured with safety features. These features will keep people safe even if an accident occurs.

For example, in olden days, there was no facility to watch television or listen to music in a car; it was used only for traveling purposes. But currently, by reading a newspaper, we can drive a car; that's how much technology has improved. If a car has an accident, there is no harm to human beings because all safety features have been arranged in the car. The old cars polluted the climate significantly by emitting smoke. However, present cars use gas instead of petrol or diesel, which will reduce climate pollution. In the past, this facility was not available. Different cars have different technologies. At present, the population has also increased, and at the same time, the usage of cars has also increased.

Finally, I conclude that in twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today. At present, technology-driven cars have good sales in the market.

I fundamentally agree with the statement that many advertisements make products seem better than they really are. However, we should not ignore the benefits of advertisements for this reason.

To begin with, I admit that most advertisements do some exaggerations on the products. It is also the reason why manufacturers are so fascinated in making advertisements. The ads arouse our interests by demonstrating how excellent the products are. For example, we can always see the ads for hair cleaning products on TV. Some models or famous stars come out to show their extremely shiny and smooth hair, and they tell us that the special product is the reason for their beautiful hair. It is really attractive. But when we buy the product from the market and use it, we will find that the result is not as good as they claim in the ad. From this aspect, we are cheated by the ads.

However, various advertisements play significant roles in our life. On the one hand, we can receive some introductions and suggestions from them. Imagine when we are shopping in the supermarket, we must face thousands of brands. There would even be hundreds of kinds of soft drinks. If we know nothing about the products, we must spend a lot of time on selection. With different ads, the situation changes. We must be aware of several brands of the soft drinks, then we can choose from this small range. On the other hand, advertisement has become a big industry. Both customers and manufacturers need the ads firms. And these firms supply a large number of job opportunities for our society every year. Therefore, the advertisements are necessary for us.

Last but not least, the qualities and services determine the products' fates ultimately, not the ads. We customers may be cheated once, but not always. Besides, not every product is bad. The famous and lasting brands in most fields are good enough for the customers, in fact. As this reason, I think it is acceptable when some advertisements exaggerate the benefits of the products.

Based on the above reasons, I believe that advertisements would serve good functions to our society, although they sometimes make the products seem better than they really are.

I agree with this speech that young people nowadays do not give time to helping their communities. The life has changed from the past; I mean, everything has become faster and faster in this life. Everyone is busy with their own life.

First of all, young people are busy with their studies and their own life. In the past, young people did not worry about their studies. However, now they worry a lot about their studies and they want to be something in their society.

Next, young people have a lot of things they want to do. For example, they want to enjoy their free time with their friends. They want to go to the mall or visit some best friends. On the other hand, in the past, they had a lot of time to help their communities.

Finally, year after year, the young people will be more busy than now because of the technology, which develops year after year, and life will be more difficult. I think the young people should organize their time, and in this case, they can do what they want. Also, they can help their communities.

Young people enjoy life more than older people do; it's a very important issue to discuss as every age has its point of advantage to enjoy, and to what extent you believe that you are enjoying your life. Firstly, young people get the energy and spirit of taking risks to have fun or any kind of adventure, but they do not have enough time to do that because they have to work to earn money to survive and to achieve their goals.

But young people are very lucky because they have a lot of means to enjoy their life, for example, the computer, clubs, sports, and so on.

On the other hand, old people do not have enough power to practice any activity that needs effort or energy. Also, they have a numerous kind of diseases. One of the most serious problems they have is that they cannot deal with the new and modern equipment of entertainment. Secondly, money is the most great factor to enjoy your life as a tool to use to fulfill your satisfaction.

In spite of the fact that old people had enough money from their previous working life, young people can be more happy and enjoy their life with a very little amount of money.

Young people mean energy, hope, happiness, success, and life without deformation. To put it in a nutshell, I agree with the statement that young people enjoy life more than older people do. Young people are very lucky and get a very good chance to do everything they like to feel happy. The young people get everything in the new civilization to serve them and offer different ways to enjoy their life.

I totally agree with the statement that most advertisements make products more attractive to consumers than they actually are. Nowadays, it is very difficult to get a product that works exactly as it is promised to.

In a globalized, market-oriented world, it is difficult for manufacturers, companies, or retailers to launch a new product and compete successfully against other products. Therefore, marketers have to think of decent market strategies to get customers' awareness and interest. To be able to achieve this, promotion is needed, including advertisement.

Advertising enables the company to present its product and put an emphasis on its advantages. I certainly have the impression that it is almost presented in a propagandistic way. The most effective channels used for advertising are, on the one hand, wallpapers in the streets, which make use of visual effects, whereas TV advertisements are even more convincing as they additionally make use of sound effects.

So, if you are the target person and watch the advertising on TV, you go into the shop and buy the product. So, the marketer has partly achieved his aim by then. It is probably not his goal to see you unsatisfied, but most of the time, the consumer is. I often think about such a fake when I see an advertisement for McDonald's. Does the food not look so fresh and tasty? But what you eventually get looks and tastes different.

Nowadays, there is an interesting thing that a lot of new products are targeted at 'young people'. It seems like young people may enjoy their lives more than the older generation. Every one has his own value about life, and different values lead to a completely different way of life, so we cannot say who enjoys himself better.

Being full of experience, old people have a different thinking about life from the young people. Some old people who survived the Second World War can understand how important food or money is, so instead of wasting wealth on enjoying life, they choose to lead a quite simple life. But they never feel their lives are boring.

Second, young people have a strong willingness to show themselves to attract a boyfriend or a girlfriend. In order to be popular, young people may like to stay in pubs and bars, they drink, dance, and joke with each other. However, almost all older people have already found a companion, and fashion, cars are less important for them, even they do not want to live as the younger people. If it is not necessary, it doesn't make sense to the judgment that young people enjoy life better.

In addition, age may be very important in some cultures. For example, older people can control the younger one in China or Korea. In these countries, age can influence many things, especially when people are having fun. In these cultures, the society will provide more benefits to the old people. If Chinese people have a lot of food, the old one can obtain more. So it is not true that young people can enjoy their life better within a less supply.

In conclusion, old people are equal with the young people, that is why nobody argues about that at all.

Having broad knowledge of many academic subjects plays an essential role in our lives. Broad knowledge affects our analysis of events and determines how we think in certain situations. It is difficult to think about topics you have not heard before. You cannot even express your feelings without having knowledge about that topic. It is better to have broader knowledge of many academic subjects rather than to specialize in one subject. Specialization would restrict your worldview and also make it difficult to decide which subject to specialize in, thereby losing other opportunities.

Specialization should occur after acquiring broad knowledge of many academic subjects. For instance, I am studying International Relations, and my department underlines the importance of having broader knowledge. I could not just focus on the Cold War without having knowledge of the results of the First World War. Also, broad knowledge of many academic subjects will help you analyze events in different dimensions. With the broad knowledge I have, I can analyze the actions of states in different aspects.

In addition, if you specialize in one specific subject, you would not even know many things about other subjects. It seems dangerous. It is difficult to face a subject you do not have an opinion about. Also, examples can be given from daily life. For instance, you can be an excellent cook, but it would have no worth if you did not know how to wash the dishes. They complement each other. This is a simple example, but it reflects the importance of having broad knowledge.

Finally, with broad knowledge of many academic subjects, people will have the chance to see events in different perspectives, even when reading the newspaper; they can create strong relations with other events. Also, it is difficult to choose one important subject for specialization. Specialization can only be achieved after acquiring broad knowledge of many academic subjects, but broad knowledge cannot be achieved after specializing in one subject.

I agree with this statement that it is much better to have a broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject, because if you only know one way to a solution, sometimes you cannot be able to find a solution. So, it is very important to have a broad knowledge.

For example, if you are only able to write with your hands and are not used to writing on a PC, you will get into trouble in many situations in daily business life.

Another problem can be that if you are specialized and somebody wants to discuss a problem with you, which is also important for you to get aware of, but you cannot say anything because you do not understand what the problem means to others.

That is a big problem in our society, because everyone is kind of specialized in one's own life, and you often see only your problems, whether others have much more problems.

The next problem for specialized people is that they normally can only do one job in their whole life. I think that if you get rid of the job you do, it is much better to have the ability to change it, and that will be much easier with a broad knowledge.

But if you are specialized in one specific subject, it will be very hard to get another job without losing time by taking courses to improve one's knowledge. Not to forget the money you cannot earn in this period of time.

As a result, I would say that a broad knowledge gives you much more quality of life and a higher variety of jobs.

Before three years, I met with my friend who had finished his university a month prior to that time, and he was very sad because he didn't find a job in any company. When I asked him about the reason for that, and he had gotten excellent marks, he answered that all companies want different skills in the employee who will work with them. It is better to have broad knowledge to get a good job, a big salary, and a high position in any company. 

If you have different majors in your education or several areas of knowledge, you'll have a big chance to get a good job. For example, if you have an engineering major with some courses in computer science, you'll get a job faster than if you have just an engineering degree. Also, you'll work in a different department, and that will make your job more exciting. 

It's not hard to get a job, but to have a good salary is the hard thing. To improve your skills and to get a nice salary, you should be different from the other employees. A lot of people try to get one major in their education and then want to work; if you want to be different from the others, you have to get a broad range of knowledge. 

Not everyone can be a manager or an important one in his company. The manager has special properties than the others, more education, and strong behavior. We can get different education by having a broad range of knowledge. If you study different majors with different people, you'll get strong behavior. 

In conclusion, you can be an important person with a big salary in an excellent job if you have a broad range of knowledge and different areas of education. My friend also has known that.

The years give us intelligence most of the time. The statement, 'young people enjoy life more than older people,' is not always true; it depends on the style of life and personal habits.

For example, young people could be always enthusiastic, happy, friendly, and also serious and quiet. By the way, some young people cannot enjoy their lives, maybe because their lives could not be the best experience. In other words, maybe they do not have the opportunity to enjoy their parents, school, or wherever. In contrast, many old people enjoy their lives; most of them thought that their old age is the most beautiful form to accumulate experience. In this way, they have a lot of memories and experience.

In my opinion, my grandfather is an example that old people can enjoy life, same or more than young people.My grandfather is 86 years old and he decided to start living again when he was 75 years old, after my grandmother's death. Some people thought that he got sad, but in contrast, he has decided to write a book, and all weekend he has been dancing in a club. He already opened his own cantina, and recently he has a girlfriend, and maybe he will get married again in a few months.However, he has diabetes and systemic hypertension; he decided to enjoy his life and start again like a second chance.I think that he is a great example for young people who sometimes decide to quit their dreams, hopes, and sometimes their own lives.He is also a good example and a model for me, and I hope to enjoy my life same or more than him.

For this reason, I disagree with the statement 'young people enjoy life more than older people do.'

Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are. Yes, of course, I agree with this.

The way advertisements are used nowadays has lost the meaning of their purpose. In the early days, their purpose was to bring products to the people, making them aware that a certain product was available in the market, which benefited customers in different ways. In those advertisements, they clearly gave the description of the product and the way it could be used in real life.

The very purpose of those advertisements is lost nowadays. They are just showcasing the product, then originally exhibiting its characteristics, comparing it with other products, and fooling the public about the worthiness of the product, which it really does not have.

They use some girls for advertising face creams. Before they use this product, they look not beautiful, but using the product for a few times brings a change in them; it seems they will be looking charming. How does this happen? It's just the camera trick and the makeup they are given. If we use it originally, will we get that change? No, definitely not. For example, take a product, namely toothpaste. The companies related to it, such as Pepsodent, Colgate, and Closeup, all have the same ingredients and mixtures of the same level. However, while advertising, each company showcases its own product differently, comparing it with others, not mentioning the name of the different company, that their company's product has better features than others. You just tell me how the product is designed with the same formula but with companies having different features.

So, the way advertisements are used nowadays is just showcasing the product more than it originally is, making the product seem much better than it really is.

Another example is soap. The company JOCIL designs soaps and sells them to bonded companies. They just label the paper on it and advertise about the product, simply expressing the features of it without knowing it.

For advertising nowadays, famous bodies are used, such as actors, sportsmen, singers, and so on. So, the people who like the famous body will automatically buy the product, and others who don't like it won't go near the product. This is one of the ways that the product is being showcased more than it is worthy of, as people like the words of famous bodies, they feel that the product is really worthy of being purchased, and they simply buy it because their famous body advertised the product.

Thus, I feel that advertisements are just showcasing the product more than its worthiness, making the product seem much better than it really is. There is no doubt that certain qualities are there in the product, but all the qualities mentioned in the advertisement are not necessarily in it; it's just added qualities to attract the public to the product.

I agree with the statement that says, 'In twenty years, there will be fewer cars than there are today.' In fact, I have to admit that, based on my personal experience, this has been the trend over the last ten years, even if it is not a good result.

I think that in twenty years, there will be fewer cars because of several reasons. First of all, cities are getting bigger. I read last week that most people now live in cities. That means they will have to move inside the city, and as the city becomes bigger, more people will need to have a car (unless the state offers the possibility to move with alternative transport).

Secondly, cities are often overcrowded, and people who do not have much money are obliged to find another place to live outside the city. This means, once again, that they will need a car to get to the city for work, for example. Also, there are people who dislike the style of life that a city often offers. They would probably try to find a place to live that is outside the city but from where they are able to get to the city by car.

Moreover, I think it also depends on how the state or local community would act. There are several examples that demonstrate that when a local community does not want to have too many cars in the city, some solutions can be found to resolve this problem.

The first thing is to make a good city plan, which can really help. If a city is planned in a smart way that considers different things, such as where to put major roads or how to plan alternative transports, then moving in the city is definitely easier.

Secondly, the state should try to sensitize more and more people who live in the city, who often do not care about this topic because they are more comfortable moving with their own car or because they think this problem does not affect them. Which is not true, because they do not feel comfortable at all while trying not to get stuck in traffic or when air pollution reaches really dangerous limits!

Finally, I agree with the statement, even if I think that it will be a huge problem if this actually comes true.

Whenever we discuss the study, one thing we should always take into consideration is that there should not be any conflict on the matter. In my point of view, a person's academic background makes that person more strong in their future, so in student life, they should never deny or refuse further education, because it may give them a lower status in society, which might lead to depression in the future.

In my opinion, I feel it is always better to specialize in one subject than having only broad knowledge of many academic subjects. Because I feel that many things might puzzle a student who doesn't have complete knowledge of any subject, but if a student is a master in a subject, they can definitely make a successful life. They will have all the detailed information of the subject, and no one will challenge them at any point in their subject, and they can make much progress in their career.

Not only in knowledge but also economically, that student becomes more confident, independent, and able to carry their life with all leisure, and they will grow up in their life. Many other professionals will promote them, and as their experience grows, they will keep them on the highest peak of success and satisfaction. Their income, respect, and the position where they are working will definitely keep increasing.

And all these things will finally relax them at the end of their life; they will have the satisfaction about the professional victory they have gained in their life. Every specialization will differ from each other, and they or she became a specific knowledgeable person and will gain all the importance in themselves.

Finally, I want to conclude that being specialized in a specific subject will complete the circle of education.

There are many ways one can travel. People can travel alone or in a group led by a tour guide or travel in groups without a tour guide. I do prefer to travel in a group led by a tour guide. Because with the help of a tour guide, we can save time, save money, and get the effective use of their rich knowledge about the places.

I prefer to travel in a tour led by a tour guide. Because they will have experiences in planning and arranging tours. By this way, we don't need to scratch our head to plan the tour. For example, one time our family planned to visit Singapore. In Singapore, we missed many important places to visit. This is because we had less knowledge about the place and language. We would not have faced this problem if we had hired a tour guide.

With the help of a tour guide, we can complete our tour with less cost. Because they will have a complete database of hotels, travels, lodges, and other important things around the world. They can find an effective tour plan that will fit into our budget. For example, one of my friends who also visited Singapore with his family with a tour guide completed the tour within only $10,000. But in our trip, I spent more than $15,000. So I think a good tour guide will help us in saving money.

By hiring a tour guide, we can save time during the tour. Because they can plan us a good schedule so that we will visit maximum places in the limited time. Also, by choosing a good and experienced guide, we can get to know the historical facts behind the place or city.

Though we will get an overhead of paying to the guide, I think it's more worth than the amount we pay them. So I think, considering all the important facts mentioned above, it's better to hire a tour guide when we are going to travel in a group.

Cars are of vital importance in everyone's life. Today, we cannot imagine a situation without cars. Even if we do not have one ourselves, other people utilize them to make our lives easier - be it a transporter bringing food to the supermarket or the car that brings us to the hospital in case of a severe accident.

In my opinion, we need cars, and the population in our country knows that. This is the reason why I think that the number of cars will not diminish in the next 20 years.

There are a myriad of arguments for and against the use of cars: The major argument against cars is certainly the pollution of our environment. And it is true - cars, as we know them today, need certain natural resources and do pollute our environment to a certain degree. If this is always true, there will probably be fewer cars in use in 20 years than there are today. At some point in time, people would recognize the harm of cars and would definitely try to reduce the number of cars to protect the environment.

But this may not be a realistic case: I am of the opinion that our scientists get smarter and smarter. Until today, they have already invented hybrid engines and engines that are only run by solar energy or plant oils. Today, those inventions cannot replace cars that need gas to produce power, because scientists are still trying to get more out of the new findings. But consider the time the gas engine needed to be as perfect as we know today: It took long years for the car industry to be able to produce those engines.

Given this evolution, it is possible and very realistic that our scientists will make a huge contribution to the improvement of the 'new' engines in the next 20 years. Even if 20 years might be too short to develop a car that does not pollute the environment at all, I think that the scientists are on a good way to find an engine that drastically reduces the pollution. And after another 20 years, we might already use cars that do not need any natural resources like gas. If this is the case, everyone will recognize the outstanding advantages of cars, so that the number of cars will rather increase.

I totally agree with the statement because if product sellers make advertisements for their products, it will affect the product's sales. For example, in my country, some companies make cheap products, but they advertise them as if no one can make this product like us, claiming they are the best. After that, they sell millions of them. Then, some people get poisoned by that product because they use cheap materials.

Also, in the US, some companies give advertisements to television channels, airing them 10 times a day. They manufacture their products in Asia because there is less labor involved. So, they can produce whatever they cannot in the US. Most countries do that, even though a person can make their own product by themselves. Because they just print 'Made in [country]' on the label.

However, people know that advertisement is a way to introduce and sell. So, people can decide whether to buy it or not. If product makers create their advertisements well, everybody will agree that the product sells very well. A person can recognize that a product is either most powerful or harmful. People should get the idea of the advertisement; if they don't, they can feel like 'What was that advertisement all about?' So, the person will be confused.

Finally, if product makers want to sell a lot, they should make them good. Also, they shouldn't use cheap materials.

I don't think that young people enjoy life more than older people do. I would say that they might convey that kind of illusion because they can take more benefit from life than older people do, but it doesn't mean that they enjoy life more.

First of all, I would say that young people want to discover the world before all. Indeed, older people are aware of the world surrounding them. They have already experienced most of the feelings a person can undergo or simply feel. Young people want absolutely to try new things, to experience other feelings.

On the other hand, they are actually younger, that's true. So they can take profit from everything, do some very physical sports that an older person couldn't do, and they are also faster. Everything has to be quick; it's because we want to discover other things.

I take part in that phenomenon; I'm young, but nevertheless, I don't think that I enjoy life more than my parents. They take profit from life in a different way. As an example, they travel, which I can't do on my own because I'm financially dependent on my parents. So I do other things; I do outings with my friends, I do as every adolescent does.

However, this speed with which we execute our activities may lead to a misunderstanding of the situation. Except for old people who can't do almost anything because they are too old, and depressive persons who aren't feeling like doing activities, all people enjoy life the same way. The reason is that we've got only one life, and it would be without interest to spend that life doing nothing.

As a conclusion, I would say that I disagree with the statement of the issue, and I think that everybody enjoys life.

Travelling is one of the most effective ways a family or an individual could spend quality time, relax, or have fun. Therefore, it is essential that tourists have their vacations organized so that they can have the largest amount of fun possible. To have a perfectly organized vacation, people should travel in a group led by a tour guide.

There are many benefits to travelling with a tour guide. Firstly, the tour guide is a trained professional in tourism. He would know which are the best attractions to visit and what would be an appropriate length of time to spend at each one. He would be able to plan how to spend the whole day efficiently, unlike if a person was alone and had to spend hours deciding where to go next.

Secondly, the tour guide would have tickets ready prior to the visit, and this would enable the group to go straight to the attraction without wasting time. For example, to go up the Eiffel Tower in Paris, France, it would, on average, take a person two hours to get a ticket in the high season. However, a tour guide would get you the ticket well before you arrive there, and then you wouldn't have to waste a lot of time waiting in line.

Thirdly, the tour guide would arrange all the transport in advance, and for example, would make arrangements with bus companies to have buses present at the correct times and tell them exactly where to go. If, on the other hand, a person is travelling alone, he would waste a lot of time trying to get from place to place.

There is also a social benefit to traveling with a group, as it would be likely that your group consists of people mainly from your home country, and therefore you would be able to socialize with them and discuss the attractions you visit, along with the fact that you make new friends.

However, some people may argue that having a tour guide deprives them of making their own decisions and their personal choices. Also, it would not allow them to do things that they have always wanted to do if they visited a certain country, but this can always be easily solved by extending the vacation a day or two, or if that is not possible, missing the certain guided tours they are not particularly interested in.

All in all, I strongly agree that the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide. Its advantages significantly outweigh its disadvantages, and I believe that most people would have more fun if they travelled in a group led by a guide.

I definitely agree with the statement at hand. In fact, in my opinion, this is the main goal of education itself. Education should give students the main ideas and concepts, things that students can absorb, make their own, and use as a basis for further education or even for their choices in life.

Facts are like evidence in a trial, things that support the main ideas and concepts. The students have to read the facts, understand them, and, even more importantly, understand how the facts give an example or an explanation of the main idea. They are very important for the understanding process, but at the end, they are notions, something specific that we learn and eventually forget. On the contrary, what really lasts in our memory is the main idea, the concept, and this is the very important thing.

The first example that I can cite is history. When we study history, we study a large number of facts, dates, events, meaning that we learn a large amount of notions that we are most likely going to forget in the future. But all these facts are necessary to understand what happened in a specific period and to analyze the causes and effects that took place in those years. The facts are the instruments at our disposal to build a broader vision of the period at hand and to have a general idea of the economic, sociological, or religious forces that interacted in that historical moment. Even if we eventually forget the specific dates or facts, we still keep a concept, an idea of what was happening in the past.

Moreover, I think that it is sometimes even impossible for our mind to store and remember all the notions and information we read. Computer databases are, in fact, very good instruments to store and retain information. Our mind, on the contrary, has the wonderful ability of elaborating information, putting it together, and drawing conclusions in the form of main ideas and concepts. Again, we see what is really important: ideas and concepts.

In conclusion, I definitely agree with the statement at hand, as I demonstrated with the examples I gave.

I fully agree with the statement that successful people try new things and take risks. In our everyday life, we have many examples that confirm this opinion, but the most important one is given by our entrepreneurs. 

Entrepreneurs are always risking a lot in terms of money and time. Moreover, entrepreneurs are always innovating, trying new things in order to survive in the market, to be competitive, and to improve their position on the global market. The main result of this behavior is the success that everybody can recognize as typical of entrepreneurs.

On the other side, we have low-level employees. They only do what they have been taught to do at the beginning of their career, and they do this work for all their life. Very often, this kind of people are really very good in doing some specific work, and they usually work for all their life for the same company. Generally, they never take any risk, and the company fully protects and supports them because they have a very strong know-how. But if we analyze the lives of these people, we can see that they never achieve any success.

To conclude, I think that to be successful in life, we need to take risks and try new things. Moreover, in this way, we can keep our minds alive, we can train our creativity, and we can better express ourselves as human beings. I think that we need to live as deeply as possible our unique life; therefore, we must try as much as possible new things!

A car is the best instrument for our convenient life. Most people buy their own car if they can afford it. However, in the future, as portrayed in some movies, we may discard our cars, and they will be just a huge waste of resources. There are some reasons to explain this opinion.

These days are changing and developing faster than in the past. Some people have already visited outer space, and many satellites are orbiting the earth. Instead of using cars, they will move around using their personal flying devices, like planes or themselves. From past times, many people wanted to fly in the sky, and they finally made an airplane. The more wishes make more developments. An airplane was not our destination; therefore, many scientists and dreamers are making new technologies and fantastic realities.

Secondly, the future will be a robot world. We always aspire to more comfortable things and have already made some features to work instead of us. There are many kinds of robots, like those working in kitchens or playing with children, and even dancing robots. Therefore, most of the lighter productive works, such as household chores or delivery, will be done by robots. Cars will not be needed anymore, and we will just call our personal robots when we need some help with moving or delivery.

Surely, the most useful thing, a car is the most successful asset to human beings for a long time. We also utilize cars nowadays almost every day; however, the changing of periods and techniques is more important and influences our life. We cannot deter the change.

Some people claim that the number of cars will decrease because not only is the pollution caused by cars very serious, but also the various public transportation systems are developing. However, I firmly believe that people will still want the convenience of cars, and eco-friendly cars are being developed now.

At first, the amount of car manufacturing is increasing continuously. That is because people would like to have their own car for the convenience of movement. A study by the Korean Public Transportation Institute showed that the main reason Seoul citizens favor their own cars is the convenience. They can enjoy driving, except for during traffic jams, and do their favorite activities freely, such as listening to music. Even though the government makes public transportation better, people will not be satisfied with their efforts.

As far as the environmental issue is concerned, it is not a big problem since many countries are trying to develop eco-friendly cars. This investment also means that people still acknowledge the cars' practicality and convenience more than other ways to move. Several months ago, in Japan, some researchers innovated an electronic vehicle that can be used by normal people. So, in the future, more people will use nature-friendly cars.

In these respects, I disagree with the statement that the number of cars will decrease.

Education is the cornerstone in our society. It's the main path that leads a person into the large, endless world of knowledge. Knowledge can be broad, as well as narrow. But which one is better to have?

To be able to answer this question properly, this topic will be divided into two parts: the undergraduate and the graduate students.

The undergraduate students will take a diversity of courses. This will provide them with a large opportunity that allows them to choose in which field to go later on.

For example, in the first two years of the pre-pharmacy degree, we used to take, for instance, cultural study courses, arts courses, which are not related to pharmacy. And many students shifted their major after taking these courses. They found themselves brilliant in other fields. This diversity in courses gave them the chance to choose the major that suits them the best. Imagine that the students take only major pharmacy courses from the first year. This could lead to the failure of many students, because they were not given the chance to study other courses. It's a serious situation, especially in the academic majors that are related to public health and safety, such as medicine, pharmacy, engineering, etc.

However, the graduate students don't have this problem. They decided to go through a specific field, after taking this diversity of courses, when they used to be undergraduate students.

So, having a broad knowledge of many academic subjects will not last forever. And it's a complement to the narrow knowledge.

In my personal experience, I've noticed that having a better knowledge of one specific subject is better than having a broad knowledge of a number of academic subjects.

At the university, I attended different courses referring to three main areas: History, Law, and Economics.

After my graduation, I can say that I had a good knowledge of a series of academic subjects, but I realized that this was not so beneficial for those who are searching for a job, in particular, their first job experience.

In fact, like all my friends did after graduation, I began to search for a job.

In trying to find something adequate to my generalistic preparation, I've understood that it is difficult for people who don't have a specialization to find a job, in particular, a qualified job.

Talking with some friends coming from Economic studies, they all told me that the labor market has notably changed in recent years.

These changes took place since a strict division of work had become a necessity for companies and factories, for example.

Consequently, it could be noticed that who offers a job is generally looking for qualified candidates, for people who have a high knowledge of a particular topic or, in better words, who is specialized in a specific subject.

I have found that this is true, because all my friends who obtained a PhD or attended technical faculties have found a job in just a few months, while others with a more generalistic knowledge or university degree are still searching for a job.

In conclusion, I agree with those who prefer to specialize in a specific subject, because I think that in doing so, they could have more chances to find a job.

Young people nowadays have much more things they want to do than before. They have to learn more things to fulfill the demands of their lives. Besides, young people have much more social activities like going to the movies, traveling, and things like these. On the other hand, most young people do not have their life goal. They do not know what is really important in their whole life and just spend their time on TV or PC games. All they do is spend their valuable time on something unvaluable, and it is a pity for them.

Actually, we can find that young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities. Due to modernization, parents bring their children with them to cities to find jobs. When they go to work, their children are just left at home or sent to a nursery. Those children can't find a model who gives enough time to helping their communities, and all they know is to enjoy their life and have fun. There is no doubt that parents are always the models for their children. That is the reason why young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities. Besides, the public media always deliver error messages to young people. All the media talk about having fun. It is also another reason for this problem.

In conclusion, young people will need more education and training to teach them to give enough time to helping their communities, and parents also should be trained to be a model. The public media also need to make some good programs to teach the young about their social responsibilities. According to these activities, we can eventually find young people nowadays giving much time to helping their communities. And we will have a better world than before.

The issue at hand is that it is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.

I agree with this because people live in various worlds and change quickly.

The first reason I agree that having broad knowledge is important is that it can prevent isolation from people. I was a nurse in my country and needed various knowledge, such as English, sociology, and culture. To socialize with other people, I needed many academic knowledges. I think it is important to have various information as well as nursing.

The second reason I believe that I prefer a person who has broad knowledge of many academic subjects is that we live in various worlds. If I know one thing, I don't understand fields of others. It causes people to have prejudice against the other one.

In conclusion, I contend that our society is changing so quickly. We have to learn various things.

There are two types of advertisements according to chronological order. One is post-modern advertisement, and the other is modern advertisement. The start of advertisement was with modern advertisement, which concentrated on the utility of the product. Later on, after the Cold War period, post-modern advertisement, concentrating on the image or impression of advertisement, began flourishing and has been the mainstream of advertising technology until the present. Now, here comes the problem. Post-modern advertisement ties mainly with the appealing method of impression, and to appeal to others, it needs such accentuation of positive portions and slipping out negative aspects or to cover the weakness of product competitiveness in utility; they will have to concentrate on overwhelming a person with the other good aspects of products, such as design. This can be said that advertisements nowadays make their products seem better.

It might be a limited example for my country, but as it is a fair example, I'll discuss it. In my country, insurance companies put tremendous assets into visual advertisements. They put some words like 'No additional money to pay for 2 months' in big letters, while they put some negative but crucial information in letters that can't even be seen without glasses. People see the conditions only written in the big letters, which seem pretty charming to us, people. However, they realize that they were faked when they actually borrowed a loan from that company.

There is another method in making a product seem better than it is. It is not telling about utility or any other practical values but depicting beauty merely. This is especially severe in visual advertisements. An impressive image overwhelms a person, so that the person forgets the real use of the product is actually limited, and sometimes, advertisements use a person's mind tending to follow celebrities and hire celebrities in making advertisements. A person just mimics celebrities then.

Surprisingly, psychological methods inherent in post-modern advertisements tempt a person to purchase a product. By minimizing shortcomings and accentuating merits, or by visually overwhelming a person without any utilitarian usefulness, advertisements show a product better than it is actually, and people often, dull, get faked by advertisements. Definitely, we'll have to be aware of this, so we don't get faked. Due to the reasons above, I think that most advertisements make products seem much better than their reality, successfully.

It is important to know both the ideas and concepts as well as the facts. Of course, the ideas of a topic or a problem make it easier to understand and to remember, but it takes much longer to be taught these concepts. So sometimes it is easier to learn only facts, even if they are dry and boring. It depends on what you have to do with the information, whether you have to write an essay about that or if it is just for your own general knowledge.
