Among my favorite authors is Dr. Kevin Skandia, who in his work, 'The Clash of Civilizations,' strongly bears, in one of his chapters, on the subject of leadership and how to be successful.He states that in order to become a leader and a pioneer, you have to get out of the conventional; you and I have to go beyond the 'establishment' to break the way things are done so as to create a better way to carry on things.Obviously, people have to take risks and have to be aware of failure, so successful people will go after their goal, knowing in advance that they probably will fail, knowing that this is the best way to succeed.

My work as a specialized purchaser for Walmart, one of the largest retailers worldwide, has faced me with enormous challenges that have demanded full effectiveness to work well under pressure and competition. This experience has helped me to realize that innovation and imagination are two important tools to succeed anywhere you are, and again, in order to be successful, we have to go beyond and try new ways to do our duties.

Since it is company policy to upgrade the expertise of employees, we are consistently enrolled in conferences and meetings, many international in nature, that have given me many opportunities to exchange ideas and share decisions that helped us in our everyday jobs.While exchanging ideas or having conversations with people around the world, our conversations often drift to more casual topics like the everyday decisions we have to take in our lives, and we remark on the importance of being sure of yourself and sure about the things you are to carry on in order to be successful.

At the end, I have always thought that only a few people have the courage to do something else in order to break their 'status quo,' and those kinds of persons are the ones who change and succeed in what they are after, so I do think that successful people try new things and take risks.

The statement says that young people enjoy life more than older people. Personally, I don't agree with this statement in all aspects. In fact, from my point of view, young people are less responsible than mature people. Generally, in recent years, the way to enjoy life has changed. In fact, today, young people have fewer problems than young people of forty years ago, for example. Today, a boy depends totally on his parents. In this way, he has less responsibility, and this causes a total dissatisfaction for all.

Instead of young people, older people have achieved total maturity that permits them to enjoy life more than young people with small things, like a simple dinner with friends or a trip with family.

It is also true that young boys have a lot of enthusiasm compared to older people. But this concept doesn't go over the problem. There are also cases where older people don't enjoy life because they have very big problems, like the fact of not finding a job or, for example, because they are very tired.

So, my personal opinion is that young boys, in a state of parity of conditions, don't enjoy life as much. In fact, also in my family, I see that my parents enjoy life more than me and my brother. Finally, in this way, I say that I disagree with the above statement.

I don't think young people enjoy life more than old people. I think that they prefer to live their life in different ways. In fact, young people love leisure time, love playing together, and they have to know the world and make new experiences. For example, the summer holidays are the weeks of the year most attended, in which they don't have to think about school, and where the only thing they can do is to play every day or go to the sea.

In my case, I am 22 years old, I enjoy life not only because I can stay with my friends and go to dance or to the pubs, I also love life because I have a lot of opportunities, I need to know more things that I can, I need to realize myself. I want a good job and a good career, I want to marry and have a family.

Old people enjoy life not less than young people, but I think that they have already left this important moment of their life and they prefer to stay together in quiet and not busy places.

An example is my grandmother. She is 78 years old. She likes to stay home to watch TV or to read lots of books. She likes to cook and to fill her leisure time with her friends to speak. On holiday, she likes to stay every day in the sun, she prefers to go out for a walk to look at the landscapes or to eat ice cream.

I think that young people and old people enjoy life, but they have different interests and different ways of experiencing life. If young people need to realize themselves, old people need to live the rest of their life to know more than they know. I can define them as the experts of life.

Traveling around the world is a great activity, and there is so much to admire and learn. People can travel for pleasure to exotic places like Hawaii or Bermuda, or they can travel in search of culture, like Egypt or Japan. Usually, couples go to these places looking to relax.

If people travel for pleasure, they do not need a tour guide, because usually, for this kind of travel, travel agencies offer packages with all the activities. These activities are for relaxation and fun. You do not need a guide for that. However, if you are planning to go to Egypt, for example, you will need a tour guide.

A tour guide is a person who knows about the area and, most importantly, knows about history. When people travel, time is very important, so you need to see and learn as much as you can in less time. Therefore, a tour guide is the right person to accomplish this goal.

A tour guide not only knows about history and important places but also recommends good restaurants, places to have fun, and places to avoid due to security concerns.

I remember when I went to Mexico, my friends and I went to visit some ruins, and we hired a tour guide. While we were on the bus going to the city of El Carmen, the tour guide started explaining and talking about these ruins, and by the time we got there, we knew what to expect.

I would like to go to Egypt in the future with a group of friends, and we will definitely be led by a tour guide. There is so much to see in Egypt that I do not want to waste time looking for places or getting lost when we can hire somebody who can take us directly to the best places.

I strongly agree because I believe that if you manage to understand the main idea of an event, it will last in your mind and you will be able to remember it for a long time. And that if you just learn the facts of the events, they won't last in your mind that much.

An example that I believe can be given is when high school students learn about historical events. If they just memorize dates, names, and places, they will be able to remember them just in order to apply them in a test, unless it's a super important subject of history.

But if they analyze the situation, analyze the events that occurred, and comprehend why that event occurred in the first place, they will like the subject more, they will feel a little bit smarter, and the dates, the names, and the places will be left in a second place. So, this will even help them when they will have to memorize dates and such, because they will be able to associate the purposes and reasons of the events with the numbers and the names.

I believe that it is not necessary for learning to be boring. If you just memorize everything and study just because you want to get a good grade, you are not doing the real purpose of learning; you're just dealing with a lot of problems and getting yourself tired and bored.

Studying can be fun if you understand everything; you will feel smart. If you just learn the facts without actually understanding what they mean, you will feel bad and less intelligent. So, I think that teachers should encourage students to exceed themselves and to develop their intelligence, and not to memorize a thousand books without understanding anything or without even learning things that will truly be helpful in your life.

People who are truly smart can solve a problem without the necessity of consulting someone else who's supposed to be more intelligent. And if you need to read something a thousand times to actually get a hold of the idea, you're just a mere puppet, and it's pointless to live as a puppet because, at the end of your life, you will feel bad for having restricted your true intelligence.

I would agree with that statement in some occasions or education levels in life, for example, at school, but would usually disagree with it when it comes to studying in a university.

A student having general knowledge would have many basic pieces of information in many subjects, which seems to me as an advantage, but not all the information as a student specialized in a certain major or subject.

Having broad knowledge in an academic is really beneficial in life and may help, but I would prefer to have a specialized major because it will, or I think it would, offer more job opportunities for me to choose than that of a person with general knowledge. I would or can specialize in that subject more, implying I could gain the master's and then the doctorate degrees more easily.

Some people, other than me, would judge me as incorrect and would assign that having general knowledge might improve my life more than that of a specialized one. However, nowadays people tend to get specialized or would rather have a major than having information on various subjects that might have a negative impact on how that individual is being taught.

Looking at people in many countries, having many majors might make a variety and help people do what or learn what they want instead of having to learn information they do not want to or have difficulties in and do not want to compete with.

A scholar's main goal is to ensure that their alumni have learned their teachings. Understanding ideas assures them that the student has a clear image of what was taught by portraying it into concepts. Once they have knowledge about these statements and ideas, they can develop their own, expand the already made, or come up with counter ideas. All of the previously mentioned forces students to keep on with their mental growth. Facts are obviously helpful; however, that's as much as you'll get from them. Facts will avoid learning because most of what you do with them is memorize and file them in a redundant folder of your brain. They'll show up when they're convenient; ideas will stick around.

I attended a Model UN annual debate meeting in 2005. My classmates and I, chosen to represent our school in the meeting, were newcomers and needed an explanation in order to fulfill expectations. We weren't clear about the process. Our highly demanding teacher made us participate in a re-enactment of last year's meeting, and even though it took us a while to get the idea, once we got the hang of it, we cleared our doubts and understood the concept. Model UN is not just another extracurricular activity; it was an opportunity for success. We were training our minds to think for others, to speak for those who can't for themselves, and to come up with resolutions to worldwide problems. That is the truthful concept of the Model UN, and we knew that even before getting there. Once we got to La Ceiba, the Model UN scenario, we had an ultimate learning experience.

Our instructor could have listed a series of facts, and sure, it'd help, but we'd have to wait until the next meeting to outstand and get the idea.

It is always a clever move to be able to have an image of what the teaching is supposed to go and not walk blindly through a learning path. Therefore, understanding ideas and concepts is much more important than learning facts.

As it is said that high returns cannot be gotten without high risk, it seems to be true that successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they know. However, I disagree with the idea for the following reasons.

Firstly, success can be achieved if you continue doing what you already know how to do well. For example, in Japanese traditional arts like Kabuki or Noh, the performers repeat the practice of the same story every day from the day they start practicing when they are 3 years old or so to the day they die. However, we all admit that they could succeed in fully expressing the traditional arts as parts of Japanese culture. The same also applies to traditional craftsmen or even professional baseball players. They improve their abilities by repeating the same things that are most familiar to them every day. These examples are enough to deny the statement above.

Besides, even if trying new things brings you chances for success, new things must mean things that are new to everyone, not just to the person alone. Someone who always changes their focus cannot have a chance to get success.

People do not always reach success by trying new things and taking risks, even though sometimes it is necessary. If someone has the formula for success, whether they found it or it was given by the environment, they should not change it unless they want to or are pushed to do so.

Carlo Ancelotti, coach of AC Milan, an Italian soccer team that has won several tournaments and awards under his guidance, declared on the day before the final of the Champions League, 'A team that wins never changes (set up).' The next day, using the same players as the previous game, AC Milan won the Champions League, the most prestigious tournament in soccer. Just like Carlo Ancelotti suggested, something successful should often remain uncorrupted to succeed again.

Not everyone, though, already has this opportunity in their life. This is the case when a person should try new things and take risks. For instance, considering a large and profitable factory, the son of the boss will not have trouble reaching working success (considering this is the kind of success he is looking for) as his heritage includes a business already started and well run. However, one of the workers in the factory has great manual skills, but in the factory, he does not gain much profit and does not fully use the resources he has. If he never took a risk and never tried anything new, he would always work in the same factory and hardly reach success. Instead, if he decided to start his own activity, taking the risks that such a choice brings, he would have a much larger chance to succeed.

Nevertheless, looking at the society on a bigger scale, risks might be necessary to succeed and develop. In fact, there is one important factor to consider: competition. The pushing force for many people is often other candidates who try to reach success by doing something innovative. Unfortunately, there are times where the success of one is the unsuccess of others. This cycle, in fact, is infinite. The positive aspect of this situation is that the society will always offer newer and more innovative things.

Therefore, success is not always found by doing something new and taking risks, but there are times where the situation requires it.

Generalization versus Specialization.

Some people prefer specific academic subjects over many academic subjects. I agree with this preference for several reasons. The first reason is that you can be an expert in the matter. The second reason is that you can get professional development and get a good job, and the third reason is to solve specific problems.

The first reason, which refers to being an expert in the matter, explains the idea that some people have the knowledge to get the information and can explain and show results. For instance, people who study a Bachelor's degree in Economics, a Master's degree in Macroeconomics, and a Ph.D. in Microeconomics could get the profile of a kind of person who can develop some theory about the behavior in consumer and demand with respect to the national economy.

The second reason refers to the possibility of getting professional development and access to better jobs. For example, if you have a Ph.D. in Computer Science, you can be a candidate for big companies like Microsoft to contract with you.

The third reason refers to the idea of solving specific problems. For instance, if you are studying something related to medicine, maybe you can find the solution to big problems like HIV or cancer or diabetes.

In conclusion, I agree with the idea that being a specialist in some area is better than getting just general knowledge, and to be a specialist is equal to saying an expert in the matter, and maybe being an expert in the matter brings you, in the future, professional development and opportunities to access better jobs.

As a student for 12 years now, I feel able to judge and talk about the scholar system, and in my opinion, our scholar system concentrates too much on success than on values.

There are a lot of different subjects and classes you participate in as a student, and in every class, you are writing exams. But often, you do not have enough time to study for such an exam, and therefore, you just learn the most important facts by heart to succeed in the exam. However, you forget the facts you learned by heart very quickly, and after a few months, nothing is left anymore, and you take only a minimum of what you have ever learned at school with you.

This is not a very good preparation for life because at school, you often only learn how to reproduce facts about a topic in a few days. By practicing ideas in an enjoyable way, such as in group work or role plays, for example, you keep the essence and the main content of a concept in mind. That way, you do not have to feel under pressure to learn facts very quickly by heart; you can enjoy learning! And if you enjoy learning, you will take more essence with you.

Teaching concepts and ideas may contain ideal ways of behavior that you could never teach with the help of facts. Students can learn about values and strategies that are important for their future life. If they understand the background or the concept of something they learn, they will always be able to reproduce these strategies of behavior in daily situations. And in my opinion, this is the task of school.

School should prepare all of the students for their future. It is up to a school to teach values and virtues because very often parents fail. It is sure that values cannot be taught by giving facts or by learning things by heart. Values can only be taught by practicing them, and therefore, I agree with the statement that it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.

I agree that young people enjoy life more than older people do. There are two reasons for this: being more active than older people and having more experiences.

First of all, young people are more active than older people. Therefore, they have so much energy to do everything. For example, the physical condition is quite different between young people and old people. When my family tried to hike Mount Fuji, which is the largest mountain in Japan, my sister and I could get to the top. However, my parents could not do that. Moreover, obviously, young people's bodily functions are better than those of older people. If they have a physical examination, the result is easy to expect. Thus, young people have to enjoy their life.

Secondly, young people need to have a lot of experiences. They are young, so their experiences are naturally limited. Older people have already experienced a lot of things, and they have stepped into adulthood, which means they can decide things for themselves.

In conclusion, I support the idea that young people enjoy life more than older people do. If they enjoy their life, they will become good people.

An ancient Arabic saying goes, 'Take whole things from a particular thing, and take something from all things.'

Having a broad knowledge of many academic subjects is better than specializing in one subject for many reasons. Strict sciences, provided another scientist, and expand personal awareness.

First, sciences are complicated and crossed. For example, there is a crossover between Law and Political Science, so any specialist who is interested in Law needs to study a little about politics. And there are many sciences that are concentrated from many sciences, such as Biochemistry and Economic Law.

Furthermore, specialists need to know some information about broad sciences to build bridges with other specialists. They and other people need each other to provide their knowledge, experiences, and research. For example, a professor of Physics will get a lot of benefits from a professor of Math, which will encourage their ideas and theories.

Moreover, a broad knowledge expands awareness of the mind, giving a lot of information that cannot be found in a similar lab where a specialist stays. For example, a professor of Law cannot know anything about periods of Arabic poets if he does not deal with an Arabic Literature professor. Also, he can enjoy people's inventions and gets more angles of view to life.

As a result, I agree that having broad knowledge has a lot of advantages, changes relationships between scientists, and expands awareness.

There is an ongoing debate about whether it is best to travel in a group with a guide or not. Some people insist that it is better to take a trip alone because it allows them to explore the new environment freely. However, I strongly believe that following a tour guide with a group of people is the most efficient way to travel because people can enjoy the most beautiful and popular sites in a short time and also learn interpersonal skills by socializing with the team members.

First and foremost, with a leader who knows about the sites, people can save their time to enjoy the most renowned places. Some people say that this kind of traveling does not satisfy every other member in the group. However, as the guide has experienced every kind of traveler, he/she would surely be able to schedule the best course for the most members. According to a survey released by the Korean National Research Center, more than two-thirds of the surveyed people who had traveled abroad responded that they would like to take a trip with a tour guide who knows about the places. In this survey, they answered that a tour guide who has already taken numerous trips would be able to lead them to the most magnificent and indispensable spots they can't miss. Also, they replied that as they have the best way to drop by all the remarkable places in their heads, it would save their time rather than traveling all by themselves with a piece of map. Therefore, traveling with a tour guide as a member of a group is the most time-saving and efficient way.

Moreover, by socializing with others in a group, people would be able to have more benefits. In these days, social skills are considered to be important requirements to move up the ladder. And by traveling in a group, they can achieve needed interpersonal skills. For example, an adult who decides to take part in a group traveling to India has to deal with troublesome behavior and incomprehensible words from others. In this process, he/she would be able to learn how to remain calm on the face of others' irresponsible behaviors and eventually be on good terms with them. Traveling in a group will finally turn out as a precious memory of not only having been to various kinds of spots but also making relationships with many different kinds of people. Furthermore, he/she would be able to succeed with the social skills he/she has got. In this sense, traveling in a group does good to each individual by teaching them how to harmonize with others.

All in all, traveling in a group is the most recommended way to take a trip because it is the most efficient method with a guide, and people can achieve social skills by it.

In my opinion, there could be great success for people who have an inclination to do things differently from others. Although some might say that such people tend to have failures because of the high risk, I think that most of them have success in terms of their personal achievement.

I prefer the idea that people should try to do their best within their ability and resources. And, even if they fail, I think they have had their own success. This success means that breaking one's own limitation could be happiness for people. For example, there was a man who quit a big company and started a small coffee shop. Even though he was so enthusiastic to make the shop profitable, he eventually went bankrupt. I saw, however, in some magazine that covered his failure story, the man said he felt so happy because he could know his limitation. I think that knowing one's own limit could be success since it could be helpful for people to have a good life in their future.

And, it could be too easy to do what others can do easily. In this circumstance, even though people can have some profit, I cannot say it is success. For instance, after Henry Ford introduced a commercialized car for ordinary people, many car makers tried to follow and jump into the car industry. Nevertheless, they were just followers. They did just what Ford did. While some car makers still make great profits, in my opinion, they are not truly successful. They imitate what the great man did.

Of course, the followers can have great success. They can reduce costs and attract consumers a lot. They might be some kind of successful people. I think, however, the truly successful people are the people who did new things and took high risks.

I agree that young people do not give enough time to help their communities these days. People have to work individually, but they also should work for the group to which they belong. Not a specific group, I mean; they have to participate in public, for example, in a school or in a family. Teenagers are not familiar with their responsibilities as a student and also as a family member.

Usually, people start learning to be a part of a community in a family. Children should study lessons, show respect to older members, while parents should work for the family and help their children to become better adults. Besides the general idea, they also have to love each other and have a good relationship. Unfortunately, young people avoid getting closer to their parents. They don't listen to the advice an experienced adult can give; instead, they start getting away from their home. Teenagers even want to be with their unknown friends rather than spending time with their brothers or sisters.

Another example where young people show responsibility is in their schools. They have to participate in classes, study for exams, and also study for the future to get a good job. Recently, students think school is somewhere to get away from home or have fun without preparing for lessons. They see the rules as challenges that they have to break and get attention. Then, school disciplines have more strict rules to control them. So, the community they try to work falls apart. Teenagers should give some of their freedom to have a peaceful school life.

To conclude, young people should sometimes act like grown-ups to control their lives better. If they can be good students, friends, sisters/brothers, daughters/sons, they can create a better community and they also can enjoy where they are and what they are doing.

I agree with this idea.

There are four reasons.

At first, it is more appropriate to play sports because some hard sports, such as soccer, basketball, and baseball, are difficult to play for older people. In fact, there are only young star players in professional leagues of these sports. In addition, it is not only the number of sports they can do but also the risk of injury when they play the sports. The possibility of getting injured is higher in older people's cases.

Secondly, young people can travel more easily than older people, especially in foreign country cases. When we trip to somewhere, we sometimes face cultural differences with other people who live in that place and should have a flexible mind to accept such cultural differences to have a good relationship with them. Moreover, sometimes it is necessary to communicate with them in their own language. In that case, we have to learn another language to communicate. It is easier for young people to learn because of their flexible and fresh thinking way.

Thirdly, young people have enough time to do what they would like to realize. Basically, older people have more social responsibility, especially if they have sons or daughters. It is quite difficult to make time to do things in the quite tight situation of older people.

Fourthly, there are a lot of chances for young people to change situations according to their preferences. For example, it is easy to get a new job for young people rather than older people because they have a lot of potential to learn more about new jobs. The main reason is they can work more time due to the law. Currently, it is difficult to have jobs for people over 60. Some people who would like to work cannot get jobs because of these reasons. In young people's cases, it fully depends on themselves.

Young people are energetic and driven, so they have a responsibility to use their talents meaningfully. It is expected that they be enthusiastic about giving back to the community that raised them.

But what actions constitute 'helping' our community? Voluntary work at non-profit organizations seems to be the easiest answer. Small acts of kindness - like helping a senior citizen cross the road - are often cited as ways for young people to serve the community. I believe that any work - paid or unpaid - done for the right intentions should count as helping our community.

Having said that, I think that the amount of time young people nowadays devote to their communities is regrettably lacking. I personally know a few young people who have never done an hour of voluntary work in their lives. Not only are they uninterested in the welfare of their fellow citizens, but neither do they see any point in serving their own family members or friends. Since they fail to see beyond themselves, there is no hope that they will give any time to help the community at large.

Most educated young people have a vague sense of responsibility involving their communities, but there are so many distractions that prevent them from devoting time to it. Peer pressure, new technology, the mass media, and pop culture simply teach them all to concentrate on themselves and try to live a happy, materialistic life. It is a pity, since so many young people are led away from exercising their civic responsibility. No matter how much they are told by parents to help their community, it is impractical if there are so many distractions in their lives.

Many young people do a small part in helping the community by doing community service. However, performance isn't satisfactory either. Even if they are doing voluntary work for no monetary pay, many young people are inevitably waiting for payment in some other form - points for an academic scheme, an impressive mention in their resume, or an award for 'outstanding service.' If they are intent on these superficial rewards, what follows is that the extent of their help will not be proportionate. Moreover, what little heart they have for service will diminish quickly, and of course, this is definitely not 'enough.'

In some situations, it is certainly understandable that young people choose other activities over service. Students should put their studies on high priorities, and young people in general seek excitement and new experiences, so they are entitled to some level of self-centeredness. In fact, pursuing wild, creative ways of doing things will probably be a help to the community, if these young people choose to lend their talents and innovations accordingly. This requires a much deeper understanding than exists in the young people of today, but it also goes to show that the measure of contribution is hardly as simple as time - it involves an awareness and some heart in all of us.

It needs people like Benjamin Franklin, who risked his own life for the sake of science when he used a kite during a thunderstorm to study the characteristics of electricity, in order to enhance our technological and philosophical understanding.

There are countless examples of men in history who risked their own wealth or even their lives to try out a 'new thing' in which they believed and put their faith.

It is inherent to human nature to strive for new knowledge and wisdom. But new knowledge can only be gained by daring to step aside from the enlightened path and searching in the darkness. Risk has to be accepted as a part of this search.

To become successful, you need to distinguish yourself from the crowd, and this also means accepting some risk. One possibility to do so is by exploring new ways and, thereby, inventing something new or developing new skills. Successful entrepreneurs, for example, are usually recognized as risk-taking people. Innovation is the result of their effort to become better and make things better. With their success, they shape our economy and our society.

It is people like Bill Gates who changed the world we are living in today; and he started in a small garage, working on something people at that time might have called 'crazy' and 'useless.' He definitely tried a 'new thing,' and that is what made him very successful.

Another proof that success and risk-taking go together can be provided by the financial markets. It is taking the risk that pays off. But that does not necessarily mean that risk is uncontrollable. Information can be gained and used through personal effort to assess the quality of the risk. So, to become successful, it is also necessary to get informed, implying that one cannot only do what he knows how to do well already but has to try 'new things.'

Acknowledging this, I have to agree with the given statement.

The life has become more comfortable and easy to live, and also the price of cars has decreased. The people prefer to buy and use their own cars rather than use buses or subways.

So, some people can think that cars will be more and more in the future, but I disagree that ``In the twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today''.

First of all, people will rethink pollution, so they will decrease their use of cars.As you know, cars are a reason for pollution, and people use them more and more, then pollution also gets worse and worse, because of carbon dioxide, which is from cars, and other bad gases.So, people will decrease their use of cars.

Secondly, when all people use cars, this will create traffic jam problems, so people always live on the road, and they cannot do what they want to do on time.So, they will prefer other traffic, such as buses and subways, because those go faster than cars.

Thirdly, it will be obvious anyway that people always die, even though medicine is developing.And in the future, there are too many people who do not get married and have babies, so there is just a few increasing people.Hence, it is not different from now.

Hence, people will not use more cars in the future than routine.Because people always think about their environment rather than their comfort.And also, they do not want to be late for all their appointments.As someone said, ``Time is money.''

Yes, I agree that most advertisements make products better than they really are. Already, advertisements focus on buying and consuming products. The way of reaching their purpose is making consumers admire them. So, products must be attractive and appeal to other senses of the consumer. Demands must be created by advertisements.

The advertisement is one of the marketing tools. It isn't given a direct message by advertisement; they are general, imaginative, colorful, and attractive. It mustn't be boring. Advertisements serve the six senses of humans to create demands.

For example, orange juice advertisements, all ages of people could be a product. Messages might be power, energy, sex, dream, healthy, even as like medicine. Even pictures of nice, real oranges and more colorful, but its ingredients are sugar, water, fruit perfumes, glycos, fruit nectar, etc. Maybe they will create an enjoyable atmosphere in the background of the advertisement, for example, a young people's party. That could be a message of sex, romance, etc.

So, a successful advertisement will be determined by the rate of consumers. So, how much separate people earn profits, add value are important points of making advertisements that products seem better than they really are.

In my opinion, I agree with this statement. I think that the number of cars will decrease at least around the next decades. There are a few reasons for it. First, recently, concern for environmental pollution is getting higher. Of course, it is not caused only by cars, but the great number of cars apparently affects the air and water, and so on. Moreover, in our daily life, cars are a very notable element to the environment.

Second, from the aforementioned first reason, the number of proprietors is not increasing like before. For example, my parents thought it was a dream to buy a car when they were young. Now, I am almost the same age as them at that time, but I do not need a car. I do not feel it is necessary to have one. The meaning of having a car is changing more than before.

Third, many vehicles have developed very well, so we can go anywhere by using them, such as trains or airplanes or ships. Moreover, although there is not only one company but also a lot of companies offering their vehicles with competing prices, we can use them cheaper than before.

Some people may disagree with my opinion. The market of motor cars is still strong now, therefore it will never decrease in number. Of course, in Japan also, the market is still vigorous. If I watch TV programs, I can see a lot of commercials throughout the time. Even now, a lot of people may be purchasing their new cars. But I think that the recent mainstream has changed obviously, that is to say, recently the most motivational stream is the new type of car that never exhausts any pollutants. In addition, eco-cars are famous and popular, which use not non-renewable resources, petroleum, but electricity. I think that this shows our view has changed from before.

Therefore, I agree with this statement that recently fewer cars are in use. The number of cars will change into fewer.

Successful people tend to try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well. Why I used 'tend' above is that it is a possibility, not an absolute solution for successful people; otherwise, the answer should depend on how to define 'successful people' and how do successful people succeed? If success means money, and someone who is called a successful person comparatively, but not a real money bag like Bill Gates, there is no absolute answer for success. However, even in that case, the possibility for success is consistently changing up to the definition of success or how much they are successful.

Apparently, the possibility for success is given to people who are willing to try something new. Because in the fields that have been well-known benefit makers, many people have already taken their benefits from that, not much is left for others to gain, and it could be called a monopoly. It's like fossil fuel depletion. A small part of the world is still taking big gains from fossil fuel, and there is no chance to get entered into that industry, because those fields are already full with prior property.

In a given situation, like their DNA, such as their looks or how they are smart, like how much money they get from their parents, the possible way to improve their possibility for success is to challenge the uncovered world. Even though they are having a risky business, which is originated from itself (because it's new!), the people who only do what they already know how to do well cannot easily catch up with those people who try to do something new and achieve great-great success rather than great or just success.

I am aiming for great-great success, like I wrote above; what I require to get the goal is to improve my creativity, to be creative enough to find something new and explore it. There is a word in my country: 'If the water is stuck in one place, it will decay.'

I agree with the statement, mainly because I think that it is imperative for students to understand ideas and concepts, and knowing how to act upon them is more important than just knowing facts.

From my experience in high school, I think students in general find it much easier to just learn facts rather than understanding concepts and ideas. One simple example is when I used to love labeling the heart diagram in biology class but just despise explaining Newton's First Law of Motion in physics class.

On the contrary, when there is a written response question on a test, it would be much easier for students to respond when they actually understand what they are talking about rather than just knowing the fact.

Another broader example is when we had to make a student committee with the job of spreading the word in school about aiding with recycling and cleaning up. Many of us did it, but I highly doubt that everyone understood why they were doing it.

So, in the end, I believe that for a student to get through his life experience as being a student with a degree of some sort, he has to understand ideas and concepts and act upon them.

Although young people tend to have more physical advantages to enjoy life than older people, I disagree with the idea that young people enjoy life more than older people because of the following reasons.

First, older people have more free time because they are retired. On the other hand, young people are busy going to school, doing assignments, and working to support their life. For example, now I am attending law school and I spend most of my time preparing for classes. Also, I do some part-time job because I need money to socialize. However, my parents are retired and they spend most of their time traveling, planning trips, and so on.

Second, older people tend to have enough budget to enjoy their life. For example, my parents love traveling and they went to Peru and Western Europe last year. I also like traveling abroad, but I do not have enough money, so I ended up traveling domestically by renting a car and staying in motels.

Third, older people are more likely to have concrete objects regarding what they want to do in their free time because there were many things they could not do when they were working as a result of insufficient time. For example, my father's dream was to visit Peru, which he could achieve because he was unable to get enough long vacation to go abroad when he was working.

It is true that young people are healthier, and some older people cannot do what they want because they cannot move. There are, however, many older people who are organizing poem clubs or reading clubs and enjoying their life regardless of their immobility.

In conclusion, older people are enjoying their life much more than young people because they have more free time, more financial resources, and have a stronger desire to do something they could not do when they were young.

I agree with that statement, though I have to admit there are exceptions. Nowadays, it seems to be all about themselves and nothing else for young people. They do not mind about the ones in need because they are not even aware that such a thing called 'in need' exists. Their families spoil them to no end, which leads the youth to be unaware of what is going on in their community, let alone the world.

The thing with young people these days is that they are being brainwashed by some industries and are victims of these industries. Like the food industry, which created a new form of ideal for women's bodies, and nearly all young girls are concerned about their weight more than anything else. This nonsense is what is taking their minds off other things, like helping their community!!!

And this generation, which I am a part of, is very self-centered because what is expected from them is perfection. Which, we all know, is impossible to reach. So, to reach that impossible goal of themselves, they give their full attention to themselves.

I know the things I wrote down are a little bit off the topic, but thinking twice, they are somehow related. Youth is striving for an unrealistic goal, making them imperfect by way of characteristics, just the opposite of what they are striving for. All in all, I do agree that my generation is not giving enough time and care to help others.

Schools that teach K-12 students require students to study various subjects. These subjects that the students learn are not necessarily useful in their career. I believe that it is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject.

If it is better to master one specific subject, why do schools teach numerous subjects to students? A student might agree that the subjects they are learning in school are useless and meaningless to learn. This is not true because as you grow more mature, you will realize that the things you learned in school really come to help in real life. So, it is better to study and have knowledge on various types of subjects rather than having unlimited knowledge on one subject.

It may seem better to specialize in one specific subject when you get a specific job that requires those knowledge skills you learned. Well, this is just in your career. When you get out to the social world, the things you learned are too professional that no one, but you and people who work with it, understand. If you want to get involved in a social life and understand life better, it is better to know many things. For example, when you go to a party where all kinds of different people gather, you want to talk to people, but you only know that specific topic and do not know other topics that people talk about. As a result, you will be secluded and feel alone.

In conclusion, it is better to have broad knowledge of many subjects than to specialize in one specific subject. With broad, but many knowledge, you will enjoy a better life where you are not left behind, and you will be able to appreciate other people's opinions more. On the other hand, if you only know about a specific subject, you will be left alone and feel secluded. To lead a successful life, it is better to know a lot of things rather than a specific topic.

I disagree with the statement that young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities because the young spend many of their time helping people with disabilities and also helping older people. For this reason, the statement is wrong.

An example is if a young person has a grandparent, such as a grandfather or grandmother, when they help them, they make a contribution to the community because they spend time helping an older person to buy food, water, medicine, and other necessities and also spend time speaking with them, which in some cases is more important than when a person goes to them only to take a list of what they need.

This is the same aspect that applies when a young person helps a person with disabilities because the true problem is not their inability to do something, but the need to speak and play with other people like them, and these people are the young.

I know a lot of young people who, over time, spend a little or a large part of their remaining time helping these people, and this is very important for the communities and the people who do this.

Everyone wants to enjoy life and live happily. We are all different and cannot be the same in appearances and preferences. As industry develops, people get more chances to enjoy their life in various ways. For example, before the invention of the airplane, taking a trip around the world was not as easy as it is nowadays. But we have a lot of things to do in our free time. Therefore, some people might say that young people these days enjoy life more than older people do. It is true in some aspects because young people have more alternatives for enjoying life, and many leisure equipment have been invented gradually.

I think that the enjoyment of life does not always mean physical aspects. Of course, youth itself is a beautiful thing. On the other hand, we should plan our future life and prepare for it in our young days. Older people enjoy their life with a sound wisdom of living. They have experienced many things through life and have a wise sight for life and the world.

Being young is not a critical factor for enjoying one's life. Older people can enjoy their life in more various ways with their experiences of life and open eyes for others.

I think the statement is too absolute. I remember when I was young, there were not that many possibilities to help the community, and they were also not attractive to young people. There is also a big difference depending on where you live. In large cities, there are not that many communities you can get involved with, like they are in smaller villages or smaller towns. 

Another point is the fact that nowadays young people have a lot more to do and not that much time, like it was years ago. They have to go to school or learn a lot, and most young people have to work besides their school to earn money to live. If they already have a job besides school, they probably will not take a community job without getting paid. They do not have the time and the money to help the community. 

Working in the community has also advantages, which most young people do not know about. A community job integrates you into your environment if you are new. It can also help you to find friends, or the community helps you if you have a problem. It also can give you social support if you do not know what to do or have no other things in your life. It is a good way for older people who do not have to work anymore to get a job for their life. And to get integrated into their social environment. 

But in my opinion, it is true, young people do not give enough time to their communities. Even if it is not the same as it was years ago. The most important point is the social contact they get in their community.

I disagree with this statement. There are three reasons. 

First, anybody can enjoy life whether they are young or old. That's the matter of individual feeling or thinking, not age. You can see it from the statistics about the age of people who commit suicide. The number of older people is not much different from that of younger people. They die because of disappointment with their life. I think that may be one of the proofs that young people don't necessarily enjoy life.

Second, older people who usually move and speak slowly may give the impression to people that they are boring or have nothing to do. It is not true. Thanks to their experiences and knowledge gained from their long life, they know how to enjoy and have fun in their own way in any situation.

Third, the number of older people who go to educational facilities, like city colleges, is still increasing. That means they have a passion to get higher education and enthusiasm to earn new knowledge.

Compared to older people, younger people seem to spend much

Last week, I read an article in our daily newspaper about who enjoys life more, female or male. I considered this piece of paper for a very long time and came to the conclusion that it is more worth distinguishing between young and old people than between female and male. But nevertheless, I am of mixed opinion concerning this question.

On the one hand, you might get the impression that young people enjoy life more than older ones if you observe from outside. But the only reason for that is that young people live their life more actively than older ones. They try new things, have fun whenever there is a chance to have, and make their own experiences in order to develop a personality. Students, for instance, like to go to parties or hang around at the beach playing soccer because they know that in later professional life they will not have the chance to act like that.

On the other hand, older people have gathered a vast amount of experience during their life. Consequently, they do no longer feel any pressure to act like younger ones. I believe that they also had an active, excited life in their youth. But with a certain decrease in age, other things like family, health, or financial security become more and more important for them. So, in my state of view, they simply have a distinct way of enjoying their lives. They get their satisfaction by going for a healthy walk in the park or having a cup of tea with their husband or wife in a nice restaurant next to the beach. Unfortunately, these facts are invisible to people who observe from outside, so the wrong impression might come up that older people do not enjoy their life.

All things considered, I would state that neither the young nor the older people enjoy their life more. Both groups have their own way to enjoy their life. The youth often expresses itself more actively, while older people are satisfied by a calm and especially healthy life.

I do not agree with this statement. In my opinion, it is not possible to make such a statement and to make clear what I mean, I'm going to explain my point of view with some examples.

Before I started studying medicine, I worked as a Rettungsassistentin. I met a few people, old and young ones, and I often had the time to talk with them for a while. Everyone had their own life story, and many of them really liked to tell me about their positions in life and their experiences. Now I would like to describe two really significant conversations I had.

The first conversation I had was with an older woman. She was about 80 years old and lived in a pension for the elderly. She was very sick but always had a smile on her face. We met several times, and we always talked a lot. She told me great stories about her and her husband Karl, who died two years ago. All the time, she felt absolutely fine with herself and the world around her, and that's why I asked her one day what her secret was like. She laughed and answered me, 'Young lady, do not believe that I do not know how cruel life can be; I have seen it.' But this is the reason why I am so lucky. I thank God for what I have, and I enjoy every day in my life. It is a question of perspective.

The other situation I would like to describe was with a girl of my age. She wanted to kill herself because her boyfriend had left her two days ago, and she thought life would be over now. For her, there was no more sense in life.

I think this statement made at the beginning is not right. It is important to look individually at everyone! It is a question of view!

I disagree with the statement that ideas and concepts are more important than facts for students. Actually, from my point of view, facts are just as important as ideas and concepts.

First, without facts, how can ideas and concepts exist? Ideas and concepts cannot be separated from facts. For example, when we learn the concept of force in physics, students need to conduct experiments to be aware of the fact that there are different kinds of forces everywhere in the world. The teacher will confuse the students if he or she just draws a symbol and points it to them, then says, 'Look, it is what we call force.' By doing this, the teacher is at risk of being fired.

Second, students should not just grasp the ideas and concepts but also know the detailed facts in order to pass the exams. For example, in an exam of a biological course, students should remember the exact examples of animals in order to describe the process of reproduction. I cannot imagine a person can write down all the materials the teacher wants without any facts. Although there may be some exams that allow students to take books with them, remembering the exact facts benefits the students greatly, because they can save the time spent on referring to the books.

Third, students should learn facts in order to find a good job in some cases. For example, I major in computer science, and it involves a lot of programming. The mathematical concepts and ideas do help me learn theories of computer science. However, it was when I tried to find a job that I realized that facts, such as the parameters of the computers, did me a big favor in finding a job as a programmer.

In conclusion, while ideas and concepts are important in learning, facts are of the same weight to students.

Nowadays, people are living in a mixed world with all kinds of generations, and where the community grows faster. How can you help your community with the time you have?

First of all, in my opinion, as a twenty-year-old student, I would say that in your everyday life, you never find enough time for all you want to do.

As far as I am concerned, I would say that giving time for other people or being involved in an activity requires a lot of human quality and a strong engagement.

It might not be easy to help our community when you have responsibilities at work, at home, with children. In order to manage a good way of living, we have to make choices at any time during our own life.

Secondly, we can consider the problem from a different point of view. If you are living in a huge town, it will be more difficult to help the community than living in the country.

Thanks to the small villages in the country, everybody knows everybody. The fact of the densification of the population makes it easier and faster to make links and create central meeting points. Obviously, the community will grow up with the help of younger people.

I don't really agree with the fact that young people do not give enough time to the community. For example, sometimes in your job, the director asks you to take high responsibilities, even if you didn't choose to, you have to control and help your company. But what we forget is the fact that it is probably for biologic research, and then the community progresses.

To believe that young people are not enough helpful with the community would be wrong; their behavior is different. They stay involved in this huge world.

The idea that students should learn ideas and concepts rather than facts neither looks logical nor rational. I would completely disagree with that idea for a multitude of reasons. I do think that in order for young, growing people to learn the facts of life and science in different specialties, they need to be able to have ideas of their own; otherwise, they will just come up with mixed-up ideas and concepts. So, it is a sort of chronological process. 

I do not think, for example, how a student could come up with a certain invention or innovation in a certain machine or subject without clearly taking in all the basic facts of how this machine works and the basic scientific factors controlling its function, or they may end up with a catastrophe. 

Another reason is that the study of facts broadens the horizon of the student's vision; then, they would be quite capable of finding out the concepts and basic ideas by themselves, by studying how everything in life correctly works. It is only after passing that stage of basic learning that their ability to investigate and relate new concepts and theories develops. 

Young students tend to be arrogant if they believe that they know concepts and ideas, which would be useful only after ensuring they really learn the facts and can use them in the proper context. 

And last but not least, education is an active process, and unless students are forced from their youth to learn hard and are given facts and certain assignments, they would be reluctant to offer anything useful to the world or be aids in the world's progress. 

It is at that young age that students could be taught all the human sciences and knowledge, and if we start by teaching them the facts and basic sciences, we will not end up with an ignorant generation. 

In conclusion, I believe students should be taught facts and basics of sciences rather than merely being given ideas and concepts, as it would not help them enough to proceed in their careers.

The tour guide is a very meaningful word for me, because I am a student from the Institute of Tourism. I should say that having a tour guide in a group while traveling is the best way.

For starters, the tour guide must be a person who lives in the local place of the traveling destination. So, the tour guide should understand the fellow types of habits in that area. Of course, they should be familiar with the beautiful sights and people. For example, my hometown is Shanghai, a city with a deeply rooted history and revolutionary meaning before the last century. I would take a group of travelers to some significant places, like the 'Chenghuang' temple, and the 'Wai Tan' bay, and so on. I can provide them with insights into the varieties of local life, from food to communication.

By the way, I remember a story from my country, where a group of travelers from a foreign country came to Hunan, a province in our country. They stayed there for three days, but they had no guide to lead their travel. The heavy rain caused a flood, and after that, they fell sick. Unfortunately, they had no medical care to attend to them. Fortunately, a local tour guide helped them from danger, because she could communicate with them and found some pills made from a special plant. So, that is why having a tour guide is the best way to travel in a group, even if it could save lives.

Finally, I would like to talk about a tour guide in ancient China, Xu Xiakeng. He once said, 'Don't change your tour proposal, but a guide will help.' These words claim that a tour guide is extremely important to a group, because everyone who wants to travel has the same dream.

Nowadays, cars are a major means of transport. They have been used for over 100 years. Somehow, people are now addicted to cars. It has become an essential thing in our everyday life.

Besides, it's unlikely that people will get rid of that means of transport. There is always something new to learn, to discover. Cars might be technologically advanced in twenty years, but I hardly think there will be fewer cars in use. In Saudi Arabia, people tend to use more and more cars, as every single family has, on average, 2 cars.

Actually, cars need maintenance, energy, and fuel. The only reason that could lead to the decreasing use of cars is the insufficient quantity of petroleum. As we all know, that resource is limited on Earth, and we could run out of fuel in 50 years.

However, human beings are known to be solution finders: we could probably invent new cars that work on another energy, for example, solar energy. Actually, some of these cars are being tested all over the world. That suggests the fact that there is always a solution for every problem.

In my opinion, I think cars are very useful, even though they cause air pollution. They have served humanity for centuries. But, eventually, if there is no more petroleum, cars are useless. That natural factor could be the major reason for the uselessness of that means of transport.

In conclusion, that statement is wrong if there is not that natural factor that stops us from providing energy to make our cars work.

When a product is developed, there must be a way to introduce it to the public, and once it's on the market, a way to increase its popularity and therefore its sales.

This is where advertisement comes in, to make the most sales and profits out of any kind of product, of any quality, and of any actual functionality, and I strongly emphasize "of any quality, and of any actual functionality" since most advertisements make the products seem much better than they really are.

I believe it has happened to all of us that we see a commercial on TV about a product that interests us, mainly because the function it will perform helps us in some way, or makes us more comfortable and happy, but when the product is purchased, it stands far from what we thought it would be or do.

Many people try to look at this as a scam that has been portrayed against them, but the truth is that advertisement was mainly doing its job, which is to attract potential buyers.

The advertisement's purpose is to make you believe that this product is the best in quality, the best in price, and the best in its performance, in other words, it's the best of the best in its kind.

In order for marketing professionals to reach this goal, they must study the behavior of the public this product is being intended for, its interests, its likes and dislikes, and even its dreams and routines, so that the product can be addressed in the most proper way and at the most proper time, presenting it as something that the potential buyer could never live without.

The truth is that some products do live up to their advertisements and to the buyers' expectations, but those are surely not the majority; and in the rest of the cases, I believe we just have to look out and pay very close attention to the real message that is being sent when these advertisements are played and displayed anywhere they are, because even if the marketing professional understands what my desires are and what my behavior might be in front of a certain situation, he or she cannot dictate what I will actually do, only I am in control of myself.

Yes, I think that young people enjoy more than older ones. It may be true that older people have fun, but the feeling of being young is fun. Sometimes I feel that I need to play with dolls, but my ego controls me, especially in front of people. I know I'm young, but within limits, on the other hand, I can do things my mother cannot do. For example, I can use computers, which is something my grandmother cannot do, but my mom can, such as cooking. Being old is a thing we cannot run from; with years, humans lose lots of their life. But if you think of the things old people live with, you will know that every person takes what is his must own of happiness and fun to be fair. Someday I will get enough of fun and wish that I will find fun in my children's eyes. It doesn't have to be something I do; the only thing I think will make younger people have more fun is that they have more time to try and lots of empty places to fill in their memory. Fun is nice, but looking for it is even nicer. I'm out of time, but I still try to pass this; it's hard to look after fun with it.

I totally agree with the given statement because I've taken broad knowledge from my school till college. I think it is very important to have knowledge about the things around you. Studying or specializing in just one subject is not enough in today's world. For example, to become a doctor, a student must not only take science classes like bio, chemistry, physics, and math, but they also have to take some elective classes as well (politics, economics, humanities), in order to understand how things work around them.

I'm an engineering major student; I've completed most of my science classes, but I've also taken classes like history, art, sociology, which helped me to understand the importance of the other subjects. These classes developed the understanding of other topics like politics, history, sociology, and world religion in me. I was very surprised to know how important these other subjects are in order to understand the nature of our society. After taking all these classes, my way of looking/thinking about the people around me, or in other words, the society that we are living in, have changed a lot in a positive way.

Someone who doesn't get a chance to learn about the other subjects finds a hard time getting a job, because their knowledge is just on specific subjects. In the modern world, companies are looking for people who have knowledge of all sorts of fields, rather than having knowledge on just one field. For example, there are more chances for a computer programmer who also has some kind of background in the field of electronics than the other programmer who just knows about his own programming field.

In my opinion, it is really very important for all of us to have knowledge of all aspects of life. If you go to universities, it is very common for a student to have a double major, that means to have a degree in two fields. Because they know what companies are looking for once they graduate. That's a kind of having another tool when others don't work. We should definitely have knowledge of other fields as well.

I think that advertisements are the best way to sell products. I believe that selling and gaining money from a product has a very important and coherent chain. And advertisements play a very important role in this chain because without an advertisement, the product won't be known by lots of people. Then, you will not be able to sell your product to many people because your product is not well known, and also because you didn't sell enough to gain people's trust, so your product is not trustworthy enough. And because of this, you will not gain money. And because you don't have money, you will not be able to produce your goods. And finally, your company will be closed.

If you look at the big companies like Coca-cola, you might understand what I am talking about. Coca-cola today is a huge company and has lots of factories in lots of countries because it introduced itself to the whole world through advertisements. Even in our country, Turkey, they have very big advertisements. In every month, they produce a new 'creative' advertisement to attract people to buy Coca-cola. Because they know that advertisement is a very important and helpful way to introduce new products and also to show and make them remember their old products too. So that's why they put lots of money into advertisements to make people buy their products, even though Coke is a very unhealthy thing.

For another example, fast food advertisements. We all know that fast foods are very unhealthy things for us. They have lots of chemical things that are not needed by our body. But when you watch McDonald's TV advertisement and see a billboard advertisement of Burger King, you immediately think about eating a hamburger and drinking a Coke and eating extremely unhealthy French Fries.

So advertisements make products seem much better than they really are. Even though they are extremely unhealthy and not needed by humans, you immediately want them. But this making-better seller is not just for foods and drinks; it can be a car advertisement, or a game console advertisement, or a clothing company advertisement, or every single thing you think of.

Although some people think that learning facts is important for students, I believe that understanding ideas and concepts is crucial for students. There are two reasons for this: the ability to concentrate and maintaining memory.

To begin with, learning facts is easy. I think that simply listening to a lecture does not necessarily mean people are learning; it is all that some people can do. However, understanding ideas and concepts is not easy. For example, when I understand the idea behind a theory, I have to study very hard. Therefore, understanding is equivalent to studying hard, which improves one's ability to concentrate.

In addition, the things that people spend much time understanding are not easily forgotten. For instance, a theory that I only listened to in science class was soon forgotten. However, when I studied the theory by reading a book about it very hard after class, I did not forget it for a long time.

For these reasons, I agree with the statement that it is important for students to understand ideas and concepts.

As a young person myself, I often feel guilty for spending so little time with the community. I have often noticed that the social bonds between neighbors have diminished in recent years, and people are becoming less caring than before. That's why I think we should definitely spend more time helping our communities.

But how? The main reason nowadays that young people don't spend much time with their communities is that they are crammed with homework, extracurricular activities, entertainment, etc. They are simply not spending a lot of time strolling about the neighborhood. Without any interactions with their neighbors, young people will easily neglect their role as a member of their community. Although they read about community service in their textbooks, few actually participate in it. And when you ask them why, they simply reply, 'I don't have time.'

So if we wish to solve this problem, the first thing to do is to decrease the amount of burden on young people. Schools should end earlier so that young people can spend more time inside the community. Teachers should give their students less work on weekends so they could have adequate time to conduct effective community service. Parents should relieve their child of too many activities and should not force them to go to cram schools. Without these corrections to our education system, schools would end up actually teaching young people not to spend time with the community.

Of course, one might contend that young people will end up spending the extra time playing computer games and not doing community service at all. That might be the case for some kids, but in my opinion, if people felt they were involved in their community, they would try their best to make it better. This sentiment can be further enhanced by government propaganda and social education.

It is everyone's responsibility to bring young people back to community service. They should not simply put the blame on laziness manifested by the younger generation. I pray for a day when the old bonds between neighbors can be re-established.

It has long been discussed whether it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts. I disagree with the statement that it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.

Facts are the things that we see as virtue and are used as the basis of ideas and concepts. You can hardly tell whether the concepts and ideals are true or false, because everyone has their own observations. We know that neither the Earth nor the Sun is the center of the universe, but most people believed that the concept that the Earth is the center of the universe.

Also, concepts and ideals always determine our own thoughts and lead them to the wrong or even opposite way, taking us far away from the truth. It is widely known that the research on brain cells had not made any progress for years since scientists used their outdated concepts and ideals to analyze brain cells. This concept that every kind of brain cell uses electricity to transfer their signals made them totally ignore the importance of other cells.

Last but not least, facts not only provide us with materials to observe but also function as the inspiration of scientists. By learning facts, we can think in our own way and then learn to select the best way of thinking. As we know, men must suffer to be wise. If you suffer from your own thinking and figure out what the facts reflect, you will finally be able to handle the problems that you will face. By this way, people become much more mature, and know the essentials of life, which do not have the concepts of how to live a good life.

I agree with this opinion. Of course, there is also a chance to enjoy older age; however, it is up to the younger age, which people have spent. So I want to point out three points to explain why young people enjoy life more than older people do.

First of all, young people have the power to gain what they want or to achieve some kind of goal. Physically, they are so young that they can work all day without sleeping, sometimes. Besides, they are not too tired after working. It is one of the important things to achieve the goal. Mentally, they don't feel responsibilities for society or family, so they can challenge something important or need to work hard without thinking deeply. If people become parents or need to care for their parents, there is some negative factor to challenge something.

Second, there are opportunities to make them change, study, or grow up. There are chances to take education and study abroad or something. Older people, mostly parents, give younger people time to concentrate on themselves, in other words, to think about themselves. It is the most important thing to grow up and have identification of themselves.

Thirdly, younger people can have time to have communication with many people who have different backgrounds. Older people mostly have jobs, and it is limited to opportunities to communicate with people in the office and people. On the other hand, younger people have the chances to have conversations and have time together with many kinds of people. They have time to go all around the world, and mentally, there is nothing for them to lose. There is only to gain.

I agree with the statement. In my opinion, there is a famous saying that 'to get success, you have to take risk.' I agree with this statement because I feel that success doesn't come without taking risks in life. Today, it's a world of competition, and to compete in this world, you have to try new things to get success.

In order to get success, sometimes you try to find out new ways. By going on those ways, you think you can achieve success, and you often take risks in your life. I feel that if people only do those things which they think they know how to do well, they can get success up to a certain level, but cannot reach the heights of success.

In my opinion, everyone has their own definition of success, and it depends on the person to person, till what extent they can take risks in their own life. For some people, success means peace of mind or a happy life. But for some, success means reaching the heights of the world, to conquer the world, so that person tends to take more risks compared to that person who is happy in their own world, or to that person who has a different meaning for success.

For example, if you take the example of cricket, if a batsman wants to score quick runs, he has to play sloppy shots in order to take quick runs, so he has to take risks. Sometimes he gets success, or sometimes he fails. So, it just depends on the person: is he ready to take the risk in terms of getting success? But I don't think you can buy success without taking risks.

Sometimes I feel that 'success has its negative side.' This question always bothers me a lot. Does success not come without taking risks? Till now, I am not able to find out the answer till date, maybe I have not achieved success yet, but the day when I will achieve success, I will come to know.

So far as the question is concerned, I am not quite at home with the statement that young people do not give enough time to helping their communities. Although it may be argued that the young population is not interested in social and political affairs as it was in the 1960s, I believe that young people have a willingness to help the communities in which they live.

It is a well-known fact that the young population is aware of the communal issues, as they are part of a family that belongs to the community.
