Nevertheless, you have to be careful because in our society, you have to take risks, but if you miss your objective, even with a fall short, the society won't forget it. And you won't be a successful person (for a long time at least).

On the contrary, if you don't take risks, you won't be successful. The society is always moving forward, and if you want to follow and succeed, you cannot remain and wait without changing. So, if you are changing something, you are taking a risk, even if it's a very small risk. If you don't adapt, your business, life, or job could get worse.

From my opinion, a successful person has taken some risks; it's compulsory. There are too many people and too many businesses on earth, so if you want to succeed, you have to take risks. But the border between success and nothing, or even something worse, is very thin. So, you have to take risks, but you have to be very careful. It means the more risks you take, the more chances you have to succeed, but as well, the higher will be the fall if you don't succeed.

In conclusion, I think in our society, the only way to succeed is to take some risks, but to be very careful. Because I think as well, a very good way to lose everything is to take too many risks. It means if you want to be successful, you have to stay within the border between not enough risks and too many. And I think the most successful people keep this border very thin.

As competition increased among companies in almost every market, advertisement became a very important way to improve sales numbers. Companies use a lot of different advertisement techniques. Accordingly, it generally causes them to make their products seem much better than they actually are.

For example, when you watch a girl eating candy or a chocolate, you probably want to eat that product as soon as possible. When you go and buy one, then you understand that it is not as delicious as you desired, but unfortunately, you have almost bought that product, and this has increased the companies' sales once more.

On the other hand, some companies are aware that this will happen only one time. When you use and see the product does not live up to its advertisement, then you lose your trust in that company and never buy its products again. So they are trying to show the true qualities of the product to avoid making the customers disappointed. When they are not disappointed, they always prefer to buy their products.

In conclusion, some advertisements may show the products better than what they exactly are, for improving sales. But some firms can think differently from that and plan a long-term process for their activities. I think the better way is always telling the truth. In that way, people can trust your company, buy your products, and in the future, according to the high sales, your company will most probably be a permanent company.

I disagree that nowadays young people do not give enough time to helping their communities. Because, even if they are very busy doing other things, they still find time to help other people. For instance, there are many things that young people could do to help their neighborhood people, such as taking care of ill people, or old people, or even helping kids after school.

For instance, when I was attending high school, my friends and I worked for the 'Red Cross', which consists of taking care of ill people. It was such a special experience for me, because I could stay in contact with people who really needed me, and it was a pleasure to be able to help them. I did not do a great job; I just gave them attention, I spent time talking with them, and even if it seemed a little, for them it was a lot.

Furthermore, I usually like spending time with my next-door neighbor, she is a very old woman, she is often alone. So sometimes, my boyfriend and I spend some time with her. For instance, it can happen that she needs something, and we usually go to the shop for her. So somehow, I try to help her, even if I do not have a lot of time, but she always appreciates it.

Besides, another way to help people can be looking after kids. When I was in high school, I also usually looked after some kids during the afternoon, at my church. The parents of these kids were always working during the afternoon, so they used to stay with me and other guys. We usually helped them with their homework, or we played some games.

In the end, I can say that from my experiences, young people give a lot of time to helping others, even if life is always more frantic. They take care of others, and I believe that is very important.

Evolution has proven that both specialized organisms and those that have refrained from specializing have endured. Specialists were able to ensure their survival by fitting into a single vacant ecological gap in which they flourished. Unspecialized organisms have to rely on their flexibility, and that is exactly their advantage. Because they are not specialized and are dependent on their flexibility, they are more capable of adapting to a new situation. Organisms that do not adapt die, and eventually, their entire species will become extinct. One can easily project that image onto human fields of knowledge. Being able to build life decisions on a great base of knowledge is more profitable than being specialized in only one field, be it an academic subject or set of ideas and values.

Being able to adapt is of the greatest necessity. It is part of everyone's everyday life; you adapt to the people you talk to, you adapt to the people you work with, and you even adapt to your own family. If you have been specialized in one field, it would probably be the one of greatest interest to you; this does not mean, though, that all the people around you share your enthusiasm about the same subject, which means that one has to be able to talk about other major topics in life. Granted, being a professional specialized in something vital does serve one well in the modern world in terms of economic security, but what good does it do when you possess omnipotent knowledge of one field but are incapable of seeing the connections to another? When the company, in which someone was the specialist for that and only that specific company's computer network, goes bankrupt, he is jobless.

I believe that broadening one's own horizon, be it intellectually or emotionally, more likely grants a secure and fulfilled future.

I strongly disagree with advertisement activities that make products seem much better than they really are. This is a case of manipulating customers' decisions. Sometimes, this concept might go further to demonstrate a status of cheating when mentioning false information about products or giving unreliable guarantees. Companies and goods sellers should talk and describe the actual advantages, features, and services they have. Presenting these items to the customers in an attractive way shall not be considered as a manner of cheating or telling lies. Ways of presenting goods and advertising to them in a proper and honest way include mentioning the components and items utilized to manufacture these goods. Companies utilizing materials with quality might point out how good the materials used in manufacturing are. Another way of fair advertising activities is highlighting the efforts required to produce some good and pointing out the professional and continuous planning to achieve this perfection. Marketing trends in some cultures attract consumers by utilizing cultural concepts (e.g., cultural and traditional sayings as a logo). Another example of fair advertising is studying the trends and behaviors of consumers (e.g., packing children's toys in bright-colored boxes), and we shall not consider this a manner of manipulation whereas no false information is mentioned about this product. By observing international markets, manufacturers and goods sellers all over the world are now trying to give glorious and attractive names to their products, which isn't a sort of decision-makers manipulating. Focusing also on the customers' needs and making purchases pointing out the positive side and promise of fulfilling their requirements can be considered a way of fair promoting to some goods. I do believe that all advertising activities should be carefully studied to give a bright image about any products to the customers without mentioning false information or making them look much better than they really are.

I believe that young people enjoy life more than older people. First of all, the young have much more free time than older people. A typical older person would spend their time at work. Most of the time, older people do not enjoy going to work, but have to go anyway to make a living. On the other hand, the young do not have work and often enjoy their free time with friends or pursuing their interests.

Also, the physical makeup of the young and older people makes a difference in the enjoyment of life. Many young people enjoy their time playing active sports and/or games. However, older people are not physically able to enjoy these active sports or games. The human body is constructed to become weaker and more feeble as it becomes older at a certain age. For example, there was a young man who loved football and became a star high school football player, but thirty years later, he cannot play his favorite sport anymore because of his physical fitness. Even if the old man had kept his physical fitness and played football, he would not fully enjoy the sport as much as he did when he was in high school, since he does not have his old friends to play with.

Another reason is that young people have school, which provides them with an opportunity to find many friends to enjoy their time with. On the other hand, older people have less chance to meet new friends who can give them enjoyment.

I agree with the statement. The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.

People travel in order to enjoy and take a break from their routines. Some people travel for pleasure, but the main reason for traveling is to see new places and meet new people. We cannot meet new people unless we travel in a group, and as far as seeing new places is concerned, we cannot know the history of the places without having someone to tell it to us. A person who has all the knowledge about the past, present, and future of a monument, city, or a country is best equipped to provide this information to a traveler.

Traveling alone does not serve the purpose of traveling itself. We go to new places and want to explore them, but we are unable to do so because we are new to the place and do not know where to go and what to do. A tour guide leads us to the right places and tells us things we would never know if it weren't told to us, especially about historical monuments. There is a reason behind every historical structure ever made, and visiting the structure without knowing when, why, and by whom it was made is like seeing pictures in a book and saying we have read it. Only a tour guide has the knowledge and communication skills to make people more familiar with a new place.

We have heard about the saying 'the more the merrier,' and this is the right way to describe a trip taken in a group. When there are others traveling with us, we not only get to know them and make new friends but they also add to the whole experience of traveling by sharing their backgrounds, cultures, and experiences. The kind of excitement it adds to your trip is worth it. What do people get by traveling alone? Not even half the experiences of the people who travel in a group led by a tour guide. Because they haven't met new people, made new friends, or gathered knowledge about the place they have visited.

For a person like me who loves to talk, make friends, and learn from my experience of traveling to new places with new people, there cannot be a better option for travel other than traveling in a group led by a tour guide.

I disagree that a trip led by a tour guide in a group is the best way to travel.

Surely, if we travel with a tour guide, we can enjoy a trip even if we cannot speak English well, because if we have a problem, a tour guide will help us solve the problem. In addition, we can visit famous places in a good way. It means that we can visit many places without wasting time. At the same time, we will be able to get a lot of knowledge about the places we visit from a tour guide. If we travel with a tour guide, we will enjoy and we will be safe.

However, if we travel with a tour guide in a group, we have to mind the time all the time. If we have free time, we have to come back on time, as the tour guide says. If we want to look around more, we cannot do that if we travel with a tour guide. If we have a place we want to visit, we cannot go there if it is not part of the course, even if it is very near the route. If we travel by ourselves, we do not need to mind the time. We can stay at a place as long as we want. Furthermore, we can make a travel plan as we want. Therefore, we do not need to go to places we are not interested in, and we can go to the places only we are interested in.

In my opinion, planning the trip is one of the enjoyments of the trip. If we make a plan from start to finish, we may have some problems. However, if the trip is finished, we can get a lot of happiness. Therefore, I disagree.

Advertisements almost show the best thing about their product, that it is really good or great. And even advertisements hide the lack of quality of their products and try to show that their product is better than the other product to earn more money from customers. As a result, products seem much better in the advertisement.

For me, advertisements make products look much better than they are. By using famous people, such as players, singers, and artists, that does not make the product good or useful. Therefore, my opinion is to see if the product is good or not is to ask people who use it. If a famous player wears a certain shoe or a singer eats at a restaurant for an advertisement, they do not do that because it's good or great, but because they earn money from it. You can't make a decision until you try it or ask about it.

But if the advertisement shows some facts about the product or records some observations...

The academic knowledge is the information gained starting from elementary school, ending with the higher level of the university.

There are two ways that a student who wants to pursue his graduate studies after finishing his bachelor's degree in any major will face.

The first one is to complete what he has started and in the same major, like what they are saying, 'It's good to know a thing about everything, and to know everything about one thing.'

Or, in the other way on the road, is to change his major and go to another subject.

Some graduate programs are designed for those who want to mix their knowledge and try to open new doors in their life.

For example, some people, who have an engineering background, are going to business school to combine their basic knowledge in problem-solving with the way of applying this knowledge in business.

There are a lot of amazing stories about people who found that it's a good way to explore the world of knowledge in several ways and to see that world through more than one point of view.

I agree with the statement that 'The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide' because, generally, people want to visit different places to relax and learn more about them. If they don't keep a tour guide, they take much time to know about the place. At the same time, if a person goes alone to visit places, he doesn't get interested in watching them and can't express his ideas and thoughts about the place what he sees. If it is the case, that he travels along with a group and with a tour guide, it makes the people's tour successful and happy because the tour guide can explain about the places briefly and interestingly, providing a well-knowledgeable tour guide. If the person travels along with a group, he can have an advantage to express his views and get other views about the place they see.

Generally, tours are included with long time night and day journeys. At this time, the tour guide can decide where to stop the vehicle for emergency and where should not. At the same time, if anything happens to anyone, others can help out in solving the problem they face. By traveling in a group along with a tour guide, they can help each other and make their tour most successful.

During the journey, they face many problems like food, shelter for changing clothes, etc. If the people go on a tour along with a group, they can help out in providing shelter, food, and other small and big problems.

If suddenly the vehicle breaks down and it takes a few hours to repair, then they can have a nice time with their mates. Simply, they pass the time happily and unforgettable. Anyway, that's all depends on the individuals, but going along with a group makes the individual see the things happily and have a great scope to have good knowledge about the place what they see.

If we take an example of an industrial tour of engineering students, like Tata Motors in India, etc. There, I definitely prefer to go along with a group because they have to recollect their subject when they see the industry. At the same time, your professor acts as a tour guide. No one can recollect the information at that moment what they studied, but if you go with a group, they can share their own knowledge with others, such that they can see the things more interestingly and gain more knowledge. Similarly, if an office staff wants to improve their industry, there it is need to visit higher industries and make points what should improve in their industry. This is possible only when he goes along with teammates and a guide. He can point out very good things if he discusses the things with his mates. At the same time, he need not spend much time to know the unknown thing as a guide is provided for them.

Thus, I can strongly agree that the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.

Nowadays, young people have changed a lot; their education has changed, and they have changed with it. It is supposed to be a more liberal education with fewer rules and more freedom, but maybe we are giving freedom to people who are not ready to use it properly yet.

What I wanted to say with that is that young people today spend more time looking at themselves than trying to be part of society.

Maybe it is because they are living in a society that does not offer them what they are looking for, and for that reason, they are not in the mood to participate in their communities.

We are living in the telecommunications era. You can live without human touch, without going out of your own house. Most young people think that their community is too small for them, so they use the internet to feel they are part of something really great, to feel important. They do not mind if their neighbor needs salt or if their hometown is clean or not. They are above all that.

As an example, I can use a new kind of culture that I read about in a magazine last week. It is a new way of life, very extended in Japan, and their philosophy of life is not to have any personal relations if it is not via the internet. So they break off with their families and with their friends and start living all by themselves. Using the internet for everything, for working, making their shopping, making friends, and all the natural things that we are used to doing in our lives.

Hearing things like that, I have got the hope that maybe in the future, young people will help their communities, maybe they would be cyber-communities, but the main idea is to be part of something.

I agree with this statement. Advertising is an art, an art of making products seem attractive and perfect. It is also the art of convincing consumers to buy the product. Consumers who are not wise enough or who are too influenceable buy products because of the advertisements.

First of all, I would say that advertisement companies tend to have a lot of money, so they can make beautiful, attractive advertisements. They have a lot of means to attract the consumer. TV advertisements are the easiest way to convince a consumer to buy your product, whereas written advertisements in newspapers, for example, are less convincing because they are not interactive. On TV ads, you can see people using, eating the product the company is selling. They reach the consumer more easily.

Secondly, advertisements are made to make products seem better than they are in real life. It is an art. For example, when you see an advertisement for a frozen pizza, the pizza always looks hot, savory. Usually, you can see the cheese melting, whereas when you buy it and heat it up, it is nothing compared to that advertisement; it is a normal frozen pizza, not a homemade one.

Thirdly, advertisement is a lure for consumers. People do not buy a product for its consistency but for the way it looks in the ad. Sometimes, ads tend to lie about the qualities of the product, for example, toothpaste that makes your teeth white as snow, or a soap that eliminates all the imperfections of a teenage skin.

To conclude, I would say that advertisements make products seem much better than they really are because it is one of the goals of advertising, the first one being to sell a product. But to sell a product in huge quantities, you have to make it special, better than the others, attractive, or even emphasize the results of this product.

Nowadays, people, regardless of their age, are selfish because of the values conveyed by modern society and capitalist values.

Indeed, everybody thinks about themselves, so young people have grown up in this atmosphere of 'me and myself.' Life goes fast, and we want to pursue and achieve our plans because today everything is planned in advance, and there is no time for civic behavior.

In addition, globalization and internationalization have made the population mix, as there are more mixed communities, and people have an identification problem: which community for which people? Regarding recent events, communities are rivals and fight between them. So, there is no unity in this world; why would young people change this by helping who and with which means?

Modern life makes young people very narcissistic and selfish, but some want to implicate themselves in a cause, in something they can progress and be useful. Some will help the oldest and disabled people in their neighborhood by doing their shopping for them. Others will come into an association to create a better life place for their community.

Indeed, some associations and organizations have social aims in which young people want to be involved.

In my case, I really want to represent Blacks in France because there is a lack of representation, even in media, fashion, intellectual, and scientific work. So, I went to Boucle d'Ebene association, which promotes African and Caribbean entrepreneurs, even though I have my studies and different things to manage before helping them.

To conclude, I agree with the fact that there is a lack of motivation among young people to involve themselves in social and civic activities to help their communities. In fact, they seem to be overbooked by their stuff, such as school, work, friends, and early childhood responsibilities. Indeed, nowadays young people have much more responsibilities than fifty years ago! But the reality is that there are a lot of young people who want to change some things in this world by giving time to helping their community. However, sometimes they do not have the means to achieve their project, such as creating an association or a company, and sometimes they are dissuaded by the lack of recognition and credit they are given.

In these days, a lot of people, especially old people, claim that young people do not have enough time to help their communities. The old people around me are complaining about the same problem. However, I do not share their idea. In my opinion, young people try to give time to help charity, but they haven't got enough time because of the rush of the twentieth century. Young people have a lot of work to do but not enough time to spend in this century. However, they spend a lot of time on their communities. For instance, they are visiting their family in every celebration. If they have, they give it to the poor people. For example, last night on a television show, a lot of people gave money to a charity to plant trees, and most of the people who gave money to charity were young people. Actually, there wasn't any old people there. This is a remarkable point; a lot of people say young people are guilty about this topic, but maybe old people are guilty. There is an adage that comes from the Hittites; in a Hittite paper, an old person was complaining about young people. It shows that complaining about young people has never changed. The people living in the twenty-second century may complain about young people too. However, it doesn't mean young people are not giving enough time. In conclusion, the young people living in the twentieth century give enough time to their community, even though they have got a lot of jobs to do. We can see this from the television shows, or if we look at history, we will see the same complaints. This is a typical thing, so the old people have to get rid of their complaints.

According to many people, there will be fewer cars in use in the future than today. Environmental problems are linked with the huge number of cars in the world. Pollution has become a central problem in our societies. In order to respond to this problem, governments focus on many possible solutions, such as the limitation of cars in cities. As an example, the mayor of London has introduced a congestion charge in the center of London in order to limit the number of cars. As far as I am concerned, I think that this solution is very convincing, as it has been proved that the number of cars has been reduced in the city.

Moreover, public transports are supported by many governments. The cost of underground is very cheap in some countries, such as France. I would rather take the bus or the tube instead of driving my car. On the other hand, the cost of driving licenses has considerably increased during the last years. As a result, people are more likely to take the bus or to use the underground than before.

However, emerging countries such as India or China are not ready to reduce their production of cars. Most of their economy is based on this production. Therefore, environmental issues are not the priority of governments. Although these countries are aware of cars' pollution, they do not take preventive measures in order to solve this problem.

But many measures have been taken in order to face this problem. The Kyoto Protocol illustrates the capacity to deal with the huge problem of pollution in the world. The problem is that many industrial countries did not sign this protocol.

To conclude, I think that we can hope that there will be fewer cars in use than there are today, because governments make us aware that cars represent a huge scourge for our societies. As a consequence, many measures have been taken and will be taken in order to reduce car activity. However, even though many things have been done, the number of cars will increase because many poor countries need this economy in order to survive.

I disagree with the opinion that in twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today, even though, all over the world, we are considering the environment, and oil is decreasing.

I know that there were some agreements about gas production by cars. Cars are very bad for the environment because they run on gas, which pollutes the earth's air. Many countries promise that they are going to reduce gas emissions from cars in the present day. My country, Japan, also did, and now we are trying to implement this plan. However, I do not see this being successful, and people who are using cars do not care about it at all.

I also hear that oil is not going to last anymore. Now, most cars in this world run on oil. Actually, there are electronic cars, but it is unfeasible to use them because it takes time to charge, so we still use cars running on oil. I think that there will still be some oil in twenty years.

Cars are absolutely useful. We can go anywhere at any time by car. People living in metropolises might not need cars, but people living in rural areas have to use cars to live. They live far away from grocery stores, malls, and their workplaces. Needless to say, we need individual cars. We cannot use public transportation systems such as buses and trains because it may be faster to transport ourselves than to use public transportation. In addition, most of us will keep using individual cars.

I think that there are not enough reasons to reduce car usage because we do not care about the environment; we care only about ourselves. Electronic cars are not useful, and I do not think electronic cars will become useful. Actually, people really need cars.

Travelling in a group led by a tour guide presents many advantages. First, you can share and exchange your opinions and feelings on the sites you visit with your groupmates. It is often very enjoyable and refreshing to listen to other people's feedback.

Second, the tour guide takes you only to locations that matter the most or that are the most representative of the country visited. Therefore, you avoid wasting time deciding where to go and whether the designated location is worth visiting. The guide is often a great source of important information about the visited site. He can turn the visit into a very interactive way, something you couldn't get from a book.

Finally, the tour and the guide make the travel much more enjoyable as everything is already planned. There is no need to bother with organization details and unexpected events. Everything is handled by the guide and the tour company.

However, travelling in a group and with a tour guide may also have some disadvantages. In my eyes, being in a group means that you no longer master your time. Unless you are selfish and impose your ideas on others, you cannot do what you want. You have to stay within the bounds and respect other people's wishes. And listening to someone whining the whole day because the schedule does not please them is indeed extremely annoying.

Besides this, a tour means everything is already planned. There is therefore no room for sudden changes of schedule or unexpected locations to visit. The excitement might be undermined. If the tour company provides poor services or the guide lacks knowledge about the location, then your experience may turn out to be very disappointing and frustrating. Another very bad habit of touring companies and guides is the fact that they often take you to locations, restaurants, museums with which they have a partnership, a deal, so you are invited to purchase items in those locations and not others. Personally, I dislike very much those practices as I have the feeling of being a kind of toy in their hands.

My best advice is to choose carefully the tour company. To rely on other people's feedback, friends, in order to determine which tour company suits our wishes and needs best. About the group, my suggestion is to welcome things as they come and always focus on what pleases you the most, and to sweep away any little annoying detail.

Although some may believe that young people nowadays give plenty of time to helping out their communities, I believe they do not. There are two main reasons: their attitude and lack of time.

Firstly, young people nowadays do not have the attitude or motivation to help out their community, as they believe it has no benefit for them. These young people believe they do not need to help out their community, as they think others will do it instead of them, or it is simply a waste of time. I believe they do not understand the moral of helping the community in need. Furthermore, young people nowadays are a lot lazier than they used to be, and so they lack the motive, as they consider helping the community to be 'work', and, as we all know, young people tend to dislike work as it is not enjoyable. This motive is probably influenced by school work, which is more of a requirement rather than a choice.

Secondly, the fact that the world is becoming more competitive and also a lot more interesting, youngsters are becoming more involved in other activities and their studies rather than contributing towards their communities. These young people may have objectives such as going to the best universities or simply enjoying life by relaxing, and, in my personal experience, I have never come across a young individual who actually wants to give their time to help their communities. As a result, as young people prefer to spend their time in a different way, there are very few who feel they should help out their communities.

In conclusion, as young people are not tempted to help the community, as it is not enjoyable, and the fact that they have better, perhaps more important things that must be done, young people nowadays do not give enough time nor effort to helping their communities.

In our century, advertising is everywhere. We have to deal with and be aware of advertisement's tricks. To my mind, most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

Indeed, the aim of an advertisement is to sell a product. That is why they are ready to say everything that can convince you to buy it. People who do advertising have no duty to say the truth; their goal is only commercial, not educative. So how can we trust advertising?

To illustrate this fact, we can take the example of McDonald's. If we look at an advertisement for this restaurant, we can learn that meals are usually very dietetic, they are not bad for the health, and pictures of meals are really teasing. But according to the experience made on McDonald's food in Supersize Me, we can see that this food is not good for the health.

To give another example, we can consider makeup advertisements. Women who play in these advertisements are models, and if we put on this makeup, we will not look like the model. Moreover, on her, the rimel seems to be something very efficient, but on us, it does not have the same effect! So the product works better on TV or in an advertisement than in real life.

It is usually the same for washing products, which wash our clothes more white than white.

We have to keep in mind that the advertising world is an imaginary world where everything is perfect. That is not supposed to reflect reality. That sells us dreams, and that is what we buy when we buy a product after having seen its advertisement. Indeed, all is fake on an advertisement; people are retouched, they always seem happy, and think everything is delicious or amazing.

To conclude, we can say that, yes, advertisements usually make products better than they really are because their main stake is to sell something and not to be true.

Traveling is a very nice thing; it helps you see new cultures and to meet new people. There are a lot of ways for traveling, and I believe that the best way is to travel with a group led by a tour guide. Because when you go to a new country, you will need someone to guide you around; you will never know where to go or what to do alone. Only if you had someone to guide you to show you the best and the most important parts of the city you are in, the guide will have a plan to show you everything in the city, so you won't miss a thing. And also, if you needed help, he can help you, or if you don't speak the language of that country you are in, he can help you with that. For example, if you were in Paris and you don't speak French, what can you do if you were alone? At that time, a guide would help you a lot. And to be with a group is so much fun than being alone; that's where you can meet new people, make new friends, and enjoy your time. It's also much cheaper to travel with a group rather than traveling alone, so it would save you a lot of money. For example, if you wanted to go anywhere, you will have to take a cab, but if you were with a group, you can go on the bus; it would be much cheaper. That's why I agree that traveling with a group led by a tour guide is the best way to travel.

The author says that young people enjoy life more than older people do. Yes, I will agree with this statement because older people came from a younger generation only, hence it is possible to agree with the statement.

Firstly, young people will enjoy more than older people because from an early age, a born baby does not know about life. After some years, the child will go to school, which is an institution, and from there, he will learn some things. Afterward, when he reaches a certain position, he will be enjoying with his friends, and they will be close to each other as well. They will help each other, and it is important for every person.

Hence, it is a must because when he will be in a problem, friends will only help sometimes, and parents will not do so at that time. And hence, it happens when it is true friendship. When there will be any occasion, all the friends will meet, they will enjoy with parties, and all will celebrate and enjoy. That is the age to enjoy life and do whatever he wants because the past never comes, and in such a way, all should enjoy.

Whenever there is a holiday, people will go to the cinema, which will be full entertainment, as well as games like cricket; all will play if they have holidays. It is a nice and interesting game, and going to the picture with friends is a nice enjoyment. All will be happy at that moment, and they will dance in theaters, and it is a nice enjoyment. Hence, in every festival, all the friends will meet, and they will spend their day at that place.

While in college, there will be competitions, sports, entertainment, and we can participate and enjoy. We can go to tours with college or with our own way for a week, therefore, we can enjoy the climate in the same while enjoying, and we should also study.

While the exam date will come near, we should prepare for exams, and also, we should prepare well for the exams. If we don't know anything, our friends will be helpful in such a way that we can write exams successfully.

Whereas older people cannot do this, which means that when they come to an older age, they should not eat every item, and they should take medicine daily. It is a problem, and also for them, there will be tensions, and they will be in a hurry in each field. Hence, at last, I say that older people also come from a younger age, and they also enjoyed, but it is a fact that every person should enjoy his life in a successful way.

Some people believe that it is better for students to understand ideas and concepts than to learn facts. They think that students benefit by studying others' ideas and concepts and using them as a directory in their lives and educational journey. They may use, as an example, the old concept about the shape of the earth and how it was held until it was approved.

I totally disagree with this concept for many reasons. First of all, these concepts and ideas might be wrong, so it is ridiculous to make students hold them. In contrast, we can let them develop their own under our observation. Also, some of these concepts are harmful. For example, until recently in my cultural background, people inherited and believed the stories about how certain tribe members were able to come back after their death.

The third reason opposing this concept is that students are the future. At the time they will be in charge, they need their own ideas and concepts to deal with it because every new day the world changes.

In conclusion, I disagree with the statement because of the variation in the reliability of the ideas and concepts' content, the possibility of it being harmful, and to allow them to develop their own.

For my part, I disagree with the idea that there will be fewer cars in use than there are today. This goes back to a variety of reasons. Primarily, cars today are indispensable to go to work for a lot of people. Secondly, cars are more than that; their use is comfortable. What also matters a lot is the lack of an alternative. And there are no factors prospected that could change the need of cars during the next twenty years.

First of all, cars are necessary for many people to reach their place of work. Both of my parents can only get to work by car since the ways are too individual and partly too wide to make use of public transportation.

If you consider big cities, you cannot always make use of public transportation. Especially in smaller cities, where public transportation may only exist in small or even does not exist at all, and taking a bike is not possible either, you really need a car.

Furthermore, I cannot see any reason why this state of being should change during the next twenty years.

There will be no doubt. Having a car to get from one place to another is - with few exceptions - the fastest and therefore most comfortable way. Since people desire gaining all amenities possible, they supposedly will not give them up voluntarily.

Everyone who once had the comfort of owning a car appreciates it. So I can see no reason in the future why this would change, either.

Lastly, we lack an alternative. There is no more convenient way to travel, and there are so many jobs in the car business. A decrease in consumption would help to kill many thousand jobs. Worldwide, car-producing industries hold so many jobs. Their falling apart would be fatal. Furthermore, the world inhabits a very strong lobby concerning the oil business, which will be interested in a further need and consumption of their oil.

Here, another job-giving area exists that many people depend on. I cannot see that the influence politicians might change that.

Still, a lot of cars are sold, and, in my opinion, will be sold. The world population does decrease in the industrial states slightly, but it will not have the effect that less cars will be in use in twenty years.

Considering the facts, it may be a good thing if there were fewer cars, for this would help our environment get healthier again. Even so, the need and lacking alternatives will not change the amount of cars during the next twenty years.

We are living in an age of information, where human knowledge of its surroundings has boosted and continues to accelerate even more rapidly. One can tell that today an average high school student, with an average level of education, knows better physics than Newton. With so much information accumulated, the urge for scientists to specialize in one area to contribute to that area gets more and more significant. There are two major points related to this issue.

Firstly, as mentioned above, the accumulation of knowledge in a single area has increased so much that it is impossible to have some discovery on top of it without having a grasp of all prior information. For instance, while most people still have difficulties understanding Einstein and his Relativity Theory, scientists are introducing theories that even extend it, having given a lifetime of study in that subject only. Specialization in a specific topic seems to be the only way of studying science professionally.

Secondly, one can say that it is required to have a broad knowledge of many fields to be able to work on a specific topic since scientific fields are highly interconnected and interdependent. This is, of course, true to some extent. There are many general topics to cover until one has the capacity of advancing to a specialized topic, but that does not stand against the fact that academic subjects are now so complex that one cannot afford distributing his effort among various subjects. In fact, the current education system in most countries in the world is so designed: an introductory undergraduate program covering all the required subjects as a baseline, and then graduate studies specializing in a specific subject with the purpose of academic research.

In conclusion, whether to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects or to specialize in one specific subject is an important question. While each one has advantages over the other, it seems that specialization is nearly an obligation of modern science regarding its depth and complexity. Specialization is inevitable and must be pursued by every academician, but also not ignoring the background knowledge of the prerequisite subjects.

An increasing number of students realize that it is more important for them to understand ideas and concepts. Unfortunately, there is a growing opposition among other students who maintain that learning facts is the most important factor in their studies. However, in the final analysis, I conclude that the former one does make sense.

In the following discussion, I would like to present some points to support my statement.

In the first place, the key point for my view is that understanding ideas and concepts undoubtedly allows students to cultivate their ability of self-study, which plays the most important role in their studies. Actually, the final aim of students studying in the university is to promote their sense of independent thinking. For example, in their beginning studies, they need a teacher to guide them. But in their future studies, they must deal with problems by themselves. Of course, they need to practice their capability to solve problems when they understand ideas and concepts in class.

In addition, students can understand ideas and concepts by themselves to check out what they have learned in class. It is beneficial for them to build up their self-confidence.

Furthermore, it is the best way to supervise students. If they cannot understand ideas and concepts, they would fail the exam in the end.

Given the reasons above, which sometimes intertwine to form an organic whole and thus become more persuasive, we can arrive at the conclusion that inspiring students to master the ability to understand ideas and concepts in class must be undertaken by teachers. Only by this way can we implement quality education; only by this way can we enhance the self-confidence of students, and only by this way can we supervise students' study in an efficient way.

I fully agree with the statement because of the following reasons. 

First, an already successful person will accept a higher risk because they have a larger security net if they fail. When the new thing produces a loss, they still have the gains from the successful actions they took before. So, they have a lower risk than a person who could lose everything by experimenting with new things.

Secondly, the hunger for success grows with the success one has. A successful person knows that there has to be more than what they have already achieved. The known old patterns will only provide the known old amount of success. But to increase it, there have to be found new, unknown, and maybe also unfamiliar kinds of ways, which mostly have a higher risk but also a higher possible gain than the conventional ones. If someone has a risky character, they will not stop at the first success but look for more throughout their life.

The third, and I think most important, argument deals with experience and the fear of the future. If a person has been successful at least once in their life by taking a risk, they have made an important step. By crossing the border in one's own mind once, the next time it will be easier because you get a kind of imagination of what is waiting for you on the other side. Of course, there is no possible calculation with all risks; there will always be some that one did not think about. Despite that, the person knows how to deal with developments that cannot be foreseen, so they have no or at least less fear of them.

These arguments show why success on a high level is not possible without risks at a high level, and therefore, I agree with the given statement.

My instant reaction on reading the statement was to get defensive and write about how there are several shining examples of youngsters helping their communities. However, I was forced to change my mind as the more I pondered over the statement, the more I realised that it is sad, but true.

Young people are often so caught up in their own lives that it has become increasingly difficult to pull them away from their own agenda and try to get them interested in activities that they do not consider 'fun' or 'cool'.

This can be clearly seen even by the amount of time that young people spend with their own families. We find ourselves resorting to using fast but impersonal modes of communication like email and instant messaging even with our parents and siblings. The amount of human interaction has surely decreased. So, where's the question of helping out one's community?

However, I think that the main problem is that most young people do not really know how to help their communities. They might also be hesitant as they feel they have nothing special that they can contribute to the community. Once this myth is dispelled, I think that more youngsters might find joy and pride in being part of something bigger than themselves, their community.

Young people, with their natural energy and enthusiasm, can come up with bright and innovative ways of helping their community. This can be done in simple but useful ways, such as tutoring some of the younger kids in the neighbourhood, or making a little old lady's day by visiting her in the old-age home, or even going all out and organising an event for the whole community to take part in.

Therefore, while I do agree with the statement, I also have faith in younger people that they can and they will put their iPods down for a while and devote enough time to help their communities. Since no amount of compelling or nagging young people to help out will work, it would be more effective to teach by doing. I feel this can be achieved by getting the whole community involved in a project that everyone finds interesting and can take pride in.

I agree only partially with the statement that broad knowledge in many academic subjects is better than specializing in one specific subject. In my opinion, it is not enough to have a vast knowledge in one subject. People tend to be narrow-minded if they do not know about any subject but their specific one. A mathematician, for example, can make up a theoretical statistic about the spread of a disease, but they will have to conclude certain irregularities to show the real process.

Furthermore, a certain amount of basic knowledge is important for everyone to participate in daily discussions or to build up a political attitude, for instance. And every employer expects basic knowledge from their potential employees, for example, about the current political and economic situations.

Therefore, it is definitely important to be familiar with more than one single topic. Nevertheless, it is obvious that students have to concentrate on one academic topic if they want to compete with others in a job. They have to know as much as possible about this one specific subject and they have to pay attention to learn about the newest changes and innovations in this subject.

And apart from the competitiveness, in some situations, it could also be very dangerous if someone has only broad knowledge of a subject. A doctor with broad knowledge of medicine, for example, is the worst imaginable danger.

Apart from that, the whole service sector is based on the fact that people know about one single topic in detail while others know about another. Nobody can learn enough about every subject; professionals would be superfluous.

To draw a conclusion, students should specialize in one specific subject and, apart from that, they should learn as much as possible about other subjects. Everybody should use their talent to the greatest extent.

Yes, I do agree with the statement that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are. Because without having advertisements, how can we know about the product?

For example, take a product like oats, which is used as a food item that we can have with hot water and mixing milk and sugar. It can be shown in a TV ad by featuring a reputed person, such as a sports personality, film actor, or model.

The play must be for 30 seconds only, and in that time, we must show all types of things, like what oats contain and how it is useful for daily users, by performing and adding within 30 seconds, showing the emblem of the product.

The advertisement should be shown globally to people.

Giving an advertisement for a product gives a complete picture or use of the product, which should be seen by people.

A product should have import and export value based on its demand.

The product should gain demand by showing proper advertisements.

People should have a proper idea about the product, and they should believe it by seeing a proper advertisement.

This means that the advertisement should impress the demanders.

Advertisements should be shown globally, where we can find the demand.

Advertisements should have a proper theme that impresses consumers, and they should be attracted by seeing that. There are many ways to sell a product by giving attractive gifts on using advertisements, showing that if the product is bought, you can have gift coupons worth x/Rs.

The whole advertisement should activate and gain more demand.

Advertisements play a major role in selling a product.

Because a product should show in real, and the caption shown below in small letters indicates that this play is performed by experts, so please do not follow the same. This means it indicates true but not real.

One good example is that cigar sales are shown on TV advertisements, but on packets, it will return 'SMOKING IS INJURIOUS TO HEALTH.'

This is the best example of how advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

Yes, I am totally in agreement with the notion that it is better to travel in a group instead of traveling alone led by a guide. Actually, in today's materialistic world, there are more safety concerns than ever before. So, it is a wise decision to travel in a group. 

For example, if a person travels to a new town or country and does not know anything about the new place. Then, it is better for him to travel in a group because it lessens his chances of being confused in an unknown place. A person could face a lot of difficulties in a new place, like where to stay, have food, and sometimes he may encounter language problems. So, traveling in a group with a guide will be a helpful option. 

Traveling in a group led by a guide is a very good choice, because the guide is familiar with the local language and culture, which helps a lot. Actually, traveling with a guide enhances your joy of the trip because he can tell you a lot about the places you are touring. Further, it is also cheaper and more economical to travel with many people. Because in a group, everybody is contributing to the whole cost, which is mostly less than the cost of traveling alone. 

Exploring an exotic place alone is not a good option because sometimes there are few minor problems regarding security, which may be encountered by a single traveler. For instance, like a person is going to catch a train in a railway station and someone steals his purse, then he feels that he is in a critical dilemma. Actually, there are a few thieves who attack alone and new travelers. But if you are traveling in a group, they cannot dare to steal your things, or you can complain to your group members. 

Basically, traveling alone in a new and unknown place is always a risky task; one should have to be very careful about himself as well as his luggage too. On the other hand, traveling in a group secures a person from these minor problems. 

In conclusion, it is a good and intelligent idea to travel in a group with a guide. It makes you safer and allows you to enjoy your journey.

I agree with the statement that young people enjoy life more than older people. Young people generally have great verve and energy. Whereas older people cannot enjoy life with such an attitude. Young people normally enjoy their life while doing their mundane jobs. But old people will do their jobs by creating unwanted stress around them. Health is wealth. If you are fit and fine, then only can you live your life in the most hilarious manner. But old people are often surrounded by such kinds of ailments pertinent to age, which restrict them from enjoying.

I have great respect for my grand aunt, who is an inhabitant of our street. I have been watching her since I was in the 5th class. She was very active and alert at that time. She had a little problem because of diabetes, but she had overcome any kind of stress and problem at that time. Now, the conditions have changed. Most of the time, she is not even able to walk properly. She is suffering from such kinds of ailments which are very painful. Whenever I watch her, I can easily understand the savour of young life. Young people readily overcome most of the ailments because of the proper physiological function of their body.

The other factor that makes old people lethargic towards life is 'Pessimism'. Old people do not prefer to work after the age of 55 or 60, which causes these people to become sluggish and prone to various dreadful diseases. Young people are always ambitious about their career and goals, which motivate them to enjoy life rather than take it as a burden.

Young people prefer to socialize and make friends with whom they can go to dance bars, hotels, etc. Old people like loneliness. My grand aunt previously was fond of parties and get-togethers. But now, she disdains such kinds of crowds and prefers to live in disgruntled conditions. Young people emancipate themselves from all kinds of bondages and live life with a vivacious attitude. In short, the normal functioning of the body and the optimistic attitude of young people make them so that they can enjoy their life.

I personally believe that experience and practice are what make a person perfect, according to the proverb 'Practice makes perfect.'

One needs to have some sort of experience in an area to be successful; for example, a previous mistake or a wrong decision that has been made.

To begin with, I would like to give an example of my personal experience. In the summer of 2007, I had dislocated my knee during a physical education class at school. We were playing kickball, and it was my turn to kick the ball and run. Due to the slippery floor of the court, I had slipped and almost broke my left leg. It took me a large amount of time to start walking, running, and even sitting again, and the doctor had forbidden me from playing any sorts of sports again, as there was a big risk that the same accident would happen again. However, I did not listen to the doctor's words and started playing basketball, my favorite sport, as soon as I was able to run again. I even joined the Varsity Girls Basketball Team of my school. Now the season is over, and I am glad that I took the risk. However, if I hurt myself again, I would never regret what I did, because I would take a lesson out of it: not to disobey my parents and my doctor again.

Another example of taking risks and trying new things would be joining the chess club of my school. I had never played chess in my entire life, but as soon as I joined the club, my knowledge of logical thinking has flourished. I enjoy playing the game, even outside of the club, and I am proud that I took the risk and joined the club, even though I was nervous and shy at the beginning.

Some people tend to hate seafood, while others cannot live without it. I believe this is a matter of choice and sometimes a matter of experience. Disregarding people who have allergies, an ordinary human being would enjoy eating something if they were raised eating it. I am a seafood fanatic and therefore adore eating Japanese food. Sushi, the most common type, is something I eat every week. Some of my friends, however, highly dislike sushi. My best friend at school had never tried eating sushi in her life, but she told me about her hunger for seafood several times. Therefore, I took her to a Japanese restaurant once, trying to convince her to eat sushi. She did not want to eat it at first; however, when she tried it, she absolutely loved it. Now, every week, my friend and I go to our favorite destination, the Japanese Restaurant.

Experience is something that happens once in a lifetime and can be used numerous times for different things. I believe that trying new things and taking risks, such as visiting different countries and riding the fast train in an amusement park, will expand a person's overall knowledge and turn them into an open-minded person.

I believe that most advertisements make products seem better than they really are. This is because the kind of things shown in advertisements do not take into account real-life conditions, and to differentiate products from other competitors, they are hyped for their goodness.

Firstly, advertisements make products seem better than they really are because when an advertisement is made, it does not account for real-life conditions. For example, when an advertisement for a bike is shown, the advertisers do not take into account the braking, stopping, and idling of the bike when they show the mileage of the bike, which most of the time never turns out to be actually achievable at all. With the hyped mileage quoted in the advertisement, the product, in this case the bike, seems to be better than it really is, as it cannot deliver the quoted mileage of the advertisement.

Secondly, companies intentionally make good advertisements of their products that are better than they really are to differentiate their product from the other products available from other companies. By doing this, they try to create a branding and a niche for their product, which is very similar to the other product. Take, for example, laptop companies like Acer and HP, which show the ease of work and graphics display that would not cause eye strain. But in actuality, it does, and is very similar to the other product.

Ultimately, advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

I agree with the statement. It is more important to understand the ideas and concepts. Learning the facts without understanding the bottom line of it doesn't make sense. It doesn't help people to improve themselves and derive the point from the facts. For example, learning about science, if we don't know the basic idea behind the fact, we never get the connection between the related facts.

Besides, if we don't teach our students the concepts behind the facts, we would just develop a bunch of encyclopedias for the future, not an efficient and smart generation. They have to know the reasons, factors, consequences, and developments about the facts. Only knowing the fact doesn't stand for much. There is something before the fact and something after the fact. If they know both parts, it makes sense and draws a picture in their mind. It will fly and never be stable in mind without it.

Also, it is really necessary for students to know the concepts behind the facts to make it easier for them to understand easily. Think about it. When they are learning about gravity, if you don't explain the factors, reasons, and just tell them the ground is pulling us, what would they understand? Probably nothing.

In conclusion, humans always look for reasons, results, and factors. They want to know why. So, for students, it's important to know ideas and concepts.

Nowadays, there is a discussion about youngsters. It is about whether young people give enough time to helping their communities. In my opinion, young people do not give enough time to helping their communities, as it was in the past. At our time, there are lots of things that youngsters can waste their time with.

Firstly, most young people are wasting time with computers. Computers were made for people's good at first, but then they started to become a toy or a game machine, and no one tried to stop it, because games are a seriously large economic resource for the people working in this sector. For example, young people can try using computers and the internet for searching for information about their country's place in the world and feature predictions about their country. Furthermore, this interest would make young people more interested in their communities.

Secondly, I think that young people are not taking the lessons at their schools seriously enough. There are important lessons given to students at school about their communities, like history and geography. In my opinion, every person related to a community should know their country's history. Also, geography is an important factor for a person to help their community. These are just two factors for a person to help their community that the education of them is given at school. Moreover, school gives the education of loving your country, after your family. These are all well known by people, but, however, still people are not taking it seriously and thinking of schools as game fields.

Young people are like diamonds. You should shape them; otherwise, you cannot expect anything from them. They have to be shaped if they are wanted to be the saviors of the community. So if a youngster does not give enough time to help their community, it is also their family's fault.

The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide, a statement I can totally agree with, and my opinion is based on several factors.

First off, the main reason for traveling usually is to explore the place visited and see the beautiful attractions in it. That's why it is necessary to find a professional and experienced local to guide you to the places, because he knows his job and he knows what he's doing, so he would, with no doubt, take you to the places often admired by tourists, like beautiful scenes and natural beauties.

For example, I remember when I went with my family to Egypt. I remember we met this young woman who was appointed to meet us as our tour guide. I can't find words to describe how excellent her choices were and how greatly we were satisfied with the places we saw and the activities we took part in, since we saw most of the breathtaking attractions in Giza, like the Pyramids, Sphinx, and the national museums in that area, where we had a short lesson about hieroglyphs. Also, getting a tour guide who's also local can make a splendid combination, because you can't find someone who'd try hard to show you places in his town to make you love the place like a local.

Secondly, by getting a touring guide, you can avoid a great deal of trouble you may face if you were all alone. Touring guides are often accompanied by security guards who are common and familiar with situations that can cause some tourists unhappiness, or make them uncomfortable, or, in worst cases, be in danger, such as getting caught in overwhelming traffic, being lost, getting a great deal of disturbance from beggars, or even, in worst cases, being endangered by tourist-targeting criminals.

So that's why I do think that tour guides are a must, instead of going solo, getting unsatisfied with what you see, and giving the place you visit a bad name as a result of that choice you've taken.

There are many advantages in any field of knowledge. They have some connection with each other. If students only learn one specific area, that will lead to misunderstandings of some parts of academic subjects. In my opinion, I agree that people are better off having broad knowledge of many academic subjects than specializing in one specific subject.

Some academic subjects need students to know other subjects first. Otherwise, they could not totally understand its meaning or how to figure out the answer. For example, students have to know mathematics first and then they can use it in an accounting class. On the other hand, if people have broad knowledge, they can understand what the newspaper is talking about. They also can join any kind of topic to share their opinion. If people only concentrate on their area, they will lose many chances to know new friends.

People specializing in one area is good for their careers in the future because they can deeply understand their professional knowledge. As a matter of fact, after graduation, people can gain more specific knowledge when they work. It would be better than learning specific knowledge in school, so they don't need to focus on it. If students learn a specific subject in university, they will lose opportunities to gain knowledge in more than one area.

I do not agree with the following statement: 'Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.' I think that the correct statement will be the exact opposite. I'm going to defend my point of view first by proving that to succeed, people need to study, then success needs to be built step by step, and finally, success comes from others' trust.

First of all, I personally think that to succeed, studying is needed. Going to college is not a risk but the opposite, an insurance in life. It's an investment in life for a better future and a secure one. Of course, going to college can be seen as something new at the beginning, but it's not exactly like that. It's more like a continuation of a reach to knowledge. By having a degree, people learn how to do something well.

The second reason why I disagree with this statement is that I think that success is something which needs to be built. It's not coming easily and fast. It's a long daily work, and to increase the chance to achieve it, stability is required. Running and rushing from one plan to another one won't lead anywhere.

Finally, I think that to succeed in life, trust from folks is a must-have. Without trust, there is no possible real success. And taking risks is the worst way to reach that trust from people around. Again, trust is something to build day after day. And to get it, knowledge in the activity is also required; nobody is going to trust somebody new in a realm who doesn't know what they are talking about.

Of course, success can come to someone who is taking risks, but it's like the lottery - it happens to one in a million. I think that knowledge, stability, and trust are the keys to success.

I totally agree with the statement that 'it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.' 

According to me, understanding ideas and concepts is more important for a student than learning facts. 

Firstly, to understand a topic, for example, any topic related to physical science like light, we should know the basic concepts to deal with it and basic ideas like thinking for ourselves where it is actually coming from. I think that's enough to understand the topic. Concepts should be more clear, like various laws of reflection and refraction, to use them for further study, not about the facts of where they originated, etc. 

From a student's perspective, we should be clear with the concepts first and the basic ideas, like, for example, taking the 'brain where it has never been before' about the topic. These generated thoughts are called ideas. Generating ideas is a really brainstorming technique that helps to increase a student's morale. 

Similarly, if a student goes in search of a fact, there are 9 out of 10 times they will fail. This failure will lead to a lower morale of a student, through which feelings of negativity can come into their mind. This will lead to the buildup of a negative attitude, which can hamper their future also. Facts are those that we go and try to find after completing our bachelor's or even after our master's. Therefore, at a student's age, we should only learn the concepts involved. 

One more thing I would like to add to make my assumption stronger is that when we appear in any subjective class at the school/college level, what is our teacher's main aim or where they put more stress? They stress more on concept-building systems than going in search of a fact. I agree that facts are also required; we should know, but the major focusing point should be concepts and developing students to think beyond the limit. 

At the end, in a nutshell, I would like to say that concepts are the ones that make students more clear about the topic, able to judge it properly. These concepts are the major supported elements in a student's life, which help them to think more, to create/generate ideas, to be able to get things done in a more fruitful way, which are basically needed academically and in professional life too.

Traveling in a group and being led by a tour guide has both advantages and disadvantages, and the consideration about whether it is the best way of traveling or not depends on many factors.

Suppose you are a busy working person and you want to spend your vacation or annual leave. You have a week or two and you plan to go somewhere. First of all, most people want comfort in such cases and they would want to go to the major sightseeings. In such cases, an organized tour led by a guide is the best option: the tourist company will arrange everything for you - all you have to do is enjoy. The guide will tell you what most travelers would like to know, and you don't have to refer to a book to find out about the sightseeing you're at. You are free of all the uncertainties and risks involved in traveling alone and being responsible for yourself.

But traveling in a group led by a tour guide has several restrictions, and they are even frustrating if you are seeking adventures or totally personal experiences. I felt it personally when I went to a Turkic tombstone in rural Mongolia with a group of tourists. The tombstone was awesome, at least for me, for I was interested in Turkic history. It had an inscription on it, and I was badly wanting to try to read it on my own (I once spent some time trying to learn the old letters). But the group had only two hours to spend there, and I had to leave the tombstone with them too because other members of the group did not share the same interest, and the schedule said that we should be at the tourist camp by 4 o'clock. I felt so frustrated that I decided then that I will go there alone sometime afterwards. So this example of mine illustrates the bad point of guided travel - you're not free to decide where to go or where to stay for how long. You can't actually, if I can put it this way, 'taste' the activity and the place because the experience is not all yours: it rather turns out to be a group experience, and it does not give you that feeling when you find, do, think about, or experience something on your own without being distracted.

Personally, therefore, I prefer to travel alone if I have enough time, but at the same time, I agree that organized travel can be a useful and enjoyable experience if you do not have enough time or if you are not really into the destination of your travel.

I agree with the statement that successful people tend to do things that are not familiar to them and take risks. I have several reasons for this.

First, challenging new things makes people well-rounded. To take a personal example, when I was a junior high school student, I hated studying liberal subjects, such as history, art, and music. I had never been to museums or concert halls. However, when I was a university student, I changed my mind and tried to study liberal subjects. Thanks to the change, I became a well-rounded person who can talk to anyone. As the above example illustrates, trying new things makes people well-rounded.

Second, people can find their best ways when they try new things. For instance, four years ago, I applied for a new project in my company, which I did not know how to do well. Although I had been a salesperson for five years, I tried the production field of a computer company. I did well because I knew what the client wanted from our products. If I had not tried a new field, I would not have succeeded in the job.

Therefore, I definitely agree with the statement that trying new things and taking risks rather than doing what people know well makes people successful.

I agree with this statement. I think successful people take risks and try new things rather than just doing the same thing. Trying new things makes people realize their new sides.

When I was in South Korea, I was a successful student. I studied really hard to get good grades in middle school. I was always making A's in Korean classes. I loved to study Korean literature, and I was successful in writing creative stories and poems.

One day, my dad suggested that I study in America. He thought I could experience a new culture and learn a new language. I was really concerned when I heard about my father's suggestion. I thought I was only capable of learning Korean. Moving to America seemed really difficult for me. For a long time, I thought about the advantages that I could get from America. I had an opportunity to learn a new language, and I could experience Western culture.

After three months, I decided to leave South Korea. I took a risk to go to America, and I was ready to challenge myself. When I first arrived at Dallas, I was amazed by the size of my high school. There were so many great students and teachers. It was difficult for me to follow the classes, but I didn't give up. I always studied after school and tried to speak with students from different countries. This helped me develop my English skills.

I studied really hard, and now I am very satisfied with myself. I am making good grades at school, and I made a lot of friends. Also, I am learning Spanish in my school. The things that seemed impossible are happening now. The risks and changes developed me into a more skilled and better person. I think I made a good decision. Coming to America gave me opportunities for my future.

I am not going to stop from here. I am planning to learn about journalism and photography. These are things that I have never studied before. I think taking risks and trying new things made me develop. I learned a lot from new experiences, and I am pleased with it. I will keep learning, and I am confident that this will make me a successful person in the future.

I agree that successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well. I have three reasons to support my answer.

Firstly, taking risks is a way of finding new chances. I think the bigger the risk is, the bigger the chance you have. And to make that chance your own, you will need hard work, and that will make you a strong person.

Secondly, taking a risk and trying new things can give you a new perspective and can make you have a bigger knowledge that can help you to become more successful. For example, for me to start cheerleading in my high school was a big risk for me. Because I used to be a very shy person and did not like to do things in front of everyone else, but for me to start cheerleading gave me the courage to let myself out in front of the crowd. The practices were very hard, and that made me a stronger person than I was before.
