On the other hand, if you like to play your guitar, your age will not be a real problem. Even if you are ten years old or seventy years old, you can enjoy yourself as you want.

Maybe we can say that a young boy may have fewer problematic thoughts than an older person, so his innocence can let him have the possibility of enjoying his life much more.

For example, an adult man has many more things to do than his son. He may have no free time, so the young child can do anything he wants to enjoy himself, while his father has a life full of problems, so he cannot enjoy as his child.

There is another aspect in this discussion that is of relevant importance. Older people are often richer than young people are. So they can do anything they want because they have much more money. For example, if you are a twenty-year-old boy and you like yachting, you may have some problems buying one yacht. Maybe you will buy it in your adulthood.

At the end, I think that the fundamental aspect of the topic is the possibility of being sick when you become an old man. This is a big problem and makes me think that if you are a young person, you will enjoy your life much more.

As our topic is about the best way to travel being in a group led by a tour guide, I strongly agree with the notion, as it has advantages over traveling without a guide.

First, we discuss traveling without a guide. As everyone is interested in going to new places according to their knowledge, they want to know each and every thing present there. Before going, everyone will do research about that, and the information we get is very little when compared to what we encounter. Sometimes, it misses out on good places surrounded by that area; no one is ready to explain the history of cultures and history of that place, and also how the importance came to that place. All these pieces of information are known to the people who stay over there or people who visit often to those places.

Now, let's come to traveling with a guide, as they have the best information. Now, I will give my personal experience so that it elevates the advantages of traveling with a guide. During my college days, we went to the northern part of India, which included a few places. When we went to the Taj Mahal, there we found a very beautiful monument ever built. The guide explained when it was built, who started it, and the cultures followed at that time, and some important things he told. After listening to the lecture he made about the Taj Mahal, we came to know that we had very little information about it. We were very much excited about the information; we really felt like we were viewing that construction and art.

As we thought the Taj Mahal was the only place to visit, but the guide showed another beautiful monument just away from the Taj Mahal. We didn't know about that before; that was also a good piece too. After that, we faced some problems regarding our trip, just a lack of enough time. In that time, our guide was so helpful; he planned accordingly, so our timings were not lost, and we didn't miss even a single location. As the guide was a local guy, he provided good food too.

Throughout the journey we made with the guide was very interesting and very helpful. After the tour, we heard and learned good things like history information about the places, etc.

Finally, my conclusion was that it's not possible to know the things that really happened at the historical places. Few things we can read or listen about those places, but some we may not. So, taking a guide is really helpful and informative, so that we can get more information than when we went to travel without a guide.

Traveling tops the list of many people's choice to spend their leisure time. But whether to follow a group led by a tour guide remains a controversial question for travelers at the planning stage of their tour. In my opinion, the best way to travel has little to do with following a large group.

People tend to rely on a group and stick to it for security or consensus or whatever they need, but when it comes to traveling, things might fall on the opposite side. The assertion of unity means the denial of freedom, which is especially true when, with the guidance of a tour guide, one cannot indulge themselves in the freedom of choosing what travel sites to visit or what time to start. There is a greater chance that the true meaning of traveling, relaxation being my definition, might be ruined by arguments and complaints.

Some people would contradict my point by saying that a tour guide offers valuable and well-informed suggestions that would make a better trip. But isn't there enough news of tourists being cheated or made use of for the sake of tour guides' benefits? By saying this, I am not saying that tourists are more skilled at escaping tricks when traveling by themselves, nor am I judging the moral standard of all tour guides. It's just that isn't it even sadder to be fooled when certain investment and trust have already been placed on the tour guide?

In addition, traveling fulfills different purposes for different people. Some want to escape the hustles and bustles of the city, some wish to explore the unknown world, some aspire to adventure through exciting places, and none of these seem attainable by following the lead of a tour guide whose job is to keep everyone in sight and control.

Good or bad, there is no absolute truth; however, we always have the right to chase what we want when traveling.

Nowadays, young people do not give enough time to helping their communities. I agree with that statement, and I think that there are several reasons for that.

First, the conditions of life have changed; everything is going faster now. People do not have much free time, as it is separated between their studies, part-time jobs, sports, and some social activities. After all this, they do not have much time left to do something else.

Second, people are no longer attached to one another as they used to be. It's just like they use the means of friendship and communication directly with others. So, as a result, if they do not communicate well, they will not be able to help their communities as a group.

Finally, before, in a neighborhood, everybody knew everybody because there were not many people. However, now it's getting crowded, and they may not know who their second neighbor is. So, how would they meet and try to help their communities if they do not even know each other?

To sum up, I think that people should well organize their schedules and find some time to help their communities because, after all, that is where they live.

Ethical marketing is a very significant subject that should be studied in some departments of universities. I see lots of advertisements on television or in newspapers that describe the product as a perfect solution to customers' problems, but in reality, it is not. I believe that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

In all sectors, we can see this type of advertisement. Automotive, Information Technology, or Consumption sectors - no matter which sector it is. All use advertisement ways to convince consumers to buy the product by emphasizing some points generally, but not giving details about some unknown things that can influence the final decision to buy it. To illustrate, a MP3 player is usually announced in a newspaper as a product that is 1 GB and has a radio. However, many people do not know that their radio does not work well everywhere, and they even do not know how many songs can be saved to that wonderful device. Without thinking, some of them buy it, while others learn the reality when they go to buy it by asking questions to the sales representative.

Another example is that some advertisement tricks are implemented in prices. Prices are shown by excluding taxes, and when you are very happy since you have found your favorite product and you go to buy it. Usually, it is too late to change your view, and thus, you buy it.

In this sense, it is certain that most advertisements make products seem much better than they are. However, by giving more importance to marketing lectures and to their content, this unethical situation can be prevented. Also, these lessons should be must courses instead of being elective.

Currently, the issue 'Young people enjoy life more than older people do' is debated by numerous educationalists and scientists.

In my personal point of view, I prefer to think that young people enjoy life more than older people do.In this essay, I will explain my personal points, which are based on previous examples as well as specific reasons.

Firstly, young people spend much more time than older people in the entertainment aspect, such as TV, computer games, and sports.On one hand, young people are the major resources of the world entertainment industry.Older people tend to stay in their own world, doing their personal hobbies, which do not prefer to communicate with each other.On the other hand, older people do not have enough energy for enjoying life due to their age.However, the situation of young people is totally different; they have enough energy for playing outside and enjoying their lives.They tend to play with each other and communicate.

Secondly, young people are much easier to accept fashionable things than older people, which are the basis of enjoying life.For example, young people like playing outdoor with skateboards, which are the newest fashionable sports in the world.Older people cannot accept this kind of sport due to security concerns.Therefore, older people would not access this area of sporting for enjoying their lives.The attitudes towards new things are the major problems.So, older people tend to take simple and easy traditional games in their lives.

In addition, most older people prefer staying at home rather than playing outdoors.However, young people choose outdoor activities as their favorite.In current times, outdoor activities are the main entertainment in the world.Thus, numerous older people who tend to stay at home without outdoor activities will lose their chances for enjoying their lives significantly.

In conclusion, young people like different types of entertainment and also accept more fashionable things than older people.As a result of these situations, young people enjoy life more than older people.

I have two opinions on understanding ideas and concepts versus learning facts by students, as mentioned below.

I agree with this opinion for several reasons. Understanding ideas and concepts has an important role in understanding a subject and achieving higher degrees in exams. Usually, these ideas and concepts derive from the experiments of scientists before being converted into facts. Most theoretical sciences and practical sciences are based on ideas and concepts. The origin of most innovations in the world was based on concepts or ideas.

Also, I agree that students must learn facts, which are merely true, in contrast to ideas and concepts, which may be true or false.

Finally, I suggest that educational members and societies learn both true ideas and concepts, which may be profitable for society, alongside facts approved by scientists and their experiments.

I agree because the advertisement exaggerates the efficiency or quality of the product, sounding like a salesman in a shop. The marketing of some many brands is aggressive because they want to compete with others and show how their brand is better than the others. For example, the Walt Disney Company: over the years, we have seen many commercial announcements on television, the internet, in movies, and in mailing letters. They bombard us with these promotions over and over again, but in many ways, they sell a 'dream come true' that is not true when you decide to start a vacation at Walt Disney. They do not tell you about the long lines in the sun, waiting for the attractions or waiting to eat in restaurants. This is a huge mistake when the advertisement captures our attention and becomes more attractive than reality. This is an example of how people are enchanted by some advertisements, and the reality is different when they arrive at Walt Disney. Other advertisements, like food or diets, show specific people achieving their goals when entering this plan, but the reality is different because they never tell you how much it costs when you become interested in that program. The reality is that they manipulate statistics and sell dreams, stealing money from customers who fail to achieve that goal. In my opinion, people need to be wiser when they are attracted and impressed by an advertisement, just because they want your money and not your needs or satisfaction. That is why they call it marketing.

People who take risks are more likely to receive benefits from their actions rather than people who simply don't act. This is not only a logical assumption, but it is also supported by evidence that is true on a global scale. Some of the richest people in the world were ordinary people with very good ideas. An example of this is Bill Gates. Instead of improving existing tools, he decided to project and invent a new instrument, the personal computer, which would cause a revolution in work and entertainment activities. He risked wasting many years of work on something uncertain that could just be a failure. It is now clear that he had employed his time in a very fruitful manner and that he will be remembered as a genius.

On the other hand, some people succeeded in exporting good ideas to other countries with different cultural backgrounds. A good example is Starbucks coffee, which is now sold all over the world, even in China. It must have been a very controversial decision for the managers to take. But, although Chinese society is traditionally used to tea instead of coffee, now many young Chinese people drink Starbucks coffee to identify with American models.

On a smaller scale, we can all experiment that if we take some risks, we will have more chances to fulfill our desires and be more happy. For example, you can decide to go and study in the United States. At the beginning, it will be difficult because of the language constraints and the distance from family and friends. But if you hold on and overcome difficulties, you will get a valuable degree from an excellent university that will allow you to access better job and income opportunities.

In conclusion, I think it is always worth trying new things and taking risks. We need to remember that we are given only one opportunity in this world, and we should do our best to be happy and make other people happy.

I agree that advertisements make products seem much better than they really are due to several factors. 

First and foremost, advertisements are designed to sell products, so they only highlight the advantages of the products and never mention the disadvantages or side effects. As a result, people can only see the good side of the product and are more likely to buy it.

Second, there are products developed by multiple companies, which sparks competition between them. Since advertisements play a significant role in the selling process, these companies try to make their products look better than those of their competitors. To win the competition, they may exaggerate some minor advantages that do not really exist in the product, although big companies with established reputations are less likely to do so.

Third, companies will not pay to advertise their products unless they are sure it will generate more profits. If the advertisement does not make the product fit with the customers' needs, the companies will not create an advertisement for their products.

Last, the art of advertisement has a concept of making a product look much better than it really is. For example, film and game trailers are always made in a way that encourages people to watch the film or buy the game after seeing the trailer. However, when they watch the film or buy the game, they often do not find it as they expected.

I think that trying new things and taking risks is not necessarily a condition to be successful, but that it is a condition to get out of the masses. I think people doing good work should be recognised for it and have success in their career, even if they don't do anything new. I know a small shop where the man repairs shoes and bags. The man is doing very good work at a very reasonable price. It is nothing special, but the quality of his work is known in the town, and he always has clients. However, the man is neither very rich nor very famous. If this is the kind of success one targets, then I think the person must absolutely try new things and take risks to distinguish themselves from other people. Among the people we remember the most are the inventors and discoverers. They often try a lot of things before doing the invention that made them famous.

I agree with the statement: 'Successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.' In other words, successful people never give up when they face bad situations and big problems. They try to solve the problems. Also, they have lots of passion and encouragement. They try to achieve their goals and dreams. They are always looking for new things and never take a rest. They are always running for their goals. Successful people are different from others. Maybe their environment is not as good as others', and their situation is not ideal. They have to spend time to achieve their goals. They have to read and read books, acquiring lots of knowledge. They can learn from others' experiences. Others' experiences make them try new things, despite the risks. Also, others' experiences give them new opportunities to try new things. It is not easy to try new things because they have to adapt to the situation and conquer the problems. Therefore, successful people never give up in dangerous situations and spend time to achieve their dreams and goals.

Students understand ideas and concepts. Students also understand form and learn facts. In my opinion, it is important for students to understand ideas and concepts before going to learn from facts because there are many reasons, which will be explained with examples below.

Learning ideas and concepts of a topic is very important before going to learn facts. For example, take an experiment from a Chemistry lab. Without knowing the idea and concept of the experiment, what would you do in the lab? If possible, someone does the experiment without knowing the ideas and concepts, definitely some explosions will occur in the lab because in a chemical lab, we do experiments with care. Without care, if we do the experiment in the lab, it will definitely go wrong. For example, H2SO4 is a highly acidic substance. I remember in my classroom in my college studies, some students without knowing the experiment details and ideas wanted to do the lab. He put some water into the H2SO4, and a big explosion took place. Then, my teacher scolded that boy, which is another matter. Without knowing the knowledge and details, he did the experiment, which would give some bad conclusions.

Take another example: some nuclear experiments are done in some countries. If we do something wrong, with or without knowing, there will be a big explosion. In that place, definitely we know the ideas and concepts; without knowing the concept and idea, we cannot do anything in such places because nuclear weapons give big energy than any other. Even the sun also gives energy based on nuclear energy.

Furthermore, it gives safety and full detailed information about what students want to learn. If students learn about concepts and ideas, they know the entire point about what they want to learn from facts. This gives no loss of anything around the place where the application is done.

Moreover, some facts are known by without knowing the idea and concepts, which is another matter. In my opinion, we must know the ideas and concepts before attempting to learn the facts.

Nowadays, there are many advertisements. We also buy products because we see many advertisements. When we see advertisements, we may feel that we must buy the products. Some people believe that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are, but others don't believe. Given the choice between the first and second opinions, I choose the first opinion.

First, advertisements use visual aspects. In detail, in the case of paper advertisements or Internet advertisements, the products can seem much better in terms of color, size, shape, etc. For example, a week ago, I ordered clothes on an Internet site because the clothes were beautiful pink, which I like. I was so excited and expected. Yesterday, the clothes were finally delivered, but when I saw the clothes, I was quite disappointed because the clothes were an ugly, dense pink that I loathe. So, following this example, the visual aspect of advertisements makes products seem much better than they really are.

Second, in the case of home shopping, the cast introduces the product. To illustrate, my aunt called my mother a few days ago, and my mother told me about the story of my aunt. I will tell this story. A few days ago, my aunt watched a TV home shopping channel about kimchi. The cast ate the kimchi so deliciously and said that kimchi was so yummy. Furthermore, all the guests ate kimchi so deliciously, and in my aunt's opinion, it looked so delicious because of the spiced color of the kimchi and the eater's attitude. So, my aunt ordered the kimchi, but when my aunt ate the kimchi, the taste was very bad and disgusting.

On top of that, most companies apply their products' prizes and prestige in contests in advertisements, so we believe and buy the products, but these may not be true.

To sum up, by the above reasons and examples, I think that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

From a recent article, I heard about a successful person who tried new things and took risks. It told me that one of the good ways to succeed in our major is to use our imagination for new things and try risks. Also, I agree with this opinion and want to discuss it in more detail.

First, I want to talk about new things. When I grew up, I heard many successful people's stories, such as Edison and Nobel. Those people accomplished their dreams by using their imagination to try new things. In addition, it is based on our civilization's development because people always want to have good, interesting, and convenient things, so from the invention of new things, they will buy them and be satisfied. In other words, the invention of new things can bring in more money, and sometimes we can gain fame. As a result, it is a good way to be a successful person.

The second reason is based on taking risks. Risks are dangerous in our lives. For example, if we fail to create some good new things, we will lose everything, such as our house, family, and other things. However, if we prepare beforehand, we can reduce the risks. In addition, there are no risks involved in creating new things, because new things are always related to some risks, which are dangerous in our lives. Although sometimes we can figure out risks for our success, we try to create new things. Moreover, we have to take care of ourselves and always prepare for bad situations. For preparing for bad situations, we can reduce the damage when some risks occur.

In our lives, we always demand new things more than before. Even if it can take risks to the person who tries new things, it is a shortcut to becoming a successful person. Sometimes, from overcoming bad situations, we can become important people. For these reasons, I would like to say that trying new things and taking risks help us to become successful people. Moreover, these behaviors make us positive and considerate people.

Generally, people who are remembered are those who leave a trace of their life in history. Nobody remembers or notices a person whose life has been carried out in an anonymous pattern. We notice what stems out from daily life, something exceptional, new. The key to success is risk. Oscar Wilde used to say that an idea which is not risky cannot be considered as an idea. To give evidence to this statement, we are going to outline some main points and then summarize with conclusions and caveats.

First of all, nowadays we consider successful people who occupy certain social positions due to their efforts in seeking their place. This successful social position varies depending on cultures. Nevertheless, this position is regarded as successful when the position itself is exceptional. Nobody would consider successful someone who works in a normal or standard position. This means that success depends on extraordinary situations carried out in particular conditions: it is finding a new solution, a new idea to obtain something.

Secondly, people will recognize success only when it is visible. If nothing could lead us to distinguish something from normality, we would not be able to determine the difference between the two. We will not thus be capable of recognizing the new into the normal. Hence, this will not be differentiable. Success is also difference, uniqueness. In other words, new things.

Third, stated that success is based on difference and new ideas, it is also to be said that news find their root in risk. Elaborating something new, it is not possible to understand whether it will be regarded as something really new and meet the taste of the others or will just fail to communicate its difference. This uncertainty has to deal with risk. To be noticed as different, one idea has to be new, thus risky.

To conclude, we demonstrated that success comes from difference from normality; exceptionality and risk. The last factor is perhaps the essential key for success. As Oscar Wilde said.

I agree with the idea that most advertisements are better than the products themselves. For example, when I read fashion magazines, I find many attractive pages that appeal to various products such as cosmetics, dresses, watches, and perfumes. Whenever I look at these kinds of pages, I actually feel like buying them immediately.

One reason why people have an interest in advertisements when looking at them is that they usually use female models whose style is good, and it always looks very enjoyable to use the products. It attracts people and urges them to buy and wear them. Sometimes, people tend to forget that they do not have the same face, style, and atmosphere as the model. It's a fault. After obtaining products, people feel it's not better than expected because people do not really need them.

Another reason why most advertisements are nice-looking for people is their quality. To compete with other companies and get a big share of the market, companies make efforts in various ways, particularly for advertisements. A recent research shows that 90 percent of companies in the fashion field consider they should spend money and time to produce an advertisement. For example, to hire a famous designer costs 10 times higher than the salary of one employee per month.

Consequently, the quality of advertisements sometimes wins over the real product itself. For these reasons, I support the position of considering that most advertisements seem much better than the products themselves.

Traveling is very interesting for me, but there is a controversy about how to travel: going alone or in a group. I disagree with this theme and I raise four reasons for this.

First of all, I'd like to go wherever I can go. It is very useful to go with a tour guide, especially to a place that I've never been to, because I have little knowledge of the dangerous places to visit. But in a guided tour, there are some places that I don't want to go to. Also, planning for the places that I want to go is also precious time. Time to travel is limited, and from planning to travel, it is a starting point!

Secondly, traveling is expanding our eyes. I traveled to Brazil a lot and I was capable of knowing foreign people. To know what they do, think, and like was a very interesting chance. I like foreigners, including Brazilians, and also want to communicate with foreign people. Traveling is knowing and expanding friends, but this will happen only when going abroad alone, and I would have never had such an experience with traveling by myself.

At last, traveling is a chance of thinking about what I am and what I am going to be. In a place where we live, I can't be stimulated, and there aren't good things for my health, but in a new place, I can be fresh in my mind, and I want to know about this.

I know that traveling with a group, for example with friends or family, but it is not interesting largely because I can't see, think alone. It is a chance to go, think, enjoy by myself, not for others.

I want to go every year alone traveling wherever I want, and expand my ability.

It is often believed that young people enjoy life more than old people due to several reasons, which, in my opinion, are related to the availability of time and other physical and mental resources, such as enthusiasm.

I believe that this view is, in some way, incomplete, although not entirely wrong.

The incompleteness of the view is given by the fact that old people are people with experience. This means that they can assess values to certain actions on the basis of their past experience. They know what to do in order to enjoy certain positive feelings, as well as they know what to avoid. This means that people, once they become old, have all the necessary resources in order to exploit their knowledge on themselves, and hence collect the fruits of their lives as young people.

In addition, although some people believe that money does not make happiness, old people are more likely to have money to spend on themselves, making them enjoy life in more ways. This would imply that you start to enjoy life only at a certain age.

However, there is the opposite point of view, which is the one of the statement. Young people, or at least most of them, do not have many things to worry about. It is up to their parents to control and administer the so-called 'dirty work,' whilst they are free to grow up. This shows that people, during the early stages of life, have plenty of time to dedicate to themselves, to the discovery of new things.

If it is true that old people know what things they like and what they don't, with the advantage of not having to experiment anymore, it is also true that youngsters have the possibility of going through the process of discovering, which is probably the most interesting and fulfilling of all, as it gives you the opportunity of knowing new things and experiencing new feelings, which were previously unknown. For example, people usually remember their first kiss rather than their last.

In conclusion, I would say that life can be enjoyed at every stage, when you are young and when you are old, although in different ways. The first period of life should be dedicated to discovering what you like and enjoy, whilst the last should be dedicated to the exploitation of such discoveries.

I agree with the statement. There are three main reasons for that. First, ideas and concepts are more varied than facts. Facts have a tendency, but all ideas and concepts are different from each other because they are created by people with different perspectives. Second, to learn is easy, but to understand is difficult. Students should study hard and not take it easy. Finally, if students understand ideas and concepts, they can apply their knowledge to their life in the future. Only learning facts is not useful. Therefore, I think that students should make a great effort to understand ideas and concepts, not just to learn facts.

Humans have created this sense of going out of home called traveling. Traveling is a very fun option for you to take. However, it is not always the way you want it to be. On the one hand, you have the opportunity to travel in a group with a tour guide or in a group but without a tour guide. With these in mind, I personally prefer to travel in a group with a tour guide because you have the opportunity to learn more and also because you have your schedule done.

The first reason I prefer to travel in a group led by a tour guide is that I can learn better about the other culture. You have a guide who gives you and tells you lots of information about the new place you are visiting. For instance, if you decide to travel to South Africa, you would not only understand even a word but also would not learn anything about this new country, completely different from yours.

The other reason I prefer traveling with a tour guide is that the schedule is already programmed by my tour guide. I would not have any minute to waste time. I would take advantage of it in every single opportunity. In fact, if you traveled without a tour guide, you may not be able to wake up at seven in the morning. A few years ago, I went to Cuzco in Peru, and I did not contact a tour guide. I did not learn anything about that incredible monument; you can not imagine how I regret it now. It was a waste of time traveling there without a tour guide.

Therefore, whether you choose to travel in a group or by yourself, try to be led by a tour guide and try always to prepare your trip very carefully in order for you to enjoy it.

Everybody could tell you this: young people enjoy life, whereas older people don't. To me, it can't be absolute, for several reasons. First, we know that young people know how to have fun. They always go out with friends, they always laugh (most of the time for nothing)... Older people don't know it. They used to know, but now they are adults and adults have a lot of responsibilities. Adults always think about their work, adults always worry about everything, and when they are older, they worry about death and always talk about when they were young, when they knew how to enjoy life!

We also could say that young people enjoy life because they don't think about the future; they seize the day. That's true, but older people, if they like to plan everything, can seize the day too. Don't we say that the better time of your life is when you don't work anymore?

What about these grandfathers and these grandmothers who travel a lot and begin to live the life they want? That's why I think middle-aged people are the ones who enjoy life the least. They have too many things not to forget, too many things to do, too many things to care about. Young people enjoy life because they have nothing to think about! They go to school, go out with their friends, have complicated relationships with their boyfriends and girlfriends, and that's all. OK, they have to do some homework, but that's not a horrible life. They enjoy life because their life is perfect!

To finish, I would say that although they have a perfect life, most young people don't really enjoy life. Adolescents are always in a bad mood, they complain every time, they always disagree with you, but what they do best is 'not care.' But older people, even if they have a quite more difficult life, know the value of life.

On the one hand, I think young people enjoy life more than older people do. Young people are more active; they can make journeys and participate in sports. They go to parties, spend much time with friends, and have few responsibilities.

Older people often have problems with their health. Some older people need permanent medical care and are not able to leave their homes. Furthermore, they know that most of their life is over. I think this is not an amusing thought. So, one can say that many older people do not have the possibilities to enjoy life, but there are also older people who do not want to enjoy life. I know some older people who are healthy and well-off, but nevertheless, they do not go out; instead, they sit in their houses and are sad.

On the other hand, young people are just at the beginning of their lives and therefore they have to fight for their place in society. This struggle is not only fun, too. In school, they have to work hard because they want to rise their job opportunities, and in university, this situation is continued. When young people have leisure time, many of them waste their time playing video games at the computer. Other young people are unsatisfied with society and lead lives as outcasts.

In contrast to that, there are many healthy older people who earn a comfortable income or are even retired. They often afford luxurious trips and do not have so much pressure to be successful. Instead of stress in school, in university, or at the beginning of a career, older people can play with their grandchildren or go for a walk with other older persons. I think this is a great perspective.

Older people can look back and see what they have achieved over the years. That can also be great pleasure. Resuming all those reasons, I think both young and older people can enjoy life, but I am convinced that older people more often do so.

I think that successful people trying new things and taking risks when doing new things is better than doing what they already know. I agree with successful people, because if people are successful in what they are, then they can think of new things. 

Obviously, while trying new things, risks may take place, but if we are worrying about the risks, then no one can be successful in their life. For example, scientists produce new things by taking many risks. If they thought that this work was very risky to do, then now we couldn't get this light, radio, TV, and satellites, and many more which we are using in our daily life. So, for every achievement, there are many risks taken for the things to do. 

So, successful people can only think of the future; for every achievement, there are many risks taken by many persons for those achievements. For example, if we are not trying for a better future and being happy with what we have, then we will never succeed in our life. 

Finally, my opinion is to agree with the hardworking people, i.e., successful people. Because if people are not successful, then they can't think of their further future. So, for every success, there are many risks that have been taken to achieve it. So, finally, I agree that successful people trying new things and taking risks is better.

I think that this statement can summarize an important problem of actual society. In my opinion, we live in a society of appearance, where exterior aspects are sometimes considered more than the substance of things. I think it is evident in a million situations. Let's think, for instance, about our markets, which are full of colored boxes and bottles. I am sure that everyone of us, at least once in our lives, has bought a kind of food or beverage just because of how well it was displayed on the box that contained it. We can also think about the ads on TV, which introduce us to so many kinds of things that seem to be the new and perfect solutions to many of our problems (and most of the time, they solve just one 'problem': how to spend our money!). Another example comes from the fashion world, which is a little different from the previous ones, but I think that in a different key, it can reflect the same problem. How many times have we seen perfectly slim models who seemed to be healthy and, of course, satisfied with their own bodies? And how many times have we heard (some time later) that they had a lot of problems with anorexia, their everyday lunch was a carrot, and their lives were unhappy? It has happened a lot of times, I guess. Now, the point is that society presents to us some patterns that are almost never real, or better, it shows us, thanks to some advertisements or something else, what it wants to show us, but not all the truth. I think that it is not easy today to not be impressed by the external side of the things that are around us, but I also think that to avoid going into a lot of delusions in our lives, we should start to look behind the appearance of the things that are presented to us to understand what they really are.

I believe that it is better for a person to specialize in one subject. We need to study everything to choose these subjects, depending on our qualities. We all have different qualities, one from another, but always, we have more developed one than the other. It is my opinion about this topic.

For example:I love playing tennis and I practice every day, so I can play with another person and understand everything about it. If I have a problem or people ask me something about it, I can explain because I know about tennis.

But if other people ask me to play soccer and they want to play with me, it is so different, because I don't play soccer and I haven't practiced that sport.

If they teach me, I will be able to play, but I'm better at another sport.

If I want to learn two sports at the same time, I will learn, but I can't develop all day in only one sport. I need concentration in the two sports.

We need to have different observations about different subjects or, in this case, sports before choosing any one. It is necessary to be sure about your decision.

It is the same with subjects; I can learn the basics of each one, but I need to prepare in only one, and in my future, I will know everything about my career.

If you can develop a subject perfectly, now, you can find out about the other and make the same effort as the first.

Sometimes we hide many positive things, but we don't know about that; with practice, we can take off and show this ability!

We can plan our future; it is only our decision. But for my life or for your life, it is necessary to study.

I strongly believe that the statement 'it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts' is true. Understanding ideas is more important for every student in the classroom. Understanding ideas and concepts gives the overall picture of that particular lecture.

For example, in my college days, I had concentrated more on my lessons, and at that time, I knew the central idea of the topic. This type of skill will improve the ability to study and the ability to remember. These skills are also reducing study time. Students can learn more information quickly.

Learning facts is good, but every time we don't want to study. We don't want to spare much time on learning facts. At that time, these skills are very helpful. It is a very time-consuming process. Understanding ideas and concepts will be helpful anytime. For example, I want to go to an exam; first, I will go through the topic, then understand the main idea of that topic and the concept of that one. I regularly follow this rule of studying. So, in this way, I get more information within time, and I save my time also. In this way of studying, I got good marks in my exams.

For example, when we read a passage, first of all, we skim the passage, then get the main idea of the passage. At this time, reading is easy; otherwise, it will be tough. In this way of getting ideas, students get a lot of exposure, and their thinking ability will also increase. In this way, learning facts is difficult to remember with the idea of the topic. So, I strongly believe that this statement will be helpful a lot in education and future aspects.

In my opinion, it is true that young people are starting to have lots of different distractions that are separating them from many interesting activities and responsibilities, such as helping their communities.

But it is something that has been increasing over several years.

The development of new technologies, such as the internet, mobiles, televisions, DVDs, computer games, etc., have extended other ambitions and purposes in life.

Nowadays, teenagers prefer to sit in front of a DVD player or play with their mobiles instead of sharing some evenings in communities where all kinds of activities or services are planned.

First of all, I think one of the reasons is the education that they are receiving from their parents and from the schools. It seems to be more important to know how to use the internet than what was the last book that they read.

Secondly, in these communities, they should try to attract teenagers by offering them different kinds of activities that could make them interested in going to these communities and participating. For example, organizing concerts (all types of music: classical, pop, rock...), football games or other kinds of sports, creating a library that would include internet, books, CDs, DVDs; also, trying to perform some plays or going to the theatre.

Also, knowing much more about the place that they live and the environment in general, not just the group or the city that they live in.

At last, when young people can enjoy this environment, they will be very excited and very decided to collaborate in any kind of activity or help that the community can create or organize.

My conclusion is that if the community presents a good range of attractive and new activities, any young people will be so happy to collaborate in the well-being of the community.

Personally, I think that this statement is a perfect reflection of what I think and do. I have always thought that you have to understand everything that you are taught.

This is a very controversial topic, but I think I have a clear panorama of what I think.

The first reason for which I incline to this decision is that learning facts doesn't give you an internal satisfaction of a certain topic. There is a famous quote stated by Ignatius of Loyola S.J., which is: "The knowing doesn't satisfy the soul, but the interpretation and likeness of the things internally does." This is a very reflective quote, because when you learn a fact, you don't acquire its concept completely; you have, like, an empty space. For example, in philosophy, you can know the point of view from every philosopher, but if you don't understand them, you could never know what they really meant.

The second reason is that the human brain tends to forget easily things learned but not interpreted. For example, the things that you learned in 9th grade, sometimes you forget them when you are in 10th or 11th, because you don't really get the concept completely. On the other hand, if you learn something and you understand it well, you will remember it forever, or if you forget it, with a little thinking, you will remember it and could use it right for other aspects in your daily life.

Finally, I would like to say that people who always memorize facts and don't understand them completely usually have fewer resources for having success in life, because of their lack of understanding and interpretation in essential matters. However, people who really understand all the things that they are taught usually develop an ability to solve problems faster or be more original in their thinking.

The business meaning of advertisement is to show what you are not. So, I completely agree with the fact that advertisements tell us that 'bad' products are 'good'. Mostly, advertisements talk about bad products.

Today, advertisements are everywhere. Turn on your TV, and it will show you advertisements mainly with certain gaps, which are called programs. You turn on your PC, cross a busy road, or do whatever; you cannot get rid of an ad. Now comes the business aspect. Why is there a need for so many advertisements? Two words have the answer: 'Purchase' and 'Profit'. All advertisements are the brainchild of some unsuccessful products that the creator wants to make successful.

So, why does one person need to advertise his product? To make it famous? Yes, maybe, but the most dominant reason is to sell and to make a profit. Why do you need an ad if your product is so good? I witnessed the same situation when I was young. I loved one chocolate of a particular brand. I never saw its advertisement on TV or in any journal. Now, suddenly one day, I saw its ad, which told me that it had changed. Joyfully, I went to a shop, I bought one, only to discover that the price had increased, and the cover pack became more glossy. That's the magic of an ad: when the product is right, you don't need to advertise it.

Advertisements are very lucrative because of their 'free' offer. I have seen thousands gather in front of malls to get a free offer with a particular product. So, what is the motive of the free offer? Nothing comes for free. 'Free' is the word that is seen by all; we need to see some invisible information, such as a decrease in quality, in place of 'free'. Once, my mom bought vegetable oil after seeing a wonderful new ad of the reduced-price product. Later, she discovered that the expiry date was already over.

In some cases, what an ad tells are completely lies. Our favorite actors and actresses don't bathe with that particular soap, which they advertise. These are just to promote sales.

I mostly got the worst products whenever I was prompted by an advertisement, so my suggestion is 'don't be fooled by any advertisement'.

Some people say that nowadays young people do not have enough time to help their communities, that because of the rhythm of our lives, we, I am 19 years old, do not have time to help poor people, to talk or to be with old people who feel alone, to make things to help reach peace in some countries or even in some families.

It is true that our lives have a very high rhythm and that we do not have a lot of time to help our communities, but that does not mean that we do not want to do it.Some years ago, young people did not do a lot of things for their communities, but the implication of the new generations in the projects of help has increased a lot during the last years.

We can see that there are more NPOs, non-profit organizations, and whose members or the people that collaborate with them do it totally free, with no monetary retribution.The objectives that these NPOs try to reach are really different.There are those who help poor people who do not have anything to eat or those who help dependent drug people.There are also some corporations that help to preserve the environment, like Greenpeace, and those who help in general kids, like UNICEF.Others try to help women and others try to fight against illegal prostitution.

There are a lot of organizations that try to help our community and that are growing in the number of activists. To sum up, I would like to say that more and more young people are helping other people, even if we do not have all the time we would like to have to do this activity.But young people are trying to find free time and spend it helping others, what makes us more human.

I believe that one who wants to be successful and achieve many goals is the one who tries new ways, ideas, and things in life.

Without trying or experiencing new ways, one will not learn or be successful in life, because one will not have the ability to achieve new things, and technology would not have become as great as it is today.

For example, without scientists, we would not have ways to study, and experiments to learn about in school. Scientists would not have learned and invented all those theories without trying and experimenting.

Another example would be if one wants to achieve good business; one would not achieve it without trying new ways and ideas to make his business grow bigger and better. Another reason for this statement would be that without experiencing and trying new things, technology would not have become as great as it is today, and people would just be doing things they are used to, and would not have the chance to experience new things in life.

Technology is getting bigger and better every day, with the help of scientists and all other people who try to make new things and more developed things from things that were nothing.

I completely agree with the statement, because as I said above, without experiencing, trying, and learning, nothing would have been invented, learned, or used today, and people would just be doing what they are used to.

I absolutely agree with the statement that young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities because they have other worries in life and do not have more time to be involved with their community.

Nowadays, young people have many other worries and do not have time to spend on their community. This problem is that some youngsters, while studying, have to work in order to pay for their studies. Other youngsters have problems with money, and as nowadays life is very expensive, they have to work so many hours in order to get by with everything. And if we talk about youngsters who have already started families, it is not viable.

For instance, I am 27 years old and I finished my degree, and now I would like to do a postgraduate program overseas in order to improve my professional skills and knowledge. In order to do that, now I have to spend most of my time working so many hours so I will be able to carry on with my studies. Not only do I have to worry about my studies, but also about my flat, the bills, and the rent. And in a few years, I would like to have a child.

Even though this pitiful situation, I would really like to have a little time to help my community, but since the rhythm of life goes so fast, I think that it is impossible, at least at the moment.

As life goes so fast, in my opinion, I understand that young people nowadays have so many problems that they cannot spend time helping their communities. Maybe if the rhythm changes, things will go better and...

I believe it is true that young people do not give enough time to helping their communities, but this is caused by society and parents.

I am a young girl, and I totally agree with this statement. In my opinion, the younger generation is busy with their own things and does not worry about the troubles that appear in their own community. They think that there are people who worry about the things of society, and they will look for some solution.

The young people who have a good life are the least worried because their parents help them and will solve their problems, and they do not think that when they become adults, their parents will not be there to stay.

I know that this position is worse, but this is what our parents teach us. Some examples are when we throw paper on the floor and are not able to take the paper and put it in the rubbish. Or when somebody paints with a spray on the doors... These people do not think when they do that; they do it because they like it.

I wish that young people were more careful and thought before doing anything. They have to know that the worst of society is bad for them. I like that politicians would do more programs for young people because this would help to envelop the troubles of society.

And I believe that with the help of the whole community, our own community will become better!

In my view, the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide. I do not prefer to travel alone as I believe that when you travel with friends, you can take the utmost pleasure and information from the travel, as there will be many questions for the tour guide, and there will be many brains, not one. I just want to emphasize this by using an example from my travel with my friends.

I am a history student by profession. In the last year of my college, I had a thesis to be submitted on the Great monument, Taj Mahal. It was a tour where a group of four, including me, went to New Delhi, in India, where Taj Mahal is located. It is one of the ancient cities in India with great history and also the capital of the country. There, we hired a tour guide who is believed to be the best in the place. While looking at the monument and hearing the information from the guide, we were astonished about the history, beauty, and the efforts required for its construction. There were many areas in the monument whose names were not even heard by us before; i.e., none of the books contained these details, which are very important for our observations and thesis. There were many questions that were asked by our group to the guide. I think my share of questions would be only one-tenth of the total. Then, I realized the importance of traveling together. I felt that if I had come to the place alone, I would have learned only one-tenth of the information for the thesis, which would have reduced my scores.

After coming back from New Delhi to our place, we checked our share of expenditures for the travel, and it was only 40% when compared to expenditures if one travels alone. With the above-mentioned example, I believe that traveling in a group with a tour guide not only helps in getting more information about the place you visit but also helps in reducing your expenditure for the travel. It reinforces your relation with your friends. You will remember and recollect your experiences and incidents in the travel throughout your life.

Nowadays, we are living in an individualistic world. In our parents' period, it was really different; everyone helped everybody. Today, this period is reversed. In my opinion, young people do not give enough time to helping their communities. With several examples, it will be easier to explain the reason for this phenomenon.

First, young people study longer than before. On average, a student stays at the university for around four or five years, which is huge compared to the 1960s or 1970s. Young people always pretext that they do not have time to help anybody. Even at 20 years old, we, young people, always have the feeling of being overbusy. We have personal work, group projects, sports, etc., but in our planning, no time for anything else. Well, I say that, but we can find time to go to the cinema or meet friends. For example, we will prefer going on three weeks' holiday than staying one week to help a charitable cause. There should be another reason for young people's carelessness.

Secondly, as I said previously, we are living in an individualistic and egoistic society. Everyone thinks about him or herself. Young people believe less in God than before, which could also be a good reason. There are not a lot of religious events. But religion is an efficient way to gather people around a good cause in order to help other communities. And all of it is just the consequence of the environment of a society or a lack of values and education.

Nowadays, parents do not teach their children to share.

In brief, I think it is not fair, but it is a reality: young people do not give enough time to helping their communities, but I am sure...

To choose between a broad knowledge of many academic subjects or a good specialization in only one specific subject is not easy, as both possibilities have advantages and disadvantages. Anyway, I agree with the idea that it's better to have a broad knowledge of several different subjects, and that for several reasons.

First of all, a person with a variety of interests and knowledge in different fields is probably a person with an open mind who shows a strong intellectual curiosity. Famous intellectuals of the past, like Leonardo da Vinci, just to name one of the most well-known, had an incredible variety of knowledge and curiosities. Then, having a broad knowledge of the world in general might help people in their career and professional life. Also, having a good knowledge in a variety of subjects doesn't necessarily mean that a person can't have a special field of interest in which he or she is more competent.

An open mind and a broad culture can be a great advantage in a fast-changing world like the one we live in today. In fact, we must be ready and able to adapt to different situations and conditions.

On the contrary, if we are too rigid, if we are overspecialized in a very particular field, we might be unable to get the whole picture, so to speak, and we might be less flexible, less able to cope with any change we can have to deal with in our lives. Of course, there's nothing wrong with being very good in a particular subject we like more. I think that only overspecialization is wrong. If someone is competent and interested only in a very special field, he or she might be very good in his or her job, but might not be able to adapt or to react to situations that require a more general approach.

Sometimes you read in papers about terrible mistakes doctors make in their work, as not understanding exactly a patient's disease or simply confusing symptoms described by patients. That can be due to the fact that some doctors are extremely well-prepared in their field, but are sometimes unable to analyze the whole situation, and they might miss the fact that they are dealing with people and not just with sick kidneys or livers, to give an example.

For all said reasons, I do believe that having a broad knowledge of many subjects and keeping the curiosity and passion for learning all our life is definitely better than limiting our knowledge only to a specific field of study.

Probably in twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are now. Today, particularly in Italy, there is a very big problem about traffic, smog, and parking, because most people have a car. In fact, in a normal family, there is at least one car for each person, while in a rich family, you can find more cars than there are people living in the family.

In nowadays, you can have and drive a car when you are fourteen; the youth do not drive motorcycles anymore, a little special car. For these reasons, in many cities, you could not drive all days of the week; for example, on Monday in Bologna, from 8:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m., it is not permitted to drive.

It is a very huge problem to drive, particularly at certain times, because you spend a lot of time in traffic jams; for example, when you go to work, and maybe after a long time spent in your car, you have to spend more time looking for parking.

I hope that for all these reasons, everything will change in twenty years. Perhaps in the future, in each town, there will be a metro station, a good train and bus station, so all people can use public transport instead of their cars. In big cities, there is now public transport, but it is often not very efficient.

I agree that young people enjoy life more than older people do. My first point, which is most important, is that they are young. Since they are young, they have lots of energy to enjoy life in the ways they want. For example, if someone thinks they enjoy their life by playing some outdoor games, when they have plenty of time. Now, if the thinker is a young person, they can just grab their stuff to play and go on. But suppose this comes to the mind of an old person; that's not possible easily because they have to remind themselves quickly of the kind of restrictions their doctor has made on them. Also, another point is the lack of energy. They may not be able to perform that task even if they will enjoy outdoor games. They have to compromise with things like just watching TV or having family dinner parties, an easy way of enjoyment that all older people prefer.

Also, a second thing that supports my agreement is traveling or taking a trip, which lots of people like and is a good way of enjoyment. When all the friends come together and make a plan for a long trip, it is easy for youngsters because they are able to face all kinds of problems, starting from weather changes to walking miles away by foot when their car is out of fuel. But in the case of older people, they need support in such kind of situations. They cannot face problems as youngsters can. They need their medicines ready while weather changes happen, and even though they are prepared, they are not sure that their body can respond well.

So, basically, young people can enjoy their life more than older people as they have enough energy to enjoy life in the way they want. But older people also have many ways to enjoy the rest of their life. As, at one time, when they were young, they also had fun.

The statement about the quality of products is a complex and controversial issue. While some people argue that advertisements do not give the real quality of a product, others think that they know what they buy. So, advertisements cannot influence their choice.

Both perspectives are important, but overall, I disagree with the statement that advertising influences my choice.

My point of view is important because we overall know the different products we use for ourselves. As an example, when you want to buy a car, you use specific information about the type of car you want and do not necessarily follow the advertising provided by any car company.

Secondly, advertisements are not primarily directed to influence the choice of customers. It is highly used by companies to settle their leadership (best selling). This can be illustrated by the fact that when someone wants a specific car, they have the choice between sometimes more than one company.

Some people can object that young boys are mostly influenced by advertising. This objection can be countered by the fact that they are not responsible for their purchases. When they want something, they ask their parents to buy it for them. And overall, the parents do not follow the desires of their children because they know what is important for them or not.

While the issue of quality of products must be considered carefully, the fact that we know what we want, compounded with the object of the company to settle at a leadership place, produces convincing reasons why I disagree with the following statement: **Most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are**.

I agree with the statement that the best way to travel is with a tour guide.

Most people would not agree with this statement, as they will argue that you can become an explorer if you travel without a tour guide. Well, this can be true if you are traveling alone, traveling with a lot of time on your hands, and traveling within your own country.

But imagine if you were to visit a foreign land, where you do not know anyone. You do not know the people, the customs, and the traditions. You do not know the historic places, and you do not know the directions. How can you enjoy a tour in which you spend most of your time figuring out where to go and how to get there?

Traveling in a group led by a tour guide has many other benefits, such as meeting people in your group who share the same interest as yours. You can communicate with them and exchange a lot of valuable information. You can know where they come from, and perhaps they can become your tour guides in their country, and you can do the same for them.

Tour guides know the exact history of a particular place. They can take you to places which you might not have access to if you were traveling on your own. Tour guides can also give you hints and tips when it comes to dealing with the locals. They can advise you of the places that you should and should not go.

Most of all, the tour guides give you the best return on your investment. You can go to a foreign country and make the best use of your time by not missing any of the famous and important places that you could have missed if you were to travel alone.

In my opinion, most advertisements deceive people by making products seem better. There are two specific cases of examples of tricks to present products as much better: changing the look of the product by changing its cover color and changing its name to make it look like high-quality.

First of all, advertisements change the color of the product's cover to attract customers. Generally, faded colors will make the customer think that the product is made with old technology, whereas bright colors deceive the consumer into thinking it is made with high technology. For example, brighter pencils are generally preferred to faded-colored pencils in Turkey. That's why many advertisers force manufacturers to produce bright-looking pencils to increase sales.

Secondly, advertisers force manufacturers to change the product names of a specific product to increase the amount of products sold. In Turkey, that is usually done by giving a foreign name to the product instead of a Turkish name to trick the consumer. In this way, the consumer may think that the product is a high-quality product because some of the goods manufactured by the Turkish industry lack quality. There is a real case for this in Turkey. A spaghetti-producing company changed its product name a couple of years ago and gave an Italian name to its product to deceive the consumer that it is an Italian product. Hence, they have increased their product sales. This is the way to present their products as much better, although it is the same quality as before.

To sum up, most advertisers make products seem much better according to some techniques listed above. Unfortunately, these techniques are becoming so widespread that consumers will unlikely encounter a product revealing its real quality.

In this essay, I will discuss whether I agree or disagree with the fact that young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities.

First of all, I want to say that I do not agree completely with this statement because it is too simplistic to say that young people now do not give enough time to helping their communities.

In fact, for sure, there are a lot of young people nowadays who think only about themselves and do not spend time helping their communities, but, on the contrary, there are a lot of young people involved in social activities.

In fact, I know a lot of young people who are involved every day in different activities to help their communities, above all young people who are part of specific groups. For example, they help children with family problems to do their homework after school, they play guitar during church celebrations on Sundays, and when I was younger and attended secondary school, in particular, I also did a lot of these kinds of activities, but unfortunately, now I do not have enough time to do these, so I try to do something else.

As a lot of young people, in fact, I am part of the Red Cross, and for this reason, twice a year I go to the hospital and give my blood for free to help a lot of people who every day need blood due to different problems.

In conclusion, I can say that I agree with the fact that there are a lot of people nowadays who do not give enough time to helping their communities, but I want to underline instead that there are a lot of young people who are very sensitive, acting in social activities, and for these reasons, they spend a lot of their time helping others.

Having a broad knowledge of many academic subjects seems more interesting than specializing in only one subject; however, we ought to determine all the advantages and disadvantages to make up our minds.

I am convinced about the great importance of mastering at least several subjects in order to increase our general knowledge. It seems nowadays indispensable to be aware of a lot of subjects that belong to varied fields, for example, we are to be able to talk about politics, ecology, communication, and business, and this would not be possible if we did not acquire broad knowledge in history, biology, or mathematics. If not, we will not feel concerned about very important subjects that are part of our lives. That is the reason why we need to accumulate a lot of knowledge while we are still in college.

After being part of this learning process, and only after that, you will be able to choose one specific subject that corresponds truly to your personality, your skills, and your motivation. Then, you might be further in the subject you have chosen to express yourself in the best way. Whether you were previously not interested in other general subjects, I am afraid that it would be difficult to envision things in a very mature and complete way.

To conclude, you should have a look around you to be open-minded, whatever your specialty may be, in order to be able to use a wide range of skills.

Although the basic concept of advertising is itself to promote a product or a service, I do agree with the statement that most advertisements make products seem much better than they actually are.

Advertising for products is essentially the process used to convince potential buyers that the product in question is fit and suitable, and the best in the market. However, most advertisements blow this definition completely out of proportion by marketing a product that ends up being radically different when finally used. The degree of exaggeration used in advertisements to convince the buyer is at times ridiculous.

Advertisements in the fast-moving consumer goods domain, especially, strictly adhere to the policy of displaying a completely wrong image of the products, which make them seem much better than they actually are. An example that comes to mind is a commercial for a leading shampoo product that claims to not only put hair back on the heads of its balding users but also rejuvenate them to the extent that they will be able to compete with the best drivers in the world on a Formula One car racing track.

Advertisements in various other sectors also mislead users to believe that the product will offer qualities that it was never designed to provide in the first place. Although one of the selling points of a good advertisement is, in some cases, to provide a tinge of humor to go with the product, certain advertisements and brands use this to the extent that makes their products seem too good to be true.

Various mail-order catalogs for exercising systems are also a clear example of how the end product differs vastly from the advertised one.

Especially in today's world, where common opinion has it that media overpowers print, people look to advertisements, especially on television, to help them make informed choices about which product suits their needs better. This dependency may not be large when it comes to everyday products, but in cases of products that are highly expensive and involve large investments, some advertisements can often mislead people's decisions.

An example to illustrate this is the advertisements for real estate projects or finance and tax-saving instruments, and more recently, even in job searching portals. Some of the advertisements have caused people to make incorrect decisions due to their assured but unrealistic claims.

All in all, my belief is that advertisements should help people make informed choices and should make people aware of the product. A certain degree of humor and make-believe is alright, but the core functionality of the product itself should not be made a fantasy, as is the case with many of the advertisements in today's world.

I therefore ardently agree with the fact that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

Young people tend to do a lot of activities and can perform a lot of tasks and desires. In contrast to older people who can have difficulties in having their wishes and desires fulfilled. That is why young people enjoy life more than older people do.

Physically speaking, older people have walked most of the roads in a lifetime, they are more weary and exhausted from their trip. Minimal interest in trying new things is obvious in an elderly person. Contradicting young people who have the energy and stamina to perform tasks, ambition and the lure of the exotic take over their minds, trying everything and tasting life in all its colors, discovering, learning, feeling, and performing more missions every day, every moment.

Emotions do have a big effect on a human being. Old people understand that they have aged, they know for a fact that their mission in life is almost over, some are sensitive about death and they don't want to lose their families and friends. But younger people view life as a long trip, a horizon of advantages they should grasp to succeed. They have all their life to look forward to.

The mental condition is a huge wall to older people. They gradually start to lose their ability to think clearly and remember information, which is a big hassle to them, they know that their organic computer (brain) is starting to disintegrate and diminish, but they can't do anything about it. While young people are at their climax of intelligence, new ideas, new information to invent and learn, and a future to look forward to. So why should a young person worry about their mental status?

At the end, young humans are more lively and happy in their lives, and old people tend to be more sorrowful and sad about their current situation. So stay young and happy if you can.

I agree with this sentence. Young people enjoy life more than older people every time. In my opinion, young people are very active, making a lot of sports, listening to music, dancing, singing songs, reading, and going to the cinema. However, older people prefer to communicate with other people alone. Young people do not like to think about life's conditions, financial problems, unlike older people. Although young people are very powerful, they do not take an interest in any problems, for instance, national economy, environmental pollution, and starvation. They think about enjoyable things every time. In addition, these young people spend twice as much as older people. They do not like to mention their lessons. Whereas older people like traveling, researching events, reading, observing events, and listening to romantic music. 

In conclusion, being young is a very entertaining thing. Young people bring chance and give movement to our life. If they did not have our life, it would make us unhappy. The world is very active and peaceful with them.

In the past years, we have seen a growing conflict between older and younger people. In many countries, the gap between generations is growing due to demographic as well as sociological developments.

Unemployment among young people is a huge problem in many European countries. In many cases, young people are not able to get a good education because of their immigration background or their social environment. Also, many young people are not able to find proper jobs although they have a good education because, after massive job cuts in many multinational companies, no youngsters are being hired at the moment due to slow economic growth and the consequences of globalization, which often causes outsourcing and transferring of jobs from expensive first-world countries to areas where production is cheaper.

On the other hand, older people are also affected by these job cuts. At the same time, European welfare states have to raise the retirement age in order to keep their social systems functioning and financeable.

Of course, this development sometimes causes frustration on both sides. When older people who either have the will to work but don't find a job or who have worked for decades and are now retired see young people in the streets, hanging out, doing nothing (except skateboarding, listening to music, playing computer games, and shopping), they might get the impression that young people enjoy life more than they do or than they did when they were their age. And that impression, in my opinion, is probably correct.

When today's old generations were young, in the forties and fifties, there was not a lot of fun stuff to do in Europe. They experienced the cruelty of World War II and the hard work that was necessary to rebuild the countries afterwards.
