Young people in Europe are lucky to grow up in a safe and often wealthy environment. They have the chance to do things older people were not able to: they can travel, they can communicate with strangers and friends around the world, they can get to know the world in a totally different way their parents, grandparents, and great-grandparents were able to. They have the time and possibility to do sports and other fun activities and to enjoy their life - maybe more, or at least in a different way, than many older people do.

Maybe this way of lifestyle many young people have, containing traveling, extreme sports, and other ways to test their personal limits, are a way to cope with their "Zukunftsangst," with the scary feeling many youngsters have, that they have to be flexible all the time, they often don't know what tomorrow brings them, and they are not sure if and how long they will have a job (and if they are lucky to have a job, they have to pay for the older people's retirement, probably without being ever able to profit from this system themselves).

I think young people have all the rights to enjoy their life as long as they can - sooner or later it will get tough anyway. Older people shouldn't complain about this but rather try to understand the situation teenagers and twens are in. And sometimes they should even talk to their grandchildren and tell them: "It's alright, enjoy your life. Go and have some fun!"

I disagree with the statement that young people enjoy life more than older people do. As a matter of fact, people who are open-minded, manage their time well, and work hard, regardless of age, can enjoy their life without question.

A bright and vigorous young spirit may have more curiosities than older people to explore the world. They are bound to learn any information they are enthusiastic about. They may have lots of social activities to participate in, such as parties, concerts, and sports, and make friends. However, a young person who grew up in a dysfunctional family with narrow-mindedness may not have the mood to learn and play. They may fall into depression and hateful environments and kill time by doping drugs or hooking around. They drop out of school and do not know what to do. They do not know how to manage themselves and their time as well, so there's no good life they can enjoy.

On the other hand, a great deal of vivid older people may retire from their jobs and are veterans who save pensions and are good at leading a beautiful life. They manage their time carefully. They may get up in the morning to take a walk in the park, read the newspaper on the bench, and enjoy the sunshine, arrange a nice trip, and visit old friends sometimes; cultivate hobbies to make their childhood dreams come true. Some older people who do not manage well from their youth may suffer financially difficult times to organize their life. They are sick and cannot go anywhere. Illness brings a hard and unhappy life for them.

Therefore, no matter young or old, people can enjoy life easily if they appreciate how precious life is and manage their time well and keep an open mind.

Nowadays, young people are more involved in many activities than in the past. For this reason, someone can affirm that young people don't give much time to help their communities. Because I'm a young person, I can explain my opinion and support my disagreed opinion with some examples. The first example I support is that young people have not so much time to help their communities because they don't want to help them, not because they haven't got such time: in fact, I can help my friends if they ask for my hand, even if I have to study for myself. If I am devoted to a friend, I help them in every way. But in this way, I have to renounce spending some time playing computer games or taking a break, going to the commercial center, or running, for example. I suppose that the people who said this sentence know only selfish people who think just about their own lives. But in university, for example, students live together for much of the time: they attend the same lessons, they talk during pause times, they have lunch together, and they become like a family. In a family, if a member has a problem, the others help them. And this is what happens in university. In fact, helping each other can make it easier to pass exams and live university life without fear. Also, in families, young people help fairly well (and more than sometimes or seldom): in fact, as a young person grows, their responsibility grows itself, and they recognize that helping parents is important. They can do it in different ways: working part-time to earn money to spend on their personal objects, and they don't ask money from their parents, or cleaning the house or their own room. Naturally, there exist many young people who don't help in any of these ways their family, but I can't generalize. As the man who said that sentence cannot generalize.

I definitely think that it is very good and essential for an individual to have a broad knowledge of many academic subjects. By knowing about many subjects, one is more comfortable in interacting with all kinds of people because it will not be difficult to have a healthy conversation, as we will not be totally unaware of what the other person is talking to us about.

Another important reason why we should have knowledge about different subjects is that we never know what bad phase in life we might go through. To be able to stay put in all situations and to be able to work our way through all difficult times, we should have at least the bare minimum knowledge required in every field. This broadens our horizon to work and not be stranded in various situations in life.

If we have only specific knowledge about one field, it is not always necessary that we may have enough luck in our fate to make it big in that field. To keep that door of opportunity open for us at all times, we should have knowledge about a variety of things in life. Let's take the example of a simple clerk who has been used to entering data into a register manually all his life. With the development of science and technology, there will come a time in his professional life where his company might install computers to manage the data. The clerk would now be required to work on this new marvelous invention. If the clerk had always been satisfied throughout his life with his manual labor and would not have updated himself in this new technology, he would have been blank as to the knowledge of computers, and this would in turn lead to him losing his job, where someone who is computer-savvy might get the job; but having been updated with happenings in different fields, the clerk would find it simple to navigate through the system, in turn making his work easier for himself.

This was a very small but very effective example as to why we should be in touch with things that are going on around us. As they say, 'a little knowledge may be dangerous.' Keeping this in mind, I firmly believe and state that it would be in our best interest if we knew more things about other fields as well, rather than just knowing everything about one.

I agree because people start to think that cars cost money and pollute the environment, which affects their own health problems now. Due to the bad environment, a lot of people have diseases, like cancer, and especially lung disease. It comes from not enough exercise and air pollution. These days, more and more people take care about their health problems and they know that cars make their health worse. Also, people start to care about protecting nature: ozone holes, air pollution comes from car emissions.

Cars cost too much money; people keep gasoline in their cars, and the price of gasoline is getting higher. They have to renew their car insurance every few years. They have to keep their own parking. Having a car means costing money every day. They want to save money, and it is easy to use the train or bus or bicycle instead of a car. Using another transportation is much easier than a car. Especially, the train is more quick and cheapest. About 30 years ago, it was a status symbol to have one's own car. However, now being natural is one of the trends. It is thought cool! Also, having a car makes people non-active persons. America is the best example; most Americans go to office or school by car. It makes American people fatter and fatter. I know the best way to solve all of these problems. We have to walk on our own legs. Do not rely on cars so much.

Yes, I totally agree with the term of traveling in a group led by a tour guide. It is mainly because, as tourists, we don't know much about the places in a particular area. We will visit only those places that are known to us. But if you travel in a group led by a tour guide, you will be able to see more new places that you have never imagined to see in that particular place.

The tour guide plays a very important role in making our tour very interesting and adventurous. He tells us about the stories of the different places in that area and makes us feel more and more excited to visit that place.

I visited Agra, India. I was traveling with my friends, and we all planned to hire a tour led by a guide so that we could visit more and more places and come to know about the history of those places. As I know, Agra is a city of history. It has lots of history in it, and I wanted to know the proper history of that place. I was sure that only a group tour guide could tell us about it, and I was not wrong at all. He told the whole group about the history of all those historical places in that town. As we know, one of the Seven Wonders, the Taj Mahal, is also located in that city. I was touched by listening to the history of that Wonder. Not only me but the whole group was touched by what all he told us about it.

I think if I were not in that group with that guide, I would have never enjoyed my trip to Agra. As I would not have come to know all that he told the whole group - the history of the great Taj Mahal.

Since then, I love to travel in a group that is led by a tour guide. Actually, what I think is that one should must visit new places in a group led by a tour guide. I'm saying so mainly because you come to know about the places of that town and everything about that town. If you like it, then you can come again on your own without a tourist guide. But if you are visiting a new place for the first time, then you have to travel in a group that is led by a tour guide. If you have a tour guide, then you need not have to take any tension for accommodation, traveling from one place to another. All these tasks are done by a tour guide only. We don't even have to buy tickets again and again. In all, when we are traveling in a group led by a tour guide, we are in a full mood of enjoying. No work tension, nothing. Only enjoyment and enjoyment.

So, I think the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.

I think that both understanding ideas and learning facts are equally important for a student, but if I were forced to choose between the options, I would say that understanding ideas and concepts is more important than learning a list of facts.

The comprehension of the idea that gives meaning to a fact will enable the student to understand all the facts that are based on that same idea. For example, teachers teach children how to add numbers by explaining how addition works, not by telling them that 2 + 2 = 4, that 2 + 3 = 5, and so on. When a child has understood the idea and concept of addition, they will be able to make all sorts of additions.

What I really mean to say is that the understanding of a concept will lead you to the full comprehension of several facts of the same kind.

On the other hand, I cannot avoid noticing that we face a big risk in focusing too much on ideas and concepts: the risk of leaving out reality. Reality is very important because it's the point we tend towards; all ideas and concepts are studied to give reasons for things we've seen in our experience. If we do not refer to reality, we would be just speaking about nothing, and our talking would be only speculation, which is not useful to us.

I would say that we need a balance between the two things, because they are both important to the student. I think that a good method of making them understand a theory or a concept would be giving them examples, because talking about experience is effective in making them realize what concept we are dealing with.

On the other hand, I think that when a teacher talks about a specific fact, they should always say what idea stays behind that fact, so that they would obtain two important results: firstly, the student would fully understand the fact in its implications, causes, and consequences (for example, why a war was declared, what consequences it had...); and secondly, the students would be able to understand many facts of the same kind because they may recognize the same ideas behind other facts.

I do agree with the statement: 'it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts.'

To understand ideas and concepts is not very easy, but once you understand, knowing the facts is an easy job, I think.

I would like to talk about this based on my experience. When I was studying, I used to learn facts first and then try to understand ideas. That was a huge mistake for me; I thought I understood what I had learned, but it was not. I understood it in a totally different way, so I had to study again, which took much more time. Also, when we had group work, I was the one who always gave wrong suggestions, and it was very embarrassing in front of my friends.

So, from that point, I decided to change my approach, which was to understand ideas first and learn facts. It was a little hard for me at first, but as time went by, it was much easier for me to learn facts after understanding ideas. Well, not only that, but after I understood ideas and concepts, I had a lot of questions to ask and opinions to suggest. Also, the time I spent on understanding became much shorter, so I could study other things as well.

In class, I was the one who never asked questions and suggested my opinions, but I changed. How? I became the one who was most talkative in class because, to understand what I had learned, I had so many things to ask and wanted to know. So, I knew from that time that because I didn't understand the concept, I had no questions to ask and no interest in thinking about that topic.

From my experience, I do strongly agree with the statement.

To do easy work or better work, to understand what the idea and concepts are is the first thing to do, and then learning facts will be the faster way to learn, in my opinion.

It is absolutely true that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are. But how does this happen? That is not an easy question to answer, but I think this is also the only question to ask in order to understand why advertisements have this particular effect.

I believe that the main strategy used by market analysts is simply to influence people by touching their weaknesses. Everyone, or at least most of us, wants to be accepted by society (our group of friends or our colleagues). It is an unconscious process, but it is like that, and we can do nothing against it. As a consequence of this process, we tend to buy the products that we feel could change the conception that others have of us in a better way; any object that could improve our social image is certainly to be bought.

I will try to make an example. If I know that David Beckham shaves with a particular aftershave, I might think that by using that specific product, I will achieve the same social approval he has.

That is why most advertisements use famous people to sponsor a product: because we unconsciously want to be like them. Anyway, the question is whether there is a solution to this kind of problem. It is, in fact, a problem we are talking about, because it is linked to a weakness of modern social communities.

I simply think that, considering that we cannot change the entire customs of our society, the starting point is being aware of this fact. This way of reasoning will make us more critical of advertisements, whose products will seem no more attractive than we thought they were before.

I disagree with the following statement. Because so many people are buying cars now, and many people use multiple cars. So, even in twenty years, there will not be fewer cars in use than there are today. Another reason for this is that many new cars are released every year or every six months. Some people buy one car, and then they buy a new one because the new car has a good design and looks good. So, in twenty years, there will be even more cars in use than there are today, and many new cars will be coming out.

Good and hard question. I think this question's answer is not simply yes or no. Because young people have a lot of energy and movement, but they do not have a lot of money. 

So, young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities. Their minds are preoccupied. They like playing games, partying, and doing other things. I think they do not know their responsibilities. For example, a student is supposed to work on their lessons, but they do not do it. Why? Because they are lazy; it is easier than working. 

They know how to swim, play, and engage in other activities, and they value their freedom. I think this is a very bad situation.

I disagree with the opinion that young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities, because I know a lot of young people who do help their communities.

I have friends who are part of a group of comedians. They are all between 20 and around 30 years old. While they perform at theaters to make money, they also perform for children and elderly people at daycare centers. They say that they just really like to see the audience laughing.

I know a group called the 'Guardian Angels.' The group consists of about 50 young people. The members of the group patrol around downtown, and if they find someone who needs help, they help or advise them. For example, when they find girls who are under 18 or younger after midnight in the street, they convince them to go home earlier.

Another example is that of a young woman who helped her community develop their sightseeing industry. She works at a travel agency in her small town. Because she wanted to make her town well-known, she decided to appeal to her town. She planned to have a festival and carried it out. People in the town cooperated with her and brought a lot of food, crafts, and souvenirs to the festival. As a result, a lot of people came to visit her town, and the town has improved its sightseeing industry.

Thus, a lot of young people are associated with their communities and contribute to them. They simply enjoy helping their communities.

All students around the world must learn numerous things and sometimes write reports, organize ideas, take examinations, and demonstrate their understanding.

Every time, we must know facts and specific information to present our ideas correctly. So, we must learn facts correctly because if we do not know the facts, we cannot truly understand an idea or concept, and we may misunderstand different things about the concept.

The first idea is that we must learn facts more than concepts for a correct understanding of an idea. For example, if we do not know the facts about the modern world, we cannot understand why we must learn history. We learn history to contrast the modern and old types or to learn how the historical world was. And if we understand facts, we can understand concepts more easily.

The second idea is that we must understand facts to understand concepts. It means that if we learn about concepts and some tips of facts in our brain, the ideas will mix and confuse us. For example, in history, if we learn only about the damage each country suffered during World War II, it is a fact of history, but it is too specific, and we may become confused about whether we are learning about the situation of each country's damage or World War II. In this situation, we are learning about World War II, so to avoid confusion, we must learn about facts first.

That is my opinion: we must learn facts before ideas and concepts because understanding what the important things and main idea are is crucial. Every time we study about the main topic of our major, we must understand the features. However, the most important thing is to understand the features and use them to understand the main idea.

I agree with the statement, but I have to point out several issues.

I believe times have changed, and therefore, we cannot expect young people to behave in the same way as young people from the past did. They might not give enough time to helping their communities, but this could be due to a lack of time and different targets.

Nowadays, young people are individualistic because we live in a society that focuses on individuals rather than on communities. By the same token, young people focus on themselves and prefer to invest their time in selfish activities instead of community services.

I consider myself a young person, and out of my experience, I can say that I am not interested in communities at all. Furthermore, I have lived in several countries, and what really strikes me is the fact that young people behave completely differently depending on the country they live in. For instance, in Sweden, guys are extremely independent, whereas in Spain, they are much less independent; likewise, Spanish guys might care more about communities than Swedish guys do. So, in order to understand the question, it is necessary to place it in a specific context.

The responsibility for such a situation lies with society, because society is constructed around individuals; rules are made according to what is best for individuals, thus they become the most important thing. Nonetheless, it is possible to notice strong nationalistic movements in Europe that emphasize on communities. If European communities become strong, it would be a change regarding young people's attitude, hence they would give enough time to helping their communities.

To conclude, I agree with the statement, but some aspects need to be considered before talking about young people and their attitude. Young people behave completely differently depending on the country they live in and their culture; however, all in all, it can be said that young people do not give enough time to helping their communities.

In my opinion, I agree with the statement that it is the best way to travel in a group led by a tour guide. And my reason is based on the following reasons.

Firstly, traveling with a tour group is safer than traveling alone. Being taken by a tour guide, you can go anywhere with a security guarantee; otherwise, it is dangerous for you to go to a strange city without someone to take you.

Secondly, a tour guide can tell you where to go and what to see. Obviously, they know better than we do. Being taken by a tour guide, you can make your trip worthwhile, and you won't waste your money, which you spend on this trip.

Thirdly, if you go to a foreign country where the people speak a foreign language that you can't understand, it will be very difficult for you to communicate with others when you want to buy something or ask for directions. In that case, you need a tour guide to help you.

In conclusion, it is better for us to have a tour guide and travel in a group, because it's safer, and you can receive more help.

Most people think that enjoyment comes from experience, but in my opinion, when we first experience something, we enjoy it more. There is a saying that a thing is attractive until you get it, in other words, when you wish for something and do not get it easily, you are more keen to get it. After getting that thing, you lose your interest in it. This is human nature. So, the meaning is that younger people enjoy their life more than older people, because they experience things for the very first time. I also agree with this opinion that young people enjoy life more than older people.

To support my opinion, firstly, I would like to discuss the tendency or nature of youngsters. First of all, they are very curious about new things. They want to explore everything, regardless of the danger associated with it. For example, when I was a kid, I was always curious about parachutes, and one day, what happened, I just jumped from my rooftop with an umbrella. At that time, I did not know what fear was. So, the meaning is that you cannot expect this kind of absurd behavior from an older person. Even if an old person does not know the harm associated with the task, he/she might not take the risk.

Secondly, youth do not care for moral values, whereas old people do follow them strictly. From their experience of life, senior people know the value of ethics and would like to follow them always. On the other hand, teenagers are unlikely to follow moral values, or they follow reluctantly.

Thirdly, in my opinion, you can enjoy life if you don't have restrictions on your activities. Old people have responsibilities towards society, as well as towards their own family. While youngsters are free to do whatever they want. For instance, I like to dance publicly, and I do whenever I get a chance to do it. But I know some older people cannot do it because first, they think about others' opinions, such as what would the society think, or what would be the impact on children.

Last but not least, young people are always open to new ideas or cultures, while older people have a narrow mind. It is easy for a younger person to adapt to a new culture in order to learn it. On the other hand, senior persons are rigid to their own culture in order to preserve it.

In conclusion, although it is true that older people enjoy life based on their own lifetime experiences, I strongly hold the view that youngsters enjoy life more than them. The main reasons are the will to explore new things, no responsibility, less regard for values or ethics, and more energy to enjoy life.

The influence of advertisements on customers is worth commending. The advertisers are projecting their goods to customers in a 'larger than real' manner. I would like to agree with the statement that advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

As an example, consider the advertisements of washing powders, under whichever brand name it may be. The advertisements claim that they can remove different kinds of stains, make the clothes shiny, and maintain the color of the cloth for long, etc. Most of these statements are projected ones. Take another example of washing soaps, which help to make people beautiful, according to the advertisements. Some washing soaps claim that they can make people healthy also. As far as my knowledge is concerned, I have never heard of things like this happening anywhere in real life.

In the same manner, as in the case of washing powder and bathing soap mentioned above, the advertisements of clothing, motor vehicles, food items, etc. are all claiming things that are a little bit exaggerated. The manufacturers of motor vehicles claim that they have the latest technology, about which the consumer has never heard before, and the food products claim that they have all the vitamins and proteins necessary for human beings.

In short, the statement makes it clear that the advertisements are claiming things that are not exaggerated to a great extent. Hence, it seems reasonable for me to agree with the statement that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

I agree with the statement that 'the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.' The primary reason to support this is the knowledge the guide possesses, having been to the place earlier and knowing a lot about it. If I were to plan a trip with my friends, the first thing to do would be to hire a guide. 

Many reasons can be cited for choosing a guide to help us through the trip, the primary reason being their knowledge of local places. If I were to book a hotel, I wouldn't know the pricing, and getting to places could be a big problem. The guide comes in handy, as they know the most economical places to stay in, and these days, we see guides getting into contracts with local drivers to help travelers have the option of having their own transport to see the various places of visit. I have recently come across a travel arrangement company that has its own dedicated staff as guides for helping travelers have a memorable experience. 

The guides, being local to the place, have a good knowledge of the local places of visit and would help us get a good feel of the local culture by showing us the places that showcase the true local culture. Even there are places of eating where we can experience the real taste of the place. These can only be visited if we have a person guiding us to these places. Often, a guide is like a local friend, helping us stay at the best hotels at an economical price, eating the best food, and visiting the best places. 

I would like to conclude the topic by stating that the guide is the best person who can make our visit exciting and help us plan the trip with only a little monetary cost.

I agree in part with the statement that 'Young people enjoy life more than older people do.' The statement stated by the author seems to be correct in some situations and proves to be wrong in others, making this statement debatable. I will provide some examples to prove my point in this essay.

The author's statement mentions 'enjoyment of life.' This term is very relative in respect to people. Every person tries to live their life colorfully in their own way. If 'enjoy' means partying, then it may be possible that young people are doing it more frequently than older people, but when it comes to celebrating, older people are not stepping back from the younger generations.

I do agree sometimes because younger generations are having better and more suitable conditions to enjoy their time. Young people are enthusiastic, active, and have the energy to enjoy sports events by playing and cheering; they are very eager to explore new places. Young people have an interest in movies and go to see them whenever they get the time. They go on picnics to have a change, and one thing that many young people enjoy is dancing continuously for hours. They enjoy various foods of different tastes at many times. This can be termed as enjoyment.

If we accept the author's statement, then it would be like saying that older people are not enjoying but are only carrying their life ahead. The things that are done by the younger generation were being done by the older generation earlier, and thus they lost the charm in those things and do not have enough strength to do the same thing continuously. But they are enjoying in a different manner, sitting on a chair, taking a sunbath, reading the newspaper, and giving advice to younger generations. They are not able to taste various foods because of their physical conditions, but even take that food by hiding from other people. They are the leaders of the house and have certain responsibilities to take care of. This can also be termed as enjoyment, but of a different kind.

In summary, we can say that this point is quite debatable and needs sampling of people and other techniques to reach some conclusion.

I absolutely agree with the statement that it's more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts. The only information from school that never leaves a person's mind is the data that they understood clearly. About 14 years after I graduated from university, it is interesting and curious to see how I can explain most of my knowledge to my son. Most of that information was very well understood, not just memorized.

After a couple of years, even if a person has a good memory, they won't keep in mind the concept and knowledge that they never understood. I learned when I was a child a lot of verses from the Bible, because my kid's school had taught me those verses. But now, because I do not repeat them all the time, I forgot a lot of them. I didn't care to understand them, just learned them to have a good grade. But now, all I can remember are verses that they explained to me and those which have importance in my life.

I think education today should focus more on explaining things instead of just letting students learn them. Our world will be better.

I absolutely agree with the statement. Moreover, I think that good advertisements should enhance the appearance of efficiency to maximize their influence on the consumer.

Advertisements for skin care products are especially good at twisting reality. They usually employ models who have immaculate skin, regardless of the product. Then, they follow the usual recipe by showing the model using the product and telling the audience how big of a change it made on her. It doesn't take long for the audience to react to this display of cause and effect. The problem is that the product probably didn't have any impact on the model whatsoever: she had perfect skin beforehand. And that's not even mentioning the computer enhancements...

However, I think one thing must be realized: the advertisement that I described previously did its job. It implanted a seed in the consumer's mind, and the sales will happen. That's exactly the purpose of marketing: generating sales. I think it's largely the consumer's responsibility to train themselves to mostly ignore advertisements. We know that they are fake, so why do we believe them anyway?

Don't get me wrong: advertising is a regulated business and, as such, should limit itself to what has been ruled acceptable by society. Laws exist that forbid telling lies or deceiving the customer in an advertisement. Building on my previous example, if the skin care product has a real potential for reasonably improving the appearance of skin, then it is the consumer's task to discern what is real and what is embellishment. As long as the advertisement doesn't guarantee the same exact results on everyone, the marketing firm is on pretty safe ground.

I'll conclude by attacking the other point of view: how could anyone disagree with the original statement that advertisements make products seem much better than they really are? That's the way it is. To anyone who believes advertisements display the whole truth unmodified, I have a bridge I'd like to sell to you...

In today's modern life, every individual wants to understand and have the capability to estimate the ideas and concepts of another person. By doing so, he improvises his ideas and comes up with better ideas than the other person. So, I agree with the statement that it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts. I would like to support this statement for the following reasons.

First, by understanding the ideas and concepts, we get a clear image of the aspect. For example, if we are studying a particular subject, it is important for us to identify the main idea of the topic and the concept involved in that particular topic. By simply learning the subject without understanding the concepts, then it will be a mystery for us, even if we spend a lot of time on it.

Second, by understanding the ideas and concepts, we are able to know how to live in society. That means we are capable of knowing how to deal with problems and our colleagues. For example, if we want to ride a car, we must first understand the ideas and concepts, which means how to start the car, how to accelerate, and how to move through gears. By understanding all these, and if we practice, then it will be easy for us to ride the car; not only does just learning help us.

Third, when we encounter new software or subjects, it will be better for us if we have understood the main idea and what are the improvements over the previous one; then these software will be useful for us.

Consequently, the conclusion is that we must learn facts, and we must also understand the ideas and concepts of what we learn; then only will it be useful for us. Simply learning will not help us.

I think that there are a lot of young people who give a lot of time to helping their communities, and therefore I disagree with the statement. I can give some reasons and a lot of examples.

Nowadays in Italy, there are a lot of people who do civil service. It is a public non-profit organisation that provides a lot of free services for the community, and the people who work in it are often young men or women. In addition, there are many private organisations that do not have financial aid from the state and where people work without any wages. In these organisations, there are also a lot of young people.

I can state this because I have some friends, and my girlfriend too, who do it, and I admire them a lot for their choice. For example, my girlfriend works as a volunteer in a first aid organisation, and I know that a lot of services are done by it, such as healthcare to elderly people or first aid when an accident occurs and wounded people must be saved.

Furthermore, it is very common to view young people in these organisations when there are sport or music events. In fact, when there is a football match in my city, there are very often young people from the first aid organisation, which is always present in these cases.

Although I admire this choice and I would like to do it, I cannot do so because I have a very demanding university schedule and so I do not have much time to begin this activity.

In conclusion, because of the many examples I provided in this essay, I can affirm that I disagree with the statement of the question, and I can state that a lot of young people give time to their communities.

There are different attitudes toward taking trips. Some people prefer to act individually and take trips by themselves or with a couple of close friends. On the other hand, some people are defenders of tour packages and rely on tour guides. I personally think that taking trips, especially to strange and unknown places, needs a great deal of information about such regions.

First of all, there are many unpredictable conditions which at first may seem so interesting, but practically, it could turn into an unwanted disaster. For instance, consider you want to go to a place that you have heard a lot about its breathtaking and spectacular view. You are tempted to take a trip and visit that region. While trekking, you feel that you are attached to the earth and could not move. Suddenly, you know that you are in the marshland. In such a situation, there is no remedy, while you could visit there by a group.

Furthermore, in a group, most people could take more responsibility, and all work is done more organized in comparison with individual actions. By sharing different responsibilities and tasks, no person will feel exhausted, and consequently, the journey will be more enjoyable for all. For instance, in a climbing trip, one could prepare the food or one could carry the stuff.

Moreover, generally speaking, group collaborative actions increase individual's sense of responsibility, and consequently, from a social aspect, these people could become good team players and act effectively in other social actions.

To sum up, there are many virtues in group travels. Firstly, decreasing the possibility of occurring some dangerous and unpredictable events. In addition, sharing responsibilities among group members will make travelers relaxed. Finally, being in groups stimulates people's sense of responsibility for other social actions in the future.

I completely agree with the statement that young people enjoy life more than older people do. Enjoyment in itself is symbolic of freshness. Age certainly is a big factor in determining the freshness at heart to enjoy life to the fullest.

The most important factor that supports this idea is that young people are away from responsibilities and day-to-day life woes. They are either dependent on their parents or have some support for themselves. This kind of independence enthuses them to feel free, thereby adding to the fun in their life. Older people are experienced and have families to look upon. Their domain starts and finishes with their families. So, their enjoyment is limited to families, colleagues, and near-ones. Moreover, with the passage of time, the feeling of being satisfied with life increases. The needs shrink to a bare minimum, and emotional support dominates over feelings of enjoyment. Especially those who enjoyed a lot at a younger age tend to get away from enjoyment in older age. Take, for instance, in countries like India and Sri Lanka, older people find pleasure in spiritual activities and become more inclined towards leading an ascetic life, refraining themselves from enjoyment altogether.

Another factor that helps young people to enjoy life more is the state of their health, which certainly is better than that of older people. As age advances, the body does not allow all activities to be done that could be done during young age. For example, young people can have no limits on eating, say, chocolates, but older people can't do so.

Young people, being adventurous at heart, tend to take challenges, make new friends, and thus expand their social circle and broaden their horizon. On the other hand, older ones do not mix up so easily and rely on already built-up relations. Another argument that favors the statement is that since older people have already enjoyed at some point in their lives, so they feel filled and complete in themselves and are left practically with no desire to enjoy. Thus, it is quite convincing to believe that young people enjoy more than older ones.

The density of cars in the world is increasing dramatically each year. As far as I know, there are no reasons to think that this tendency is going to change in the next twenty years. Specifically, if we have in consideration different factors such as the economic growth of countries like China or India, which will allow their population to buy more cars, the general reduction of car prices (especially due to competition existing between American and Asian manufacturers), or the quality of the existing cars (which will allow their use during a longer period). Finally, we can't ignore the fact that more infrastructures are being built all around the world in order to absorb the expected increase in the number of cars.

Although it is true that the number of cars existing in Western markets will increase softly, the BRIC countries (Brazil, Russia, India, and China) are undeveloped markets, where the number of cars will increase dramatically.

On the other hand, prices of cars are being reduced because of the tremendous effort done by American and Asian producers in order to lead the world market.

All the above is supported by the effort done by all the governments in building new and faster highways.

In conclusion, for the above-mentioned reasons, the number of cars existing in the world will increase in the next generations, despite environmental and oil problems. It is built in order to absorb an important increase in the number of cars, providing better cars that will be safer, more economic, and more popular.

In order for any person to succeed, it must undergo many phases, experiences, events, and even take risks. To succeed in your life, you must try new ways or methods in dealing with other people or situations; this will increase the knowledge, experience, and excitement in your life. By doing this, you might change your life from a failing, depressed life to a successful one.

If a person will not take any risks or try anything risky in his life, he will lead a dull, boring life. For example, if you have a fear of heights, you might take a big decision in your life and go try bungee jumping. You might wonder how this will affect my life for the better. This experience will enforce your self-confidence and self-esteem. It will change you to a person who is strong and not afraid of facing his/her fears.

Another example is that if you work at home and you do your work manually, but at the same time, you are good at it and know how to do it well. This might be good in some way, but on the other hand, it is boring and might make you depressed. If, for example, you decide to introduce a computer to your work, but you fear anything that is new and has to deal with technology; this might stress you out. You should take the risk and attend a course that teaches you computer skills. By facing this fear in your life, you and your business will turn out successfully. It will also help you flourish your work and save time, and at the same time, face your fears and build your confidence.

In order to be a successful person, you have got to try new things and take risks in life rather than doing what you already know how to do. This will increase your self-esteem and spice up your life.

I can't agree with this opinion. Thinking of my business experience, I feel we can lead the ideas or concepts to learn the facts or the experiences. So, to learn a lot of facts or experiences from the past is important.

As a first example, my company provides seminars about the business process periodically. This seminar introduces the methods and processes about the business that is relational to our industry. In this seminar, we use presentation documents. The concepts are written in these documents. After the seminar, we collect questionnaires from the participants. They often say that ``Please introduce examples or facts using business methods more''.

Second, when we do a project, we explain the process to our team members. They can't understand how to do it with only an explanation of the concepts. If we explain using examples, they understand what they should do sooner.

For doing it ourselves, we need to know many examples or facts.

Although young people are more outgoing than older people, I do not agree with this statement. Older people are mostly retired and have much more time and money to go on trips and travel to other countries. Younger people, on the other hand, have to learn often and do not have that much money to travel a lot. But they are more interested in discovering new countries and making new experiences. In comparison, older people already have a lot of experience and they often just want to visit places where they have been before rather than go on exciting trips.

However, older people often have problems with their health and therefore they are not as flexible as young people are. Young people can do whatever they want without thinking about their health. Older people, therefore, are more interested in their own family, which is often the most important topic in their lives. And, to my opinion, it is far better to see your own grandchildren growing up than going into discos and staying up all night, what a lot of younger people do.

To sum up the main points, I do not think that younger people enjoy their life more than older people do, because there are so many things that older people can do which younger people cannot do. To my opinion, older people enjoy their lives differently than younger people do, but there is no better way.

Today, young people do not give enough time to helping their communities. I agree partly with the previous statement. The first point I would like to make is that young people nowadays are very busy with their own engagements, which do not leave them with enough spare time. I think this is the main motive behind why young people do not give enough time to helping their communities.

As for me, I am a student at a university, and I never have spare time. I am always busy working at the university. Many times, I do not have time to see my boyfriend and my friends; also, I feel like helping my community, but I do not have time to make it happen.

Therefore, last year I succeeded in organizing a big party in my country to gather money to help poor children. In addition, sometimes I help the children of my country with their homework. These events seldom happen because I do not have enough spare time. My situation is similar to that of my friends. In conclusion, I think that today, young people do not give enough time to helping their communities. In addition, I think that the main reason for this type of behavior is that young people do not have enough time.

Although people's enjoyment differs from stage to stage, it is definitely reasonable to agree with the statement that youth enjoys more as compared to older people.

I have observed in my life that young people enjoy more. 

In the modern world, due to the development of technology, they are more fascinated by new kinds of objects, such as mobiles, computers, the internet, etc., and by using them, they are able to enjoy life.

Younger people are more affectionate towards the day-to-day development of technology, and by using these things, they enjoy more. Older people are not that much aware of these technologies. Because technology is developing rapidly in daily life, younger ones are more energetic than older people, and they can go and do whatever they want. They make friends as a part of enjoying life in most public places, they usually attend parties and meetings, and have the capability to think and improve by adapting to new technologies, which enables them to enjoy more.

Older people mostly feel that they enjoyed in their younger stages, and let us allow their children, who are in younger stages, to enjoy, because most of their life has come to an end. While coming to old age, people think that they cannot enjoy because they usually suffer from most health problems, such as heart attacks, blood pressure, sugar, and bone problems. Today, the development of industries and factories, as well as increasing pollution, affects people's lives, making them prone to many diseases, which makes most older people think that they cannot enjoy the rest of their life.

In most of my experiences, older people allow themselves to enjoy more, as well as to get awareness of social life.

I totally agree with this statement because what allows the car to turn on is the gas, and the gas is getting more and more expensive due to the decrease of worldwide gas resources caused by overexploitation.

Everybody knows that we need to think about how we are going to substitute gas. Some solutions are there, but they are too expensive. However, when we find an appropriate and non-pollutant fuel, it will come out with new automobiles, and it will be a revolution.

Nowadays, cars release too much carbon into the atmosphere, and it's very bad for our planet. Cars pollute too much, and we can't keep on polluting as if nothing will happen. People will realize how bad cars are for the atmosphere, and everybody will prefer to have a bike or a non-pollutant automotive vehicle.

The technology allows us to build these kinds of cars, but the reason why car builders aren't generalizing this kind of car is that governments and people don't really see how fast carbon damages our planet. However, if we keep on polluting with our cars as if there are no consequences, in something like 10 years, the effects will be more violent and will happen more frequently, and that will make everybody want to stop polluting before it's too late.

Cars are being banned everywhere in the world. For example, in Paris, the mayor closed many of the city roads to cars and opened them to buses in order to force people to take public transportation and leave their cars at home. In Mexico City, it's worse because there you can use your car only once a week. The government did that to decrease air pollution because Mexico is one of the most polluted cities in the whole world.

Cars are too much polluting, and it's going to get more and more expensive just to put gas in it. So, in the next years, I'm sure you will see new kinds of automotive.

I strongly believe in the saying, 'Change is the only constant in life.' According to me, a person who changes with time and tries new things can be successful. Some people just want to play it safe and do not want to take any risks in life. They want to stay in the same place, work in the same company, and even like to eat the same kind of food. These people have very few chances to be successful.

I think it is very important to have the courage to take risks in life. But at the same time, a person should also be intelligent enough to analyze their plan of action. For example, if a person wishes to start a company, they should plan and work on a lot of things. Firstly, they should analyze the market and see what effect their product has on the market. Then, they should take care of the finances. Starting a company or business or any enterprise requires a lot of courage because it might work, and it might not.

So one should have the confidence and courage to go out in this competitive world and give their best shot. If you fail once, it does not mean that you will fail every time. One should keep trying until they succeed. But it is also important to learn from your mistakes and try not to repeat them. Failing once should not stop you from trying new things.

I disagree with the idea that understanding ideas and concepts is more important for students than learning facts. There are two reasons: the step of study and correct ideas. The first reason is that it is necessary to learn basic knowledge for understanding ideas and concepts. If students lack basic knowledge, they cannot understand all of it. For example, students in Japanese universities primarily learn basic facts. Then, they begin to study applications. This is derived from the evidence during a long educational history in Japan. So, it is an important step of study for students. The second reason is that learning facts is essential for correct ideas. It is doubtful that students truly understand ideas and concepts unless they learn facts. For instance, in nutritional studies, students who do not know nutrients cannot understand the metabolism of their body and cannot find new ideas and pathways of the body system. For these reasons, I disagree with the idea that understanding ideas and concepts is more important for students than learning facts.

I disagree with the statement because I think that older people enjoy life more than young people. In fact, I think that today, young people have everything they want and therefore don't fight to conquer their dreams or desires. Therefore, after a bit of time, young people get tired, because they know they can have everything. 

On the other hand, older people know how to fight to conquer their dreams because, in the past, there were fewer things. In addition, today there are more and more problems, unlike in the past, because society has become more industrialized and people are always in a hurry. These troubles cause general unhappiness, and young people don't enjoy their lives. Therefore, I think that today, when a young person says they are happy, it isn't true, but there is a way to hide general unhappiness.

Nowadays, due to the fact that lifetime is becoming longer for all human beings, everyone can enjoy life in each moment. However, I do think that young people are still more willing to afford life in a more enjoyable manner than older people do. So, I do agree with the statement that young people enjoy life more than older people do. In my essay, I will provide some reasons that make me agree with that statement.

The first reason why young people are able to enjoy life more than older people are is that, as they are young, they have a lot of experiences to do. Young people may wish to experience emotions that they have never tried before because of their age. They might like to have a family, and so they try all they can to find a good partner, enjoying any occasion they will have in order to reach that aim. Moreover, they would like to experience work. They would like to enjoy the jobs that they eventually find and they will try to appreciate all the aspects of them, as they represent their first experience in the labor market.

Younger people might enjoy life more than the elderly, because, as they are young, they have more energy to afford life itself. On the contrary of old people, young people enjoy sports, such as football or basketball, which are an essential part of life, and which require a lot of energy that older people, in general, do not have. Furthermore, thanks to the energy that young people have because of their age, they have more opportunities than older people to make funny and relaxing things, such as trips or parties, which are so helpful in order to enjoy life.

To conclude, I do think that young people enjoy life more than old people do, because of the experiences they would like to try in their future, and because of the energy they allow them to exploit the most enjoyable aspects of life.

Will there be fewer cars in twenty years from now? My instant reply is no, and mainly because I realize how our technology is rapidly advancing, and cars will change, changing only to make people love them more, satisfying urges for beautiful car models, creating more desires to own one.

Looking back into the past since cars were first invented, there's a huge difference in how many cars are owned. Compared to before, when only the rich owned cars, cars nowadays are getting cheaper in price, considering the amount of second-hand cars being sold and how cheap it is to buy one. As time passes, the rich will continue to buy more cars and sell their old ones, and at the same time, the lower class will buy these used cars for a cheaper price. With this cycle going on, more and more people will be owning cars rather than selling them.

And why are the rich buying more and more cars? Generally, it's because of the constant change in car technology; the desire for speed and unique designs. A stereotypical view of rich people is that they buy cars just because of their looks. Car companies, looking at this, will exploit this point by coming up with more and more uniquely designed cars. There's a rare chance that rich people will disappear and their interest in buying these cars will decrease. On the other hand, there'll always be lower-class people who are ready to buy these used cars at a lower price.

Most people want to own a car, and in my opinion, this is a psychological desire - jealousy. When a person sees another person with something they do not have, that person will also want a car. When a rich guy sees his friend with a really cool car, he will also want a unique car of his own. There are always more generations joining us, and with this cycle of jealousy and how the car price falls, it'll be easier for people to own cars.

In conclusion, I'd say that in twenty years, or even fifty years, the amount of car usage will only increase but not decrease. Unless something better than cars joins this market and successfully grabs car buyers' attention.

Students encounter many kinds of information in their courses or lectures. It can be regarded as an information overload on students. The lectures usually include ideas, concepts, and facts that students should learn and use. I assert that students should try to understand ideas and concepts instead of facts in the lessons in order to be successful. Understanding ideas and concepts rather than facts offers knowledge that is more lasting and provides students with a deep and total understanding of topics.

First of all, a student has two choices when studying a lesson: memorizing the facts included in the subject or understanding the main concepts and ideas covered in the subject. If they prefer memorizing to understanding, their knowledge will be lost after a few days. Because of this reason, covering ideas and concepts is more useful and helpful than learning facts.

The other important advantage of understanding ideas and concepts is a deep and total understanding of the subject. Ideas and concepts have more meaning than facts. In other words, they are more valuable in terms of meaning. On the other hand, facts may be just a case or specific situation. It is narrow and has a general meaning about itself. It seems that ideas and concepts should take precedence over facts for students.

To conclude, it is the student's preference whether they pay more attention to ideas and concepts in the subject or not. The other choice is memorizing facts in the subjects. Understanding ideas and concepts is more lasting and provides students with a deep and total understanding. After considering the two advantages of ideas and concepts mentioned before, they are enough to prove their importance.

Young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities. I agree with the above statement that young people do not give enough time to help their communities. There are many reasons to support this.

Firstly, in this competitive world, young people are much concerned with their careers, goals, and their aims, so they are more involved in their studies. As a purpose, they go to college regularly and study their day-to-day lessons regularly. The subject has become so vast that they have to refer to many books, and it takes much time for them. So, they do not have much time for other activities, such as helping their communities.

Secondly, people nowadays show much interest in enjoying themselves with their friends. They either go to the movies or restaurants or pubs or to the playgrounds with their friends. They are always in a mood to enjoy themselves. They do not help the communities because they do not spare their time to work on good things and helping their communities.

Thirdly, the people these days have become very selfish, and they do their own work, which is helpful to that particular individual. They do not want to help their communities, which is beneficial to all. That is why they concentrate mainly on their work rather than helping the community.

Finally, nowadays people are more attracted to media, such as television, newspapers, magazines, weeklies, etc. People are more concentrated on these, knowing about the world through newspapers and news on televisions and other means. There is also a rapid growth of importance for computers and the internet, and it draws the attention of young people towards it. Young people are much attracted to finding new things, and they browse the internet, spending most of their time finding out the information that is useful to them.

Due to these above-stated reasons, nowadays people, mainly youngsters, do not spend enough time to help their communities.

The discussion about the success of people according to the risk level of their actions should be split into two parts. 

On the one hand, there are people who try new things and take risks to fulfill their targets. On the other hand, there are people who do what they already know how to do well. 

Such two different types of handling risk will reach final success. People have different kinds of meanings about their own ability to take risks. If I think about such differences, I will talk about two friends of mine. 

The one boy is about 35 years old. He reached one of the best school examination grades with a score of 1.2 during his school period. He began studying law and finished university after less than the regular studying time of 4 years with a very good grade. His first contact with the economic or, in general, with business had taken place for him at the age of 26 in a big company as an assistant for law-specific questions for consulting contracts. He was very resistant against risk, maybe because of his first contact with the business world. He had been in such an office and position for almost 9 years without a lot of experiences, but also without trying any higher risk than going home 10 minutes before the regular business closing time.

My second example is a boy who is 28 years old. He finished school with a grade around 2.5, which had been the middle field in his final examination year. He started his own business idea after his examination. His business was about offering IT solutions for small and middle-sized companies. In the time of the new market economy, a lot of companies used the consulting work of his company. He had a lot of fixed customers, which needed his help regularly. During such a period, he had the idea to export the concept to other countries, which he started in 1999 with Austria. 

Banks helped him to fulfill such a target by offering a lot of money. After two years, he had 4 offices outside Germany and a sum of 4,500,000 Euros as a negative deposit on the bank. 

The concept failed due to the crash of the new market, and he lost almost all his life standards in 2 months and would not be able to pay the whole deposit to the bank in his lifetime.

As a conclusion of my two examples, the level of risk cannot be argued by the level of school education, meaning the final examination grade, and the university status. 

Moreover, people with an ability to try risks will have faster success and will stay there if they control themselves regularly. The risk of falling down due to uncontrolled mistakes is more realistic in comparison to the risk-averse people. 

However, every human being has to know for themselves which goals and objectives they want to reach and how fast to get there. In addition, such factors will bring the level of risk ability and the success.

I disagree with the idea that the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide. I think the best way to travel is alone or with a friend. There are two reasons. First, it's more freeing. Second, backpacking is more exciting.

The first reason is that I have much more free time than in a group. To be specific, I can go wherever I want and spend a lot of time in some places without any resistance. If I want to go shopping, I don't care about other people's opinions. So I can go to small shops and explore where I'm interested. That means I have freedom in a trip.

Secondly, it is more exciting. For example, when I visited Italy last year, I stayed in a youth hostel. There, I made friends who came from other countries. So, we went to popular spaces, restaurants, parks, and rivers together. Until now, I keep in contact with her by email. Even if I had not planned to go to a concert in Italy, I saw the pamphlet and went there. I cannot forget that concert.

That's why I think the best way to travel is alone or just with a friend.

Advertising was created to make people buy things. Nowadays, competition is very significant between brands, and each brand has to struggle to convince people to buy their products. Marketing departments deal with that.

As for me, I do agree that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

Because of globalization, we can nowadays find almost whatever we want in each country, and more particularly in developed countries. This implies that competition is very fierce since there are so many products available for customers. The choice is huge, and how can we decide which product to buy when we do not know them?

As a consequence, brands launch many advertising campaigns. They do their best to create the best campaign. Thanks to advertising techniques, they enhance their products as much as they can. Because they need to have the product that would most catch people's attention.

Usually, when someone looks at a billboard or watches a commercial on TV about a new food product, it is so well promoted that we are most of the time very interested in the product and very excited to go and test it. But we are unfortunately often disappointed. Indeed, if I take the example of a new burger launched by McDonald's, the burger will seem very good in the picture. However, when I go and try it, the bread will be too dry, the cheese will not have the same aspects... And once again, I will wonder why things are almost never the same as in the advertising.

Advertising agencies usually deal with significant budgets and use amazing techniques sometimes to enhance the product.

Not only are the aspects not the same, but also the features are not what they tend to be. Actually, some products ensure that they can do this or that, and when you try them, the result is not the one you were expecting.

Finally, I would like to add that this does not only occur for products but also happens for famous people. Most of the stars you see in magazines are gorgeous, but in real life, they are not the same; you can be very surprised. All this is due to the marketing that makes everything or everyone seem perfect.

It is a hot topic that successful people love to try new things and take risks rather than sticking to what they already know how to do well. Many different people hold different opinions from their respective angles. In this topic, I need to say I agree that success belongs to people who like new things and are not afraid to take risks. There are two reasons to support my idea.

First, I think the most important quality is adaptability. The people who like to explore new ways can always find a solution when they meet problems. In contrast, if you just rely on traditional ways to solve the problem, you are limiting your situation and may not overcome it. In other words, if you are not afraid of the problem and face it, you can find it is not a problem for you easily. For example, when I was a child, I needed to wait for my mom to pick me up and take me back home after school. One day, my mom couldn't pick me up because my grandmother was sick and she needed to go to the hospital. At that time, there was no mobile phone to be the contact access. My mom was very nervous that she couldn't find me. In the meantime, I tried to find something to do and went to the library. In there, I met my brother who was studying, and he took me back home finally.

Second, another quality is bravery. People will succeed because they are not afraid to try any ways to accomplish their goals. Generally, many ways mean many chances. That is also meant to increase your chances when you are trying new things.

In conclusion, because of the above reasons, I strongly believe that people who like new things and adventures will be successful more easily.

In modern societies, people are confronted with all kinds of advertisements daily. Commercials on TV, huge wallpapers, and other kinds of advertisements influence and manipulate people to make them buy products. Are these advertisements really truthful, though? Or do they promise some things that don't even exist?

I personally think that most advertisements make products seem a lot better than they really are. We just have to look at TV commercials to realize that they often promise more than the products actually offer.

Let's look at the pharmaceutical industry, for example. Every day, we get to hear about new cosmetic products for beautiful skin or pills that help to lose weight. I tried many of these products, and I was never pleased with them.

Another example of false advertising is food commercials. Specific products we see on TV often seem to be a lot larger than they actually are. With the help of computer programs, people are able to make their products look better on TV or on paper. They use specific technical methods to convince their customers of their items.

A third example of the lack of truth in advertisements is the methods of politicians to get more votes. They often promise great achievements and advertise with big headlines on wallpapers that they are going to improve the country's situation. I have gained the experience that they usually don't keep their promises.

I come to the conclusion that we should be really careful about believing what advertisements promise us. Many of them don't tell the truth about their products. I personally think that these false promises are even the essential element of advertisements. We know that their only purpose is to convince people. Therefore, advertisements do always only show positive aspects of their products. Besides, our economy puts a great amount of pressure on firms who try to sell products. There is a huge competition between companies, and everyone has to sell as many products as possible in order to survive. This forces people to create advertisements that are convincing and persuasive, even if that means they have to hide the truth and be unrealistic.

I myself am considered a young person and live in a community comprising both young and old. It is a common perception that young people enjoy themselves more than older people do. However, I think this perception is faulty. In fact, it is the older generation who enjoy life more.

Youth has many advantages. It is perceived that young people enjoy more because they have more energy, enthusiasm, and time. However, what they do not account for is the society and its demands. With time, our society has been evolving; it has become more demanding, more particular, and much younger. Even though the younger generation does have more energy, enthusiasm, etc., it does not have the time to enjoy.

'I wish the week had eight days' - this is a common phrase heard from all young people across the globe. Youthsters are pushing themselves to become responsible and successful citizens every day. They are always wanting to do more in less time. Their life has peer pressure, study pressure, exam pressure, job pressure, personal pressure. Added to this are various family, friends, and other social obligations. There is too much to achieve in such less time. Thus, the attributes which should have assisted them in enjoying life more become the reason for them to work and achieve more. Time is always short. In this rush of things, when does one get time to even breathe?

In contrast, the older generation is at a stage where they have undergone all psychological, communal, religious, physical metamorphosis. Thanks to various state and public policies, they are no longer financially dependent in old age. Thus, they are free to experience life as it is. Though they lack in the attributes favoring the younger generation, they compensate by maturity, patience, and motivation to truly enjoy life.

It is commonly said, 'Life begins at Sixty.' This is true, because by this age one is free of all responsibilities and obligations and can enjoy life at their own pace. There is true enjoyment only when one has time to experience every minute particle.

Yes. I do agree that most of the advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

Advertisements, in fact, in today's world do not only mean the disposition of the product's essential features and its looks. Instead, they are supposed to be a glorified display of the product with the fake promise that it is and will prove to be a very valuable product, which will indeed provide enough customer satisfaction. In some cases, the promise may turn out to be true, as it totally depends on the company and the 'product', the real one.

Advertisements are supposed to be, in some cases, only heart winners! I say only because the products of that same field, competitive products, are all but equal in terms of quality or quantity they provide. It's only upon the marketing and advertising faculties of the organization if it can make it look 'much better than it really is'. And only when it makes a place in the customers' heart would it be sold, and the profits for the company would flourish.

In a world of competition, the manufacturer is compelled to make the product perceived as the best it can be. And indeed, as supported by the studies of the current markets, the products that are well advertised are the most sought after by the particular segment of customers. Indeed, if you add a bit of sheen to your product or make it look bigger, better, 'tasty', or tempting to the public on TV, magazines, or any other means of media, chances are that the customers, in and except your clientele, would be at least somewhat lured to the product. And though they might buy it only after careful examination of the product and considerable reviews from their friends, they are at least ushered to go to the markets and check out how and what it really is.

Now, the actual sales of a product would obviously depend partially on how well it really resembles the advertisement 'glorification' and partially on the competition it faces.

So, in my opinion, the advertisement in today's world is a necessary part of the marketing process. As real as it can be kept, it should be. But I would consider it compulsory to give a bit of weight to the product and its features.

I agree with the statement that says that for students, it is more important to understand ideas and concepts than to learn facts. In fact, as a student, I believe it is essential to learn well by first trying to understand the ideas and concepts that are behind the facts I must learn.

If a person does not understand the why behind the facts, I think it is not useful to learn about them. In my experience, I always try to understand the reason behind an event. Because I think that if I understand the basic concept, it will be simpler to learn facts and not forget them.

I study criminology, and for my work, it is basic to understand why a certain event happens, what is the principal cause that causes a certain type of event. For example, for me, it is not important to learn the fact because I must understand the reason behind a certain type of behavior and not only the result of it.

For my type of study, it is not important to learn the fact but the reason. But I think that it is not useful only for my type of study but for all types of faculties. For example, in the scientific faculty, it is also very important. It will be very important to understand the reason why a certain natural event happens, for example, and not learn the events alone.

In conclusion, I think that if a person wants to understand facts very well and not learn them because of school or because someone says they must learn them, they must question themselves about the basic ideas and concepts that are linked to those events. Also, if, for example, the event they must learn is not a good event, they must try to do it in a different way.

Nowadays, advertisement is one of the most important aspects to sell their products. I fully agree with this statement that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are.

Advertisements of products can make their goods more beautiful or attractive. It is necessary for people to notice their products more impressive. There are many types of advertisements, one could be television advertisements, another one could be supporting entertainers, and so on. And showing some specific advertisements many times, people can get accustomed to the product.

For example, the iPod, which I bought by seeing many advertisements and seeing my favorite entertainer who has an iPod, can be a good example. iPod is the most popular item. Many Hollywood stars have this item. Many people bought this item. We can see iPod advertisements everywhere. And we can see the goods in the movie or drama.
