Cars seem to have a drastic impact on every class of people, starting from the lower middle class to the upper class. So, nowadays, a car cannot be disappeared.

Secondly, they are considered to be more comfortable. A car is preferred because it is easy to reach our destination rather than waiting for some public transportation. It doesn't give much stress and makes people get relaxed when compared to other means of transportation.

At any time, it can be used and make our work done in a cool way instead of rushing for other ways. Finally, nowadays, the prices of cars are also declining due to some reasons. So, they are affordable by even a middle-class person, which again symbolizes a rise in the car population.

Being a car owner, any person can make a plan spontaneously and even implement it. Like planning for a picnic. An example of why anyone goes for a car is that it may be used for all purposes, both for official and personal things. And a car doesn't release much gas, and it is not a victim of pollution too. Cars not only serve as personal vehicles but are even used as public transportation, like taxis. So, a car has its effect on every walk of man's life, to reach the destination and to enjoy luxuries too.

I conclude that I can't imagine a road without a car, as it carries many advantages.

I agree with the statement that successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.

It depends on how one defines success, so I take success to mean becoming famous and changing the world for the better.

One example of a successful company is McDonald's, the famous fast-food chain in the United States. I recently read a book about McDonald's. The founders of McDonald's were two brothers in the southern United States. They were selling hamburgers at a store that offered drive-through service, where customers could buy food without leaving their cars. This was a major innovation in the restaurant industry at the time. However, they changed their approach. They revolutionized the entire process of making hamburgers by assigning each person a single task, such as baking the meat. Previously, one person would perform every step to make a hamburger. This new approach enabled them to serve food more quickly. Due to their efforts, McDonald's became the largest hamburger company in the world.

Trying new things always involves some risks. It would be great if new endeavors brought success. However, if they fail, it would be a nightmare. I think challenging new things is a kind of lottery. We cannot know if a new thing will be successful.

Another example of successful people is the person who created the iPod. This product is one of the most hit products of Apple Company, which used to produce Apple computers. The idea of making the iPod the lightest and having a big capacity for music was a fashionable idea. Apple Company was the first to create products like the iPod. The attitude of challenging new things would make Apple accomplish success.

Because of these reasons, I agree with the idea that successful people try new things and take risks rather than doing what they already know how to do well.

I personally think that if someone has a broad knowledge of many subjects, he will be able to find a solution to a larger amount of problems in life and work. If a person has to solve problems on his own and can't cooperate with other people, he would certainly be advantaged with this type of knowledge.

On the contrary, if a society is well-organized and all the parts that cooperate are well-prepared in a specific subject (obviously, each part has a different subject), efficiency can be increased a lot, making the society very competitive.

Taking the statement from a more personal point of view makes me think about those people considered as 'geniuses' who improved a lot in a specific field but consequently had a lack of knowledge in other fields, for example, social relationships.This makes them suffer and escape different situations just because they can't stand them.

The genius creates something with his ability that will always be remembered and appreciated, but he has to suffer for it.Actually, I wish I were a genius at something, but at the same time, I like the way I was educated, so I find myself in agreement with the statement.

I agree that traveling in a group led by a tour guide is the best way to travel. If you visit a country without a guide, you can manage if you know a little bit about the place. However, if you want to visit more places in that country and you don't know about them, then you need a guide. Without a guide, whatever you know, you can visit the place, but if there are many visiting places, you cannot visit them all. At the same time, you can face language problems. If you visit a place simply by seeing it, it is a waste. If a guide is with you, he can explain the historical significance of the place. If you know about the visiting places completely, you don't need a guide.

In some cases, if you want to visit a new place, you want to know the language of that visiting place. At the same time, the food at the visiting place may not be good. If you take a guide along with you, he is familiar with that place, which can be helpful to us. The guide knows the language, so there is no communication problem. Moreover, some visiting places may not have good food, but a guide knows where fresh food is available.

Another advantage is that he is familiar with all the visiting places in the area. Additionally, he is well aware of which hotels are good and which hotels are available within our affordable financial budget. It would be better to go with a guide whenever you travel.

Travel is a nice thing. The people who travel in a group will have a very nice time and they will spend a nice time. I agree with that. For three reasons, first: Traveling with a group led by a tour guide will allow you to know new people. Second: Traveling with a group can visit many places. Last: The people with you in the group can become friends. Traveling with a group is very pleasant in any case.

Traveling with a group led by a tour guide will allow you to know new people. If people travel with a group, they can know a lot of information about other people. They will know about the language and some information about other countries.

Traveling with a group can visit many places. If you travel with a group, you can visit a lot of places with people to make it fun and enjoy a lot of time. Traveling with a group can enjoy time with other people. They will enjoy shopping with other people and make nice teams in this group.

The people with you in the group can become friends. In this group, you can make a lot of friendships. This friendship will be from another country and can know a lot of information about many countries. So, you will have friends from all over the world.

Traveling with a group is very nice and good. Traveling with a group can be pleasant and can know a lot of information about many countries. With a group, you can visit many places with a lot of people. If you travel with a group, you can make national and international friends.In my opinion, the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.

This is a very important issue with respect to the community and the youngsters who are part of this community. The issue, which does need attention and analysis, is that many young people nowadays do not give enough time to helping their communities.

Although it is not the case that the whole young crowd has become indifferent to helping their communities, I certainly believe that, looking at it wholly, young people nowadays do not devote enough time to helping their communities.

There are several reasons for my acceptance of this statement, and I would like to state them in the following paragraphs.

The main reason I feel this way is that today's youngsters have become too narcissistic. They are all self-centered and bothered about their personal progress. This is due to the ever-increasing competitiveness. In this competitive world, to catch up with the pace, each youngster is busy polishing themselves for the contest. And in this course, they remiss the community. They are too worried about their own progress and achievements to look into community matters. Each of them wants to be the best, and they don't want to afford wasting time on others.

The other reason that makes me accept the statement is the prevalence of corruption, violence, robbery, murder, and a whole lot of crimes taking place. If the youngsters gave enough time to the well-being of the community, wouldn't the scenario be different? All those murderers, robbers, rapists constitute of whom? Aren't the major chunk of them the youths of the community? Instead of being helpful to their community, they are becoming the cause of all sorts of sufferings and traumas to the community, I must say.

Further, I feel that youngsters are not contributing to help the community because they are getting away from moral values and disciplines of society. Today's youngsters want to be more independent and do not want to be taught all those lessons of helping others. What they learn from the growing technological world is how to make themselves modernize and how to cope up with the rest of the competitors. Amidst this, they do not care for the community. For example, today, most young people spend half of their time on the internet. Now, by exploiting the internet, what are the possibilities of them using it for others' sake or to help someone compared to the possibilities of chatting, browsing, looking for job opportunities, searching for institutes for further education, etc.? Certainly, the probabilities of utilizing it for personal benefits are quite higher.

All these reasons and examples make me accept the statement that nowadays, youngsters are not much interested and hence not devoting much time to help the community. This can be attributed to their ignorance about the well-being of others and zeal for personal holistic development.

For centuries, there have been many inventions that have changed our lives a lot. One of those inventions is the automobile, which we use almost every day. Some people consider that car use might decrease little by little, and I agree with this idea. These days, many people, including me, worry that the population might reduce in the future, and because of that, car use might decrease, too. Also, thanks to developing technology, public transportation has become much more convenient now, so this could be one of the reasons that people use cars less in the future.

Nowadays, many people are concerned that the population might decrease in the future. According to investigations, the population rate is focused on the elderly class. One of the reasons is the development of medical technology. Moreover, more women are going out to work, and recently, they usually refuse to have babies because they will not be able to avoid quitting their work. Because of that, in the future, there might be less population in the world, and car use might be down, too.

As technology develops, public transportation is now much more convenient than when it began. In Korea, there were almost no facilities, such as elevators, to support injured people like in Japan. However, this year, when I went there, there were many elevators to support those people. Now, still, there are many cars on the street, but people might use more public transportation in the future because it is pretty cheap despite its convenience.

As I mentioned, in the future, fewer people will use cars. Of course, still, many people will use their own cars because it is convenient, too. However, a lower population will help reduce car use, and more people will use public transportation, which has become more convenient.

I would like to travel in a group led by a tour guide, because this way makes my trip better. Actually, there are negative aspects to a group trip. For example, it reduces my own free time. If I travel in a group, I have to pay attention to other people, so even when I want to buy a souvenir and take a long time, I cannot do this.

However, there are more good aspects to a group trip. Last year, I went to Australia in a group. As it was my first trip abroad, I felt a little nervous at first, but gradually we began to talk to each other and my nervousness was removed. More, during the trip, I lost my wallet, but the people who traveled with me looked for my wallet together. At that time, I was very moved. Moreover, a tour guide taught me a lot of things about Australia. Before I traveled to Australia, I knew few things about Australia, but thanks to a tour guide, I learned a lot of things about Australia, for instance, the history of Australia and the Aboriginal people. When I was a junior high school student, I read a book whose main location is Australia, and the man in the book climbs Uluru, so I wanted to climb there. However, a tour guide told me that Uluru is a special place for the Aboriginal people and they do not want us to climb. I did not know such a thing.

That is why, thanks to a trip in a group and a tour guide, I had a very good time during my trip, so I agree with the statement that the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.

I quite agree with the statement that young people enjoy life more than older people do.

Being young means a lot of energy. Young people have more energy compared to any older person. More energy helps them to take part in more activities. Though this could be only true if these energies are spent towards positive activities.

When a person is young, he is always in a learning stage. So many times they may come across new places and new things, they will enjoy knowing about it, because it would be their first interaction with it. For example, simple driving - young people may find it more joyful than older ones. Because driving would be relatively a new activity for them compared with older ones, who could be frustrated with daily traffic and other issues related to it.

If you ask this same question to a school child during their exams, it can be expected what their answers could be. But during their vacation time, it may be opposite. This lets us know how immature a human being is when he is in his young ages. An immature human being means they don't understand responsibilities towards their life as much as an older person could understand. In short, a young person could have fewer responsibilities in his life compared with an older person, which puts an older person into a more stressed life.

Said all these, life is great. It's better we understand our different stages of life and enjoy each stage as it comes. Each stage of a life has its own beauty, to lead a happy life, one should understand this and should enjoy his or her life to the most, no matter in what age he or she is.

In my opinion, there is no single correct answer to this question. Of course, both ways can lead to success. My main reasoning is that it depends on the path one wants to follow, whether an academic specialization makes sense or not. My aim is to explain this argument in the following sentences by looking at the broad academic field of business.

In Switzerland, a master's student can choose whether they want to specialize in one specific subject, such as finance, or to keep their focus on a broad approach, which includes subjects such as marketing, human resources, finance, strategic management, risk management, and leadership.

To illustrate my hypothesis mentioned above, I will now take a look at two different jobs within a company.

A general manager and their management team do not need to be specialized in one specific subject, as they have to address problems from many different fields, such as leadership issues, marketing decisions, and financial topics. An important aspect in the job of a manager is the need to quickly decide on many different issues. Thus, a broad education is actually an advantage.

An employee in the financial sector, such as in a bank, does not need to have such broad knowledge. Rather, it is essential that they possess in-depth knowledge of the transactions within the sector and of the sector itself. The job requirement is much more focused. Rather than just knowing a little about everything, it is advisable to have a solid knowledge of this special topic - and finance, for example, is actually still a rather broad subject.

But, of course, it is needless to say that knowledge is always an added asset. However, one has to decide first which path will be chosen in order to be able to make a sound decision whether an academic specialization makes sense.

Nowadays, the car is connected to our everyday life more than any other way of transportation. We often use cars to go to work or to school; we use them in order to be somewhere else in the least time possible. We also use cars, and maybe first of all, for going out in the evening, when buses and tubes are maybe full of undesirable people and things like that. 

On one hand, the car is for sure our best way of transportation because it is easy to use and does not require queuing for tickets, for example. However, I think that the real question is: Is the car really the best solution, the best urban solution to reach a place, to go somewhere? Or maybe would the car be one day a real problem in our everyday lives, instead? I think that the answer is that in a few years, the car will be the worst way of transportation because of the increasing number of drivers in the streets, and most of all because of the incoming problem of pollution!

According to me, in the end, in twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today as a natural consequence of the improvement of our own lives. I also think that my opinion is supported by all those experiments that scientists and engineers are doing in order to convert our way of moving in a city with alternative ways of transportation and also with alternative fuels, maybe less harmful. For example, I think that in the future, our cities will support much more transportation by train than by car in order to move many more people at a time, eliminating problems connected with traffic and pollution.

It is always better to understand facts.

As a student, I really think it is easier for us to understand a topic by using examples and learning facts. When students just see the concept in class or the definition about something, it's difficult for them to remember it just as they saw it in class. However, if they see a specific case about the same concept, it will be easier to keep it in mind, because they can relate it to real life.

For example, last semester in my human resources class, I had a teacher who always helped us to relate the theory with the practice. I remember one class where we saw what an interview was and what it consisted of, and she took a classmate to make him undergo an interview, explaining all the steps we needed to take to make it right, and showing the most common mistakes that we could commit.

I recall it was so enriching for everybody in class, and after that, when I entered my first job, I could remember everything I had learned and I took it to reality.

When we learn facts, it also helps us to convey them with our own experiences.

On the other hand, I have had classes where we get full of concepts and definitions of some subjects, but we really don't know how to put them into practice, and I do think all this information goes away.

In conclusion, to learn in a classroom or out of it will always be better to understand facts and relate them to reality, and also it will be easier for us to explain and to teach somebody else, because we have already absorbed this information, and professors should do this with the students since they are kids to provide them with an important tool to learn better.

Nowadays, advertisement is very important. When we look around, we can easily see that the type of advertisement has developed because technology has developed very quickly. When I open the TV, I can see many different and interesting advertisements. If one person wants to be successful, they must make a good advertisement. On the other hand, they must pay a lot of money. Therefore, we should prepare an advertisement for making a good product.

The first reason is curiosity. Generally, everybody watches television every night. The advertisement gives many opinions about the product, and on television, we can make many changeable points, such as shape, color, or size. For example, when I watch an advertisement, I want to use the product because, on TV, the shape and color are very attractive.

The second reason is that in the advertisement, we can see famous people. I believe that it is very important because many people like to watch famous people. This type of advertisement is expensive, but I believe that it is not important because, in the future, we will gain much money. For example, last week, my sister wanted to buy Coca-Cola because she saw the famous people in the advertisement. So, emotional intelligence is very important in the advertisement. Advertisers should find many different types of advertisements when they prepare the project.

As a result, there are many reasons for making a good advertisement. When we read the examples in the passage, we can easily see that the advertisement is very important for the product. If we give many importance to the advertisement, I believe that the product will become popular.

As the young generations of children and teenagers continue to display themselves as unique, wild, and crazy, people tend to think they do not contribute to the community or promote altruism. In fact, they tend to think young people do the opposite. This assumption is not entirely a fabrication. There are countless children who are willing to give up their time to help the community. These occurrences can be observed anywhere, especially in school. Several schools offer a myriad of student activities that help their communities, which students volunteer for generously.

The most popular program among the students is orphanage or retirement home visits. Students voluntarily sacrifice their time after school to take the hike to an orphanage or retirement home nearby. During these visits, students play with the children, exchange conversations with the elderly, help clean up trash around the area, all in all, promoting warmth and happiness to the community. Undoubtedly, these generous acts promote a better environment.

Another program includes Amnesty International, which takes helping communities to an international level. Students organize themselves into groups and become aware of social and political injustice around the world. With knowledge, they promote social awareness and facilitate active political participation to fellow students by writing letters to governments. Being future leaders of the world, not only are they aggregating interests to governments for the community, they are influencing others to become equally aware of the world around them.

Undeniably, sometimes young people do become lazy and not help the community. They would rather enjoy luxurious times in front of the television or playing video games. Sometimes young people just need their relaxation time and enjoy themselves as kids. A childhood must also be dominantly characterized by exuberance. Furthermore, there will always be other more responsible kids doing more helpful work for the community to counterbalance the laziness of others.

Benevolence and sacrifice are indications of maturity. Countless young people already help the community voluntarily, as seen in the various successful school activities. However, young people are still growing and adapting. If they are not, we should not hinder the process and let them enjoy their childhood.

Yes, I agree with the statement. Because young people are at a stage of life where they will enjoy a lot compared to old people. Whereas old people enjoyed at that age, but not now.

But nowadays, young people enjoy more than old people enjoyed. The reasons are: young people are in good health and they are very flexible to any kind of environment. As they are younger, naturally they are in a position to do anything like playing, dancing, drinking. Whereas old people cannot do all these things; it is not possible.

Young people will enjoy with friends, going with friends, and spending time with friends in chatting, etc., roaming here and there. Enjoying holidays in other countries with friends, parties. Whereas, coming to old people, they cannot move anywhere because, as they become old, their health will not support moving to other places or the environment does not suit their health. They could not enjoy at this age.

Coming to the young people, they can adjust anywhere, they can do anything because until their body permits. Young people will enjoy a lot compared to old people because there are many changes in present days compared to previous days. Keeping present days in view, we can say that young people will enjoy many things.

Young people will enjoy by attending parties and coming late nights to the house or going for a long ride, going with friends for a picnic. Enjoying weekend parties with friends or official parties, etc., enjoying all the tastes and entering into each and every corner to taste the thing or to know about the place. If they found a new place, they will reach there and enjoy; they will know about that place.

Hence, I conclude that young people will enjoy more than old people by saying above reasons and with examples.

In today's world of cutthroat competition, advertising plays a major role in increasing the sale of any product. There is a large variety of products available in the market today. Similar products are manufactured by many companies. Hence, the customer today has a variety of choices.

The differences in these similar products may be very minute. The advertising helps in exaggerating these differences. Take cars, for example. One car manufacturer may exaggerate about the spaciousness in the car by comparing it to a lounge ambiance in its advertisement. Another car manufacturer in the same category may emphasize on the outer design of the car, comparing it with the aerodynamics of a spaceship. Thus, both the manufacturers have a selling point to be emphasized.

But, as the saying goes, looks can be deceiving because all that glitters is not gold. There are so many instances in which the customer is fooled into buying a product because of the glamour created around it through advertising. These instances are coming to life almost every day. There are many letters in the 'letter to the Editor' columns of newspapers that highlight this point. Let us consider a simple example of buying an apartment. One of my close friends wanted to buy a new apartment. He collected many brochures and visited many incomplete sites of construction. He decided to finalize on the basis of the brochure comparison. The brochure of the apartment he zeroed on spoke about the spacious rooms, facilities like a gym, sauna, play park, and many more amenities. After actually shifting to the apartment, he was surprised to see big spacious rooms accompanied by a lot of plumbing problems, no gym, the sauna without water in the pipes, and so on. But if the advertisement hoardings were to be followed, this was a dream apartment. This is a common case for a large variety of products.

Going from the advertising point of view, the advertisers are paid to make the products look good even if they actually aren't. Take an example of a popular razor that shows leading sports personalities using it. This razor actually caused skin problems to a customer, according to a newspaper. But the company that made this ad made a profit and successfully helped in selling the product.

There are many more instances that help in supporting the statement that advertisements do make products look much better than they actually are, and I completely agree with this notion.

Today, advertisements can convince consumers that every kind of product is the best one and that you can't live without it. There are a lot of techniques that make a product irresistible to consumers. But is it always true that all advertised products are as good as they seem to be? I think it's not: they seem much better than they really are. Last week, I bought an apple pie that I saw on a television spot. In the images reported on TV, it seemed really tasty and healthy, but when I ate it, it was not so good, and I got sick. I couldn't sleep all night long. 

In my opinion, it would be better for food or dress companies to spend their budget improving the quality of their products or decreasing the prices instead of investing it on advertisement. 

The problem is that business rules are different from what is better for the people. But something has to be done. I think that certifications of quality are a very good investment for the companies to show the real value of their product and, at the same time, a good way for consumers to verify the quality of what they are buying and choose better between different brands.

There are some young people who do not give much importance to helping their communities; they are preoccupied with their own world. They have enough time to do all other work, but when it comes to helping their communities, they will run away. These are the people who, after some time, are the ones living in the same community. They should remember only one thing: if today they don't help their community, there will be a day when they need some help from them, and on that day, nobody will be there to help them. If we are not ready to help ourselves, no one will help us.

When we are living in a common place, we have to learn to help each other; by doing this, we can live without any troubles. If we live like this, one day will come when there wouldn't be any problems in the world. By this, we could live as a complete family, which is what we all need to do - at least try to help each other. I think this is happening, for example, if we take globalization as the medium through which we are coming to one place, and all rich countries are helping the poor countries in a way they could; this is an example of people who are willing to help.

We cannot also say that young people are not helping their community; there are some young people who are creating awareness among different sectors of people about the importance of helping one another. They are forming groups and communities for those who are in need of help.

So, this suggests that there is a section of young people who are willing to help other people and communities, but the percentage of these people is less, and we need to increase this habit and make sure that everybody inculcates this practice.

Nowadays, advertisements are a key element of trade business. Indeed, advertisements are always used as a means to improve the sale of goods. Some people think that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are. I agree with this statement.

The reason why advertisements were invented is to increase the level of sales. Therefore, advertisements promote products and must convince the buyer that he needs the promoted products. To this aim, the products are presented as the best product ever invented, even though it is often false. Advertisements are created to attract customers, to make them buy the proposed products.

For instance, it is common to see on television advertisements that explain that the presented product has been tested by a certain number of customers who expressed their satisfaction when they used the product. However, there is no proof of such a study, and those results cannot be ascertained.

The promoted product must appeal to the customer, and therefore, lots of technological means are used in order to improve the picture of products. Indeed, nowadays, lots of software are invented in order to fix pictures, to erase some elements of the pictures. To some extent, advertisements are often diffused on television; the best way to attract customers is to show a beautiful product, with nice colors and a nice shape.

For example, advertisements often concern food products. When a cake is promoted, the nice color of the cake will obviously attract the customer. In the same vein, the nice shape of the cake will also appeal to the customer. Therefore, the customer will buy the product, thinking that he will get the same article as the one exposed in the advertisement, and he will be disappointed because the cake cannot have, in reality, the same color as the one obtained thanks to informatic software used for pictures.

As a conclusion, advertisements are always using false information, and it is difficult to put boundaries between well-conducted advertisements and false information.

When it comes to learning facts, some people argue that it is an easy way to understand some methods. Personally, I think that students need to understand ideas and concepts rather than to learn facts. This is because understanding ideas and concepts widens people's intellectual horizons, and people can use these ideas in more practical ways.

First of all, students can broaden their intellectual horizons by understanding ideas and concepts. In the case of learning facts, it is obvious that it helps people recognize some physical things. However, these factual and physical things only allow students to learn those facts. This would limit people's imagination, so they cannot understand things above that, such as using other fields. For example, one of the most famous scientists in Korea, Ho Jin Moon, once said that when he was young, he was taught by teachers who just conveyed factual information to students. His parents thought that these methods would restrict their son's understanding, so they moved to America. There, he could take more idea-based education, and when he grew up, he returned to his mother nation and had eagerness to dispute ideas and concept-based educations. He argues that by taking this education, students can understand more in-depth knowledge.

On top of that, people can use their knowledge in practical ways. In today's society, people are bound and driven by hectic schedules, which make people only focus on the facts, so they cannot use their knowledge only in a few fields. However, the basic ideas and concepts in education are linked to each other. Especially in science, if they understand these basic concepts, learning scientific concepts is more easy. To demonstrate, according to a study released by the Korean National Research Center, more than two-thirds of surveyed scientists responded that understanding ideas and concepts is more important because, by doing this, students can link their knowledge not only to their major fields but also to other similar scientific fields. They said that electronic science can be useful in manufacturing engineering, so students who major in engineering need to understand electronic science basically.

In conclusion, I strongly believe that students should focus on understanding ideas and concepts because they can widen their intellectual horizons and use their knowledge in more practical ways.

There are lots of successful people in our circumstances. Most people know that successful people have an active mental attitude. It means they always try new things. Of course, most successful people do not stop doing so, according to research, most successful people do that.

First of all, some successful people want a stable life, and they want to become a celebrated person in one part of something they do well, rather than others. Then, maybe they have lots of benefits about one part of things, because they have already excelled in their parts. However, they cannot develop in other parts. They should keep only their position. Therefore, I believe that if they fail at something, they can think that failure is only an experience for more approaching life.

On top of that, everybody knows that one of the big companies is Samsung. The company owner said that success is for prepared people. It means that everyone has to try other things when they finish their work in their own parts. Then, you will be successful. Most people relate success to earning money. Samsung company's owner said that if you do what you can, you can earn lots of money and your life will be successful.

In short, I believe that most successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing.

You often hear that in the future, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today. I also agree with this statement. There are several reasons why I think so.

The first is that the costs to drive and possess a car would be much higher than today. Because the price of oil would get higher. Also, today you can see this, because in the last few years, the price of oil has exploded. Additionally, the taxes for cars would raise because the government cares about the environment and needs money. So, not every person will have the money to use a car.

Another reason why cars will be fewer is that there will be a lot of other options to get from point A to point B in the future. For example, a transrapid will be built in Munich in the next few years. So, many people would not use a car if they have the possibility to go by the transrapid. And today, many people are researching new ways of transporting people that are not as bad for the environment as cars are.

A third reason is that more and more people are moving into the big cities to get a job. So, there will be more people in the bigger cities of the country. And in big cities, you normally don't need a car. I think so because with a car, you need so much longer than if you use other possibilities because there are many traffic jams in bigger cities. For example, a friend of mine studies in Munich, and he needs an hour to get from his home to the university by car. With a bike or the subway, he only needs half an hour. So, I think many people will then use a bike or go by subway.

In conclusion, you can say that there are a lot of good reasons why in twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than today.

For lots of people, traveling is one of the most enjoyable experiences. Throughout the world, millions of tourists travel every year. Some of those tourists travel independently, while others are led by tour guides.

In my opinion, the best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide because by this way I will be sure that I will visit the most interesting places in the country to which I traveled. I remember, for instance, my first trip to Egypt and how the tour guide ensured that I and the other group members saw the most fascinating archaeological sights there. Moreover, I believe that being led by a tour guide is more secure than exploring a foreign country alone.

However, being led by a tour guide would not be a happy experience for a tourist who wants to wander around the real cities and discover the other lively sides of a country.

Furthermore, there are other methods that can provide the same capability as a tourist guide. For example, books that include useful information about the places that can be enjoyable for tourists to visit, maps, and illustrated books.

Another important reason makes me prefer traveling with a group: being with a group of someone's country or culture would make them feel more secure and safe rather than knowing no one.

In conclusion, I would prefer to be guided by a local person who knows more than me about their country.

I disagree that traveling in a group led by a tour guide is better than traveling on our own. From personal experiences, I've learned that touring on our own gives more opportunities to be more knowledgeable about the place we're traveling, more time to travel unknown places, and more chances to communicate with locals.

As a personal example, when I went to Cambodia last winter, I went with a tour group led by a guide. Before I went, I knew I had to study about the places I would go, but I postponed such duties because I was expecting the guide to explain everything. Just as I expected, when I went to ancient sites in Cambodia, the tour guide explained every little detail, leaving no space for me to further find out. However, when I went to Europe by myself this winter, I felt obliged to study about the background information or about the European history because there was no guide to answer my questions. The fact that I was planning all the journey on my own gave me more responsibility to study about the place I would go to.

Such cases are not merely limited to my personal examples. Also, when we travel with a group led by a guide, we have to follow the tour company's tight schedule. Our itinerary is often scheduled, and we merely follow where the guide takes us. We don't have much free time to ramble around new places other than the famous tour cites. However, when we're on our own, we don't have to move according to a fixed schedule. We are free to go anywhere we'd like. Other than famous tour cites, we could simply go to local markets or take a walk down the streets -- places that are ordinary but also places where we can smell the local's custom and culture.

Furthermore, when we're traveling with a guide, we're too busy following the tight schedules to actually communicate with the locals. Touring with a guide often ends with visiting famous cites and taking pictures. But when traveling on your own, we have more chances to actually be friends with the locals. Although there might be some language barrier, we can use body language and talk with locals about their lifestyle, custom, and culture. Traveling on a group led by a guide lacks the precious moment to learn about a country in a first-hand experience.

Traveling in a group led by a tour guide surely does have some benefits. We don't have to plan all our schedules, and we don't need to worry about not knowing something because the guide is there for you to explain everything. However, so far from all my journeys, the most memorable and long-lasting experiences were those that I traveled by myself. Starting from scheduling my itinerary, studying about the country, exploring new places, and meeting people from walks of street is truly the valuable and the real journey I never forget.

I agree with the statement, but I think it will depend on different reasons. It will be difficult to live without cars, especially here in Italy, where most of the trade and traveling is made by cars. I believe that we will all benefit from the lack of cars, but we need to get used to other means of transport. First of all, people should start using public transport. In this way, companies will improve their means, and they will be ready to sustain the changed habit in twenty years. Secondly, we should invest more in research and development for alternative means of transport and to lower the prices of transportation, such as those of airplanes, trains, and ferries. The government should also improve infrastructures for these means of transport, as often airports, railway stations, and harbors are not enough efficient. As nowadays cars are the biggest source of pollution, it will be positive for the environment and for all of us. Scientists are already working to find alternative sources to make our cars run, as in twenty years' time, we might run out of petroleum, and this will probably be the main cause for fewer cars. Despite this, we will need to discover alternative sources to make our cars run. New cars are already on the market, which work with hydrogen, electricity, or solar panels. However, they are just prototypes, and we are not sure about their benefits to private transport. Finally, it will cause fewer accidents on the roads, as most of the deaths in the Western hemisphere are caused by road crashes.

The issue of whether young people these days give enough time to helping their communities or not is an issue that has been debated extensively over the last few years. I personally don't agree with the statement, as I feel that young people still play their part in helping their communities. The issue comes up again and again because people just take the actions of these young people to heart without actually understanding the situations they face and seeing how things have changed for these young people over the years.

First, I have always noticed that it takes a thousand good deeds to be appreciated and just one bad deed to be cursed. Very often, the actions of one person are taken as the trait of a group of people without actually knowing what these other individuals are like. A few bad examples have helped promote the idea that young people nowadays don't care.

Secondly, a lot has changed in the life of young people. The world is a great deal more competitive today than it was ten years earlier. Everything from an education to an occupation demands much more. Time cannot be taken for granted anymore, and young people find themselves more and more time-bound every day. I don't think this aspect is completely understood. Yet, you see these young people doing the best they can to help their communities. A simple example of this is how, at the time of someone's death, everyone is there to lend a helping hand to the family that has suffered the loss, and at such occasions, if you try to think about it, it's usually the young people who run around to help all the time.

Moreover, there are so many young people who have dedicated almost all their time to serve and help their communities. There are so many young people either involved with or running NGOs or organizations that deal with serious issues like education or ample food and shelter for their communities. These people have devoted all their time and energy for the betterment of their communities.

In the end, I would just like to say that there might never be a common agreement on this subject, but I firmly feel that the young people are doing their part. I guess all we really need to do is open our eyes and see the bigger picture, and I have a feeling that the results, like me, might not support the statement either.

People are always tending to pursue the most that they may obtain. When it comes to the aspect of knowledge obtaining, the situation is similar. However, sometimes they have to choose whether to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects or to specialize in one specific subject. For myself, I will choose the latter, but will try to get some balance as well.

Nowadays, knowledge is exploding every day, as a result, it is rather difficult for one to learn broadly and deeply at the same time. Having broad knowledge seems attractive, but actually, it is not practical after the second thought. In the academic circle, there are experts and authorities in almost every field, all of whom hold some specific research interests and accomplishments of their own. If one just spends most of the time on learning knowledge of many subjects, he or she may not have the time to do related research. Besides, since it is quite easy to gain information currently, it is not necessary to know all, for if you want, you can look up the needed information soon.

However, if one specializes in one specific subject, things will be quite different, especially when he or she chooses a valuable but rarely-touched field. Under this situation, he or she will become the expert in this field and it is possible to do some quite profound research on it, which will be more beneficial if one knows a lot but really knows little on each subject. As long as the researchers are willing to share their results, communicate with each other, and do teamwork when it is necessary, it does not matter whether all these researchers are able to have broad knowledge.

At the same time, to keep some balance, it is also important for a researcher to know some basic knowledge on related subjects, which could broaden the eyesight and inspire him or her with fresh ideas. Besides, this will not waste too much time.

To sum up, generally, I think it is better for one to specialize in a certain subject, but it will be good to know some concerning knowledge at the same time, which can make the work most effective.

I agree with the statement that advertisements make products seem much better. It is because of my thoughts, surveys, polls, and experiments.

Firstly, famous people usually make most advertisements. It appeals to people enough. Most people want to be like actors, singers, and actresses. Maybe the product that is advertised by a superstar is more attractive to people.

Secondly, the survey, conducted by Chosun Daily, one of the best newspapers in Korea, shows that three-fourths of overall candidates surveyed feel that advertised products are more qualified. Also, the poll, conducted by the same company, shows that people think that advertised products are safer.

Thirdly, when I was a high school student, my friend bought a product that was not advertised. It was an expensive tape player. It was disordered the next day. My friend wanted to get guarantee service. He did not get it. So, he had to buy again, and he bought an advertised product, Sony, because of its services.

Lastly, when I was young, I had two toys. I did not have discrimination between the two toys. However, I was perfectly changed in my mind after the advertisement of Superman, my hero in the past. Although the toy was much cheaper than the other, I always took Superman's toy because I had pride in myself.

In conclusion, given several reasons, I think that most advertisements make the products seem much better than they really are. It seems that advertisements make us attracted to the product.

I have a quite open opinion about the statement that 'In twenty years, there will be fewer cars in use than there are today.' 

On the one hand, I would totally agree with this. Each day, you can read somewhere in the newspapers how the prices of petrol increase from day to day. Petrol has reached its highest price, and there might be no decrease in the next years. As well as the limited oil reserves, which begin to reduce every hour, it will be difficult to drive a car. Perhaps people will wake up and use public transport, like the bus or train. That would lead to a better environment, because pollution and noise would reduce. As we could also see with the Transrapid, public transportation development is great.

On the other hand, we all see that there is no end to new car production. Nearly each inhabitant over 18 years old has once driven a car. Unfortunately, for a lot of people, cars are a symbol of status and lifestyle. They like to express their position in society. Some also don't want to give up driving a car, because it is a comfortable way of getting somewhere quickly and easily. For a lot of people, especially men, cars are more than just a thing to transport them. It is a plaything, which they like to show and compare with others.

Conclusively, I think there will be fewer cars in twenty years because some people in the future will have to stop driving their own cars. Insurance and petrol will become too expensive when the prices further increase.

Do young people enjoy life more than older people do? If I were asked to answer this question, I would say no. Many older people think and say that young people have freedom and can do whatever they want. However, that is not true for young people because there are many things they must do before they become adults.

As a young person, I feel like I have a very limited life. Teens go to school every day, they have to do their homework and projects, and they also have to prepare to go to college. Preparing for college gives a lot of stress to young people because most students want to go to good colleges. In order to go to a good college, they need to work hard in school and also do many extracurricular activities. Even though they have something they want to do, either there is no free time for them or there are things that are not allowed to young people. Also, in order to achieve their goals in the future, it seems necessary to go to college and study in the field they want to study. Without that education, it is hard to get a job in a high position or to earn a lot of money.

Not only that, but also they need to listen to their parents because they are not adults yet. If the parents do not agree with something that you want to achieve, you need to either give up or change your mind. There is actually no freedom for teens at school or at home. Older people are more able to do whatever they want because they have freedom and do not have financial problems because most of them work. Basically, they can buy anything they want without asking or getting permission from their parents, and they can also do whatever they want without being pressured by their parents.

We do not exactly know when a young person becomes an older person, but what we know is that when a person becomes old enough, they can enjoy their life doing whatever they want and they have more freedom than young people.

I totally agree with the statement that successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.

In my observation, successful businessmen or professors often do things or subjects that other people do not understand at all. For example, ten years ago, while most people did not know the values and benefits of computers, Bill Gates knew it. Because he went ahead and tried new things (computers), he made a real big fortune from doing the latest technology.

On the contrary, to those persons who only do what they know, successful persons are always trying new things. They usually have an open mind to absorb all the latest concepts, and they often take risks. For instance, if a businessman adopts an idea that he has never heard before, it must be very risky to use it if the idea is not practical to operate.

There will be two different ways for using new thoughts: success or failure. Most people will not dare to adopt new things because they are afraid that they may lose everything. In this way, they gradually develop the idea that they do not want to learn new things and take advantage of them.

In contrast, this idea is seldom formed in the heart of successful people. They, of course, know the risks might be, but they are not afraid. Successful people usually have a positive mind to keep them going ahead.

In conclusion, I think that I truly agree with the opinion that successful people try new things and take risks rather than only doing what they already know how to do well.

I agree that it is more important for students to understand ideas and concepts than it is for them to learn facts. Because today, at every school, every student only learns facts. Even they do not understand what the teacher is talking about. I think it is not good for young students. If the teacher reads and teaches what is in the book, they would think about the same thing. In addition, it would suppress children's free imagination. Getting high scores is one of the big problems in the world, especially in Japan. I heard on television that there is no student who often reads a book, does not like to learn new things, and they do not know why it is so important to study.

I think all teachers must teach children to get interested in knowing new ideas, not only facts. Children should think about their own ideas. It will make them more intelligent and interested persons. Another big problem is that most Japanese cannot speak English. And I saw the graph on the news; they said Japan was the worst. In high school, students will learn English from teachers who are not native speakers. They study such as grammar and how to talk. I think it is not very useful for students. They have to learn listening, writing, and need a chance to talk to people who speak English. It will also make students interested and easy to understand in class. I do not think that only learning facts is bad, but I guess if students learn that, they would lose their individual ideas and sense of imagination. That's why I think understanding ideas and concepts is more important than learning real facts.

One thing history teaches mankind is that extremes are never the best solution. They might serve one's purposes for a short term, but in the longer run, they usually reveal their shortcomings.

The very same rule can be applied in this case.

At first glance, the advantages of specified knowledge seem to be overwhelming. Nearly every modern company or even scientists in universities serve as good examples. To be successful in your part of business, you have to know everything about it, and additional knowledge only serves as a distraction. Since the times of big breakthrough inventions are all gone, everybody specializes in a very narrow field. On a small subject, we now have an absolute expert, knowing nearly everything about it. To a certain extent, this is absolutely necessary. Who else can deal with nano-composites, for example, except someone who has studied this subject for many years? But as soon as a wider overview is needed, this type of scientist very often fails. How can he know about new methods in medicine that might well be adopted within the field of nano-composites if all they ever studied are nano-composites? It is therefore possible that lacking interdisciplinary skills often result in disadvantages.

Furthermore, a person with a tremendous amount of knowledge on only one field most definitely lacks interest in other things and therefore misses so many things in life.

The other extreme would be people who know something about everything but nothing of importance about any specific field. While these scientists might have the interdisciplinary skills, they would certainly lack the knowledge they need to combine anything of real use and importance. There is simply no need for these persons in academia, since a certain understanding of specific problems is always needed.

I therefore strongly support the idea of a combination of these two types. Of course, I am aware of the fact that we can never gain specific knowledge on all academic subjects. This will remain an illusion.

I favor the humanistic approach. Specialize on one or two subjects, but never lose your ability to overview a wider field. If you are a mechanical engineer, don't lose your interest in theatre.

The statement 'It is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects than to specialize in one specific subject' is an important point, which plays a big role in society, especially in education.

On the one hand, you can agree with this statement because it is very important to have a basic background of education. You should know the basic facts in different academic subjects. This way of thinking can be found in schools. At school, pupils are expected to be good in every subject. They should be good at maths, languages, biology, chemistry, and sports. So, a pupil has to concentrate on every subject to achieve good results after school.

On the other hand, critical people would ask, 'Why should a pupil who is good and very interested in maths also be good and interested in sports?' This would be the other way of thinking. Some parents, for example, think that it is enough when pupils are talented in certain subjects, because after school they go to a university, where they also concentrate just on a special subject, which they choose to study.

I am of the opinion that a mix of two ways is the best solution. I think people, especially children, should have a basic education in every subject. It makes no sense to send a child very early to a school that is based on a special subject, like a science school, for example, or a sports school. Pupils should learn the basic information in politics or in geography and other important subjects. I think it is a good way to send children firstly to a normal school, and after graduating, pupils have to decide on their own where they want to go and which university mostly agrees with their own interests. So, the pupils would have a basic knowledge that you need in society, and after this, they can concentrate on a special subject.

I don't think all of the young people nowadays are helping their communities, but I believe some of them do. Sometimes this kind of topic appears in the news or the newspaper. Adults think young people don't help and are just playing around, but I don't think it is true.

Now, in the world, many people are working for themselves, for their families, and for the world, but adults say they are not helping. But is this true? I don't think so. There are hundreds of young people working for their communities. But why do adults say that? Maybe because they have not seen it.

How can they show the adults that they are doing something for their communities? Do they have to come in front of them and show what they have done? No. Young people nowadays are working and helping their communities in their own original styles. For example, the club DJ. From the adults' point of view, they can only see the young people playing around until the morning. But they are working hard in their own style and helping their communities.

If you look around really carefully, then you can see that young people nowadays are giving their time to helping their communities in their own original style.

This is a very hard-to-discuss question, and I believe everybody you ask will tell you a different answer about this aspect of the generation gap. But with the tendency that always accuses the other group of being more enjoyable than the one you belong to. So, everybody's opinion, as a young or older person, could be affected by such an influence. Thus, I am trying not to be affected by such group thinking.

I would say that, in the overall majority of our society, people are enjoying their life, although older people do it more. Surely, one could say the young are lazy and the only thing they have in mind is making party. But I think that relates to their younger and more active body and mind. And I am convinced that the relatively short time young people party cannot be compared to the long periods the older people sit around watching TV, playing poker, or spending their free time in female chatting clubs. Of course, there may be several older people who use their time efficiently by working, keeping the front yard nice, or being active in a sports club. There are also people who are ill and cannot do what they have in mind. But in summary, I want to make a statement about the mean, the normal, older person.

Young people are simply doing much more, in both fields, enjoying and working, than older ones. I do not know of any of my friends or study mates who think of life as only joy. They are all working hard and learning in schools, universities, or learning a handworker's profession to provide the best possible opportunity to get a job and earn money to run a family. Especially in today's time of mass unemployment, the younger generation must perform more not to be one of the workless. That was different in the last decades, when getting work was no problem and there existed a shortage of factory workers. Today, workers must have a profession and be well-prepared for their job.

The older generation is now enjoying their dusk of life in a financially saved situation. When the young people will be old, the situation will certainly have changed for the worse.

I agree that in twenty years, advancements in the convenience of public transport and/or concerns for the environment will decrease the number of cars in use compared to today.

Public transportation will prove to be more efficient than owning a private car. Not only does it save money, but it also saves time. Using public transportation will save money in two ways. Firstly, the expenses on fuel would be cut to zero. Secondly, one no longer has to spend money on car maintenance. Adding to that, using public transportation will also save time because there will be less traffic. This is especially true in subways.

Because of these increased benefits in using public transportation as technology advances, the population who would prefer owning a car would dwindle.

Another reason that the number of cars is going to decrease is that there are growing concerns for the environment. Environmentalists have been active in promoting the conservation of nature through the media. They have successfully managed to alert the world about the seriousness of global warming and have also educated society on ways to prevent a serious disaster. These same environmentalists have convinced many that the preservation of nature is highly urgent. Also, they have stated that the earth will run dry of fuel in a few years. Thus, increasing amounts of people who abide by such beliefs will result in the decrease of car usage.

In conclusion, because of the effectiveness of public transportation and concerns for preserving nature, fewer and fewer people would be willing to own cars. When public transportation saves money and time compared to owning a personal car, and when the earth can be subject to serious catastrophe because of your use of cars, could you possibly purchase a car?

Travelling has become a part of our lives, such as eating, drinking, and exercising, etc. But why do people travel a lot nowadays? 

Firstly, the reason why people are willing to travel is to be open to other cultures and traditions. They can also meet other people from different ethnic backgrounds or religions in order to exchange new ideas and form opinions from all that, or simply take a short period of time to relax, and that is called a 'vacation'.

In fact, when we decide to travel, we usually need someone to lead us; otherwise, we'll get lost and be deceived. Moreover, we might also find it really tiring and fruitless since everything is new to us, and we need some time to get accustomed to that new country. On the one hand, we can buy guiding books and maps, and on the other hand, we can hire a tour guide. Which one of the above means is effective?

In my opinion, a tour guide is necessary because he can be really helpful by making us visit the most interesting spots or the famous ones, and it's easier, of course, as we won't need to rent a car or look for taxis every time we need to visit a new place. Moreover, he'll be well acquainted with his native country and tell us additional things that sometimes aren't revealed in books, and we can ask him all the questions we would like to ask, whereas by using a book, we don't get really satisfied with the results, and it doesn't provide all that huge amount of information given by that guide. Another interesting point is the reason why people prefer travelling by groups instead of travelling alone is because they just want to enjoy their time and leave some souvenirs of that trip.

At last, according to my experiences, I would suggest that the best way of travelling would be in groups and guided by a tour.

Facts can be researched by students in order to improve their knowledge about an idea. There are several ways to support the statement that it is more important to understand ideas and concepts than to acquire knowledge of facts. Science requires students to think constantly and develop a critical way of thinking. For example, for a lawyer, it is more important to learn how to think logically than to learn a set of laws in order to be successful in their career. A set of laws can change within one period of Congress; this will leave the given lawyer who just learned a set of laws obsolete. They will need to go to university to learn again the set of laws to be useful in their field. Fortunately, this is not the way that lawyers learn about their career; most of the knowledge acquired at a law school is to think logically. Even with a change of legislation, a lawyer still remains a lawyer. However, there is always the requirement to be updated with technology and new research to be successful in any given career. For a historian, there is no discussion that it is required to learn facts. The same concept does not apply for a doctor. 

There is always the necessity to improve processes to evolve with society. This is the reason that universities develop research departments. If society does not make research, there will be no progress in many industries. In order to achieve progress, students make research to understand ideas and concepts. If their knowledge is based just on facts, they would not be able to discover new theories. For example, all the improvements in telecommunications. Thanks to the understanding of ideas and concepts, students have improved internet telephony, making it possible to call long distance. 

Finally, it will be impossible for society to progress if we just waste time learning facts. Like in a picture, society will be static with no improvement, like the Mennonites who like to live in the past, ignoring the new opportunities that ideas bring.

Travelling is sometimes for a holiday and seeing new places, but sometimes it is for a job. For the first, you can travel yourself or travel with a group led by a tour guide. Sometimes you need the first one, sometimes the second one. I disagree with the statement: The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide. It changes according to your psychology or your destination, which can be abroad or inside your country. I prefer to travel on my own because of several reasons.

Firstly, when you travel with a group led by a tour guide, you must follow them throughout your travel. It does not come across as good to me. It seems very restricted and boring. Before you travel to some places, sometimes you make some searches about this place and you imagine something; also, you plan something. When you travel with a group, if a tour guide plans to see places where you planned to see, it is a problem. In addition to this, you can be bored with the place, but because of the group, you must be there. So, it is not a good situation.

Secondly, tour guides generally take you to historical places. Sometimes it is good, but for a person who is not interested in history or art, it is also a bad situation.

In conclusion, there are many reasons like these to prefer travelling on my own. Tour may not be as good as you expected. The hotel may not be clean or comfortable. Although there are some advantages of travelling with a group led by a tour guide,

I would disagree with the given statement, i.e., 'The best way to travel is in a group led by a tour guide.'

I strongly feel that the best way to travel would be alone or with a bunch of people sharing similar interests. The reason for this is the simple fact that the tour guide would take you to a set of places that the city is famous for, and these places might not necessarily interest me in particular.

I would like to cite a simple example. Last year, for New Year's, I had to go to Goa (which happens to be a major tourist destination in India). Goa is known for a lot of things: great beaches, brilliant churches (Goa was under Portuguese control for over 200 years, so there is a lot of European influence in the architecture), and a pretty rocking nightlife.

My friends and I decided against having a tour guide because 'Goan Music,' in other words, 'Psy Trance,' interests us more than the churches or the beautiful beaches out there. The tour guide would have charged us a bomb for showing us the churches, talking a bit about the local culture, and walking us down the beaches! We went to Goa for the simple fact that it happens to be the hub for some great electronic music, and since everyone in my group was inclined towards the same objective, all of us started exploring the city all by ourselves!

We bought some local maps, hired a couple of bikes, bugged people for directions, and it all added to the experience! I wouldn't have enjoyed it to this extent had I gone for a tour operator.

Guides are only out there to make money, and in today's world, guides aren't a necessity while going on a trip because you have enough information available in the form of books, the internet, etc.

So, I would strongly recommend going alone and doing away with a tour guide, just because it would add to the whole experience of travel.

Does success come to you or do you come to success? Would doing only what you are used to doing be proficient enough to take it to another level? The key to success often comes with a certain risk involved.

Observing successful people, you often find a pattern: those people are open to new ideas, will go new ways, and broaden their vision continuously. They are not shy to take risks, and thus help progress to be made.

If one only did what he used to do for years, his vision would narrow, and his success would be steady. Many people succeed not in doing the same thing year in, year out, but in breaking out of their usual work pattern. Certainly, this very step involves a lot of risk. If you fail, you might lose your job. If you invest lots of money, it might be lost. If you are working with hazardous materials, you might risk your health or even your life. But technical progress hardly would have been made if it were not for people who risked their lives in order to find ways to improve airplanes, cars, or machinery.

If no one had dared to award Larry Page and Sergey Brin with two million dollars in 1998, Google would not have revolutionized the internet. Now, it has paid off a millionfold.

Risks have to be taken, and people need to be open to new ideas to develop them further, to try them out, and to eventually decide whether they are worth it or not, in order to gain a competitive advantage over their rivals.

Nothing is secure, and nothing is to be gained if we just stick with what we know. Only in very rare cases does success and development come to us. In most cases, we have to work hard for it, never knowing whether it will pay off.

One of the best examples might be stock brokering. Is he who always went for the safe bets the most successful? Generally, the highest revenues are made through investing in the more risky stocks. And only those who are open to taking the risk will succeed long-term in this market.

Being open to new things and daring to take risks brings you further than just going with the normal daily routine.

Since World War 2 ended, the young generation has enjoyed life more than the older generation. They, the would-be Baby-boom generation, were good at various forms of entertainment and were exposed to splendid media, such as Hollywood movies or Broadway musical shows. There are a few reasons why young people are better at having a great time than older people.

First, young people know well how to play whenever they want eagerly. They know where the best bar is, what trend is going on, or who the most famous actor is these days. Of course, older people have no time to have fun in order to earn enough money for their family, like a daughter who is interested in an expensive jewelry brand. However, young people do not need too much money because they have no one to provide for. They just maintain their living costs, which include money to go to the best club in Soho.

Second, young people are healthier than older people because they have young and strong bodies that older people do not have. Old people have to pay for their medical care and medicines in order to maintain their bodies. In contrast, young people are not required to make any medical payments at all.

Finally, young people tend to be curious about all the strange things they have never seen before. When older people avoid a stranger from another country, young people try to get closer with positive activity. For example, in a small town, a tourist visits for academic research, such as modern agriculture from a strange country, and young people or children will try to talk to him or her.

These reasons are why I think that young people are more enjoyable than older people.

I agree with the statement.

I think that facts show that most successful people have tried new things and taken more risks than unsuccessful people.For example, most big computer corporations are owned or managed by people who took many risks in the 1970s and 1980s by betting on new emerging computer products.Those people took many risks and succeeded.

Such reality is in accordance with the economic principle that 'more risk involves more gain.'Therefore, it is probable that a person who takes risks will have more profits than a person who only does what he knows best.This is under the assumption that the person who takes such risks is a well-educated person and not just a gambler.

Also, if a person only does what he already knows how to do best, it will not gain more experience and the knowledge that it will require in order to be successful.For example, if a person only does what he already knows how to do best, it will probably never fail.This may seem like something good, but it is not.It is very important to fail in order to learn from our mistakes.That is why successful persons have often failed numerous times.For example, many of today's rich people have been declared bankrupt many times.

Finally, the results of trying something new are most of the time a new product, which, after having the corresponding trademark rights declared, gives a person the exclusive right to sell it.For example, most successful pharmaceuticals have become such due to the invention of new drugs.This could only be achieved because such pharmaceuticals took many risks and did things in a different way.It is important to mention that this does not only apply to professionals but also to artists.Many artists have been successful because they have performed their art in a different way, taken many risks.

I agree that most advertisements make products seem much better than they really are. In all kinds of advertisements, especially those we can watch on television, the products are presented like incredible objects that can satisfy any of our requests! 

There are a lot of workers employed in these organized machines having the purpose of selling the largest quantities of a certain kind of products. Obviously, I think that the production companies couldn't sell a very different product from what we can see on television or in newspapers, because people would not buy again a bad product. 

I think that advertisers are concerned to show a thing in its better face, trying to emphasize some qualities and trying to hide the lack of points of a product. They often provide examples of satisfied consumers who are enjoying being

In my opinion, it is better to have broad knowledge of many academic subjects for a number of reasons. First, to know about many kinds of things is a great influence for the future. When you get a job, you will not do the same kind of work for your whole life. My father, a priest, also keeps a kindergarten. He knows about children because his major was teaching in college. After he graduated from college, he went to another college and studied about religion. He talks to many people and has good activities and hobbies.
